files.name: NEXUS-AI-ACADEMY-BRIEF.md
files.content:
# Nexus AI Academy ‚Äî Project Brief

## What It Is

Nexus AI Academy is a full-featured Learning Management System (LMS) built primarily for the French-speaking market. It's a web application where users can browse, enroll in, and complete online courses with rich multimedia content, progress tracking, quizzes, certificates, and AI-powered tutoring.

**Live tech stack**: Next.js 15, TypeScript, Prisma ORM, SQLite/PostgreSQL, NextAuth v5, Tailwind CSS, Stripe payments, OpenAI integration.

**Languages**: French (primary), English, German, Spanish ‚Äî full i18n support.

## What Makes It Special: AI-Powered Course Creation

The core differentiator of this platform is that **administrators don't manually create courses**. Instead:

1. An admin provides high-level course information (topic, target audience, desired structure)
2. AI agents automatically generate the full course structure ‚Äî modules, lessons, content sections, quizzes, case studies, and exercises
3. The system creates all the structured content needed for a world-class tutorial experience
4. The generated course is uploaded and published to the platform, ready for students

This means the platform can scale course creation dramatically without requiring subject matter experts to manually author every lesson, section, and quiz. The AI handles the heavy lifting of content structuring and generation.

### Course Import Pipelines

The system supports multiple ways to get courses into the platform:

- **HTML Import**: Upload structured HTML files that get parsed into courses, modules, and lessons with content blocks
- **Airtable Integration**: Sync course data from Airtable bases, including structured lessons with sections, video prompts, case studies, and exercise projects
- **Unified Bulk Import**: Import multiple courses at once through a single interface
- **Structured Lesson System**: A rich content model that goes beyond basic lessons ‚Äî each lesson can have typed sections (Introduction, Concept, Example, Practice, etc.), visual elements, interactive components, video production specs, case studies, and step-by-step exercise projects

## Platform Features

### For Students
- Browse and search a course catalog
- Enroll in courses (free or paid via Stripe)
- Learn through rich multimedia lessons (HTML, video, audio, code, interactive content)
- Track progress at the lesson, module, and course level
- Take quizzes and assessments
- Download course resources
- Chat with AI-powered course assistants (each course can have its own AI tutor)
- Book 1-on-1 sessions with human instructors
- Earn certificates upon course completion

### For Instructors
- Create and manage their own courses
- Import course content from HTML files
- Set availability for 1-on-1 booking sessions
- Configure session types and pricing
- View student enrollments and progress

### For Administrators
- Full user management (roles: Student, Instructor, Admin)
- Course approval and moderation system
- Bulk course import interface
- AI-powered course generation
- Analytics dashboard
- Content moderation tools
- Coupon and promotion management
- Email campaign system

## How the Course Structure Works

```
Course
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Module 1
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Lesson 1
‚îÇ   ‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Content Block (HTML text)
‚îÇ   ‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Content Block (Video)
‚îÇ   ‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Content Block (Quiz)
‚îÇ   ‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Content Block (Code example)
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Lesson 2
‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Assessment (Module quiz)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ Module 2
‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ ...
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ AI Instructor (chatbot tutor for this course)
```

Each lesson can also have a **Structured Lesson** record that provides:
- Typed sections (Introduction, Concept, Demonstration, Practice, Conclusion)
- Visual element specifications (images, diagrams, animations)
- Interactive elements (quizzes, reflection prompts, code editors)
- Video production prompts (scene descriptions, graphics specs, B-roll suggestions)
- Case studies with background, challenge, solution, and results
- Exercise projects broken into guided steps

## Payment & Business Model

- Stripe integration for course purchases (EUR currency, French VAT compliance)
- Support for coupons, promotions, and time-limited discounts
- Course packages/bundles
- Instructor session booking with configurable pricing
- Subscription tiers (Free, Premium, Enterprise)

## Authentication & Access Control

- Email/password registration with email verification
- OAuth via Google and GitHub
- Role-based access (Student, Instructor, Admin)
- Course enrollment verification ‚Äî students must be enrolled to access learning content
- Profile completion enforcement after registration
- Protected admin routes with role checks

## Real-Time & AI Features

- **AI Course Assistants**: Each course can have an AI instructor powered by OpenAI that students can chat with for help
- **Firebase Chat**: Real-time messaging infrastructure
- **Pusher**: Real-time event broadcasting

## Current State

The platform is functional with:
- Complete auth system with three test user roles
- Course browsing, enrollment, and learning interface
- Course import from HTML and Airtable
- Progress tracking
- Payment integration
- Booking system for instructor sessions
- Admin dashboard
- i18n support for 4 languages

The main area of active development is the AI-powered course generation pipeline ‚Äî making it seamless for admins to go from a course idea to a fully structured, published course with minimal manual effort.

files.name: PULSE-ARCHITECTS-BRIEF.md
files.content:
# ALEX BRIEFING ‚Äî Pulse Architects

This document is the comprehensive briefing for Alex, the AI assistant working on the Pulse Architects project. It contains everything you need to know about the business, brand, platform, and product offering.

---

## 1. COMPANY OVERVIEW

**Company Name:** Pulse Architects
**Domain:** pulse-architects.com
**Location:** 3 Avenue Jacques Prevert, 77200 Torcy, France
**Phone:** +33 6 12 77 64 98
**Email:** chicco007@PulseArchitects.com
**Social:** Twitter, Facebook, Instagram, LinkedIn (@pulse_architects)

**What we do:** Pulse Architects is a digital marketplace and one-stop shop for premium, ready-made architectural plans covering every type of building ‚Äî from single-family homes and luxury villas to 10-story commercial buildings, palaces, apartment complexes, office spaces, and full site developments. Customers purchase plans digitally, download them instantly, and get everything they need to begin construction.

**Experience:** 25+ years in the architectural industry.
**Team:** 50+ licensed architects on staff.
**Catalog size:** 5,000+ architectural plans.
**Awards:** 100+ design awards won.
**Customer satisfaction:** 4.9/5 from 10,000+ customers.

---

## 2. VISION & MISSION

**Vision:** To be the world's most comprehensive and trusted digital source for premium architectural plans, making professional-grade building designs accessible to anyone ‚Äî homeowner, developer, or builder ‚Äî anywhere in the world.

**Mission:** Transforming visions into architectural reality through innovative design and meticulous attention to detail. We combine cutting-edge design with practical functionality to create blueprints that inspire and endure. Every plan is meticulously designed by licensed architects who understand the importance of both form and function.

**Core promise:** "We're committed to helping builders, developers, and homeowners bring their vision to life with confidence."

---

## 3. COMPANY VALUES

1. **Architectural Excellence** ‚Äî Every plan is crafted by licensed architects with decades of experience in residential and commercial design.
2. **Client-Centered Design** ‚Äî We prioritize lifestyle needs, creating spaces that enhance how people live, work, and connect.
3. **Award-Winning Quality** ‚Äî Designs recognized with multiple architectural awards and featured in leading publications.
4. **Innovation & Sustainability** ‚Äî Forward-thinking designs incorporating sustainable building practices and smart home technology.

---

## 4. TARGET AUDIENCE

- **Homeowners** building custom homes or renovating
- **Property developers** working on residential and commercial projects
- **Builders and contractors** who need professional-grade plans
- **Architects** seeking plan templates as starting points
- **Real estate professionals** developing land and properties
- **Government/institutional** clients needing schools, healthcare, government buildings

---

## 5. PRODUCT OFFERING

### What customers buy
Complete, ready-made architectural plan packages. Each package is a comprehensive documentation set that includes everything needed for construction and building permit applications.

### What's included in every plan package
- Detailed floor plans and elevations
- Roof plans
- Foundation plans
- Structural drawings and specifications
- Electrical layouts
- Plumbing plans
- Section drawings
- Construction details
- Material specifications
- 3D renders and visualizations (exterior and interior)
- Building views from all angles
- Building permit-ready documents
- Multiple file formats: PDF, DWG (AutoCAD), RVT (Revit)

### Plan categories and catalog depth
| Category | Plan Count | Subcategories |
|---|---|---|
| Residential Plans | 2,845 | Single Family, Multi-Family, Tiny Homes, Luxury Estates |
| Commercial Buildings | 1,256 | Office Buildings, Retail, Restaurants, Hotels |
| Sustainable Design | 891 | Net Zero, Passive House, LEED, Green Roofs |
| Institutional | 678 | Schools, Healthcare, Government, Religious |
| Historic & Traditional | 423 | Victorian, Colonial, Craftsman, Art Deco |
| Waterfront & Coastal | 334 | Beach Houses, Lake Homes, Marina, Flood Resistant |

### License types
| License | Description |
|---|---|
| PREVIEW | Free preview download |
| STANDARD | Single-use license for one construction project |
| COMMERCIAL | Commercial construction rights |
| EXTENDED | Extended rights with higher download limits |

### Plan card attributes
Each plan displays: title, description, price, number of bedrooms, number of bathrooms, total area (sq ft).

---

## 6. SERVICES

### Core services
1. **Architectural Plans** ‚Äî Premium ready-made plans for residential and commercial projects. Code-compliant, multi-format.
2. **3D Renders & Visualizations** ‚Äî Photorealistic exterior renders, interior walkthroughs, material/lighting studies, VR presentations.
3. **Building Permits & Certificates** ‚Äî Permit applications, zoning compliance, environmental impact assessments, fire/safety certifications.

### Additional services
- **Consultation Services** ‚Äî Expert architectural consultation for custom projects and modifications.
- **Custom Modifications** ‚Äî Team can modify existing plans or create completely custom designs. Standard mods take 2-3 weeks; fully custom designs take 6-12 weeks.
- **Sustainable Design** ‚Äî Green building certifications and sustainable architecture solutions.
- **Design Awards Program** ‚Äî Submit projects for architectural design awards.
- **Digital Asset Library** ‚Äî Extensive library of architectural components and materials.
- **Fast-Track Services** ‚Äî Expedited design and delivery for time-sensitive projects.
- **Construction Support** ‚Äî Contractor selection, document review, site visits, quality control inspections.

### Service process (4 steps)
1. **Consultation** ‚Äî Understand requirements and vision.
2. **Design** ‚Äî Create detailed plans and specifications.
3. **Review** ‚Äî Collaborate on revisions until perfect.
4. **Delivery** ‚Äî Final delivery of all files, permits, and documentation.

---

## 7. KEY SELLING POINTS

These are the six pillars used across marketing:

1. **Professional Quality** ‚Äî All plans created by licensed architects, compliant with international building codes and safety standards.
2. **Instant Download** ‚Äî Plans delivered immediately after purchase with secure digital delivery and lifetime access to updates.
3. **Complete Documentation** ‚Äî Floor plans, elevations, sections, construction details, and material specs all included.
4. **Expert Support** ‚Äî 24/7 customer support and consultation with experienced architects.
5. **Award-Winning Designs** ‚Äî Multiple architectural awards, featured in leading design publications.
6. **Fast Delivery** ‚Äî Most plans delivered within minutes; custom mods available within 48 hours.

---

## 8. BRAND VOICE & MESSAGING

### Tone
Professional, confident, aspirational. The brand speaks with authority (25+ years, licensed architects, awards) while remaining approachable and client-focused.

### Key taglines and phrases
- "Premium Architectural Plans"
- "Design Your Dream"
- "Transforming visions into reality"
- "Crafting architectural excellence"
- "Where architectural mastery meets unparalleled elegance"
- "Enter a realm where exquisite design and timeless luxury comes together"
- "Ready to Start Building?"
- "Ready to build your dream home?"
- "Transform your vision into reality"

### Marketing scroll strip messages
- "Browse thousands of premium architectural plans at exceptional prices"
- "Get a free architectural consultation"
- "Custom design your dream home"
- "Award-winning designs by licensed architects"
- "Instant download with lifetime access"
- "Professional quality guaranteed"

---

## 9. LEADERSHIP TEAM

| Name | Role | Credentials |
|---|---|---|
| Sarah Johnson | Principal Architect | AIA Licensed, 20+ years experience |
| Michael Chen | Design Director | NCARB Certified, 18+ years experience |
| Emily Rodriguez | Sustainable Design Lead | LEED AP, 15+ years experience |

---

## 10. SOCIAL PROOF & TESTIMONIALS

**Customer rating:** 4.9/5 from 10,000+ satisfied customers.

**Testimonial 1 ‚Äî Emily & John Smith (Homeowners):**
Found their perfect architectural design. Plans were detailed, layouts accurate, process seamless. Design team answered all questions professionally.

**Testimonial 2 ‚Äî Sam & Mickay John (Property Developers):**
Delivered their dream home design. Plans thorough, 3D visualizations spot-on, entire process smooth. Outstanding customer service addressing all requirements with expertise.

---

## 11. PLATFORM & TECHNOLOGY

### Tech stack
- Next.js 15.5 (App Router) / React 19 / TypeScript
- Tailwind CSS with Homely design system
- Prisma ORM (SQLite dev, PostgreSQL production)
- NextAuth v5 (Google OAuth + credentials)
- Stripe payments
- Cloudinary for image/file hosting
- Resend for transactional emails
- next-intl for i18n (English + French)
- Zustand for cart state management
- Framer Motion for animations
- Vercel for hosting

### User roles
| Role | Access |
|---|---|
| CUSTOMER | Browse, purchase, download plans, manage orders |
| ARCHITECT | Upload and manage plan content |
| ADMIN | Content management, analytics, user management |
| SUPER_ADMIN | Full system access |

### E-commerce flow
1. Customer browses catalog (filterable by category, specs, price)
2. Adds plans to cart (Zustand store, persisted to localStorage)
3. Checkout: enters details, selects payment (Card or PayPal via Stripe)
4. Order confirmed, license key generated
5. Instant digital delivery with secure download links
6. Download tracking and email confirmation sent

### Dashboard capabilities (Admin)
- Analytics: total users, images uploaded, downloads today, total downloads
- Track downloads by license type
- Image status management (Approved, Pending, Rejected)
- Content upload and moderation
- Site settings configuration

### Design system
- **Font:** Bricolage Grotesque
- **Colors:** Primary green #07be8a, Sky blue #79adff, Light sky blue #9cc2dd, Dark #172023
- **Dark mode:** Class-based toggle, default light
- **Template reference:** Homely NextJS Tailwind v1 (must be used for all new sections)

---

## 12. CONTENT AREAS

### Website pages
| Page | Purpose |
|---|---|
| Homepage | Hero, features, testimonials, CTAs, luxury showcase |
| About | Mission, stats, team, values, FAQ |
| Services | Core + additional services, process steps |
| Catalog | Browsable plan marketplace with filters |
| Gallery | Portfolio showcase (50K+ views, 2K+ downloads, 5K+ likes) |
| Blog | Architectural insights, trends, sustainability, technology |
| Contact | Form, phone, email, address |
| Auth | Login, register, email verification |
| Dashboard | User orders, admin analytics/content management |
| Checkout | Multi-step purchase flow |

### Blog topics covered
- Modern architecture trends
- Sustainable design principles
- Smart home integration
- Property market insights

### Gallery categories
- All Projects, Architectural Plans, Residential, Commercial, Luxury

---

## 13. FAQ REFERENCE

**Q: Can plans be customized?**
A: Yes. All plans can be customized for specific needs, site requirements, and design preferences. Licensed architects modify existing plans or create fully custom designs.

**Q: What's included in architectural plans?**
A: Floor plans, elevations, sections, construction details, structural drawings, electrical layouts, plumbing plans, material specifications, 3D visualizations, and building permit-ready documents.

**Q: How long does custom design take?**
A: Standard modifications: 2-3 weeks. Fully custom designs: 6-12 weeks depending on complexity. Detailed timelines provided during initial consultation.

**Q: Is construction support available?**
A: Yes. Contractor selection assistance, construction document review, site visits, and quality control inspections are offered.

---

## 14. COMPETITIVE POSITIONING

Pulse Architects positions itself as a **premium, comprehensive, professional-grade** alternative in the architectural plans market. The differentiators are:

- **Breadth:** Plans for literally any building type ‚Äî homes, villas, apartments, commercial, institutional, palaces, site developments
- **Completeness:** Every package includes everything (plans, renders, permits docs, multiple formats)
- **Credibility:** Licensed architects, 25+ years, 100+ awards, code-compliant
- **Convenience:** Instant digital delivery, lifetime updates, 24/7 support
- **Flexibility:** Ready-made plans + custom modification services + fully custom design

The platform is a **one-stop shop** for anyone involved in construction ‚Äî from a first-time homeowner to a large-scale real estate developer.

---

*This briefing is excluded from version control. Last updated: February 2026.*

## 4. The Design Shop (Digital Products)

The website has an online shop selling premium digital design resources. These are passive income products that clients can buy without a consultation.

| Pitch Deck Pro | 35 EUR | Presentation Templates | 40 slides, PPT & Keynote. **BESTSELLER** |
| Business Card Collection | 19 EUR | Print Templates | 20 designs, print-ready 300 DPI, CMYK |
| Dashboard UI Kit | 79 EUR (was 120) | UI Kits | 100+ components, dark/light mode, Figma. **NEW** |
| Device Mockup Bundle | 39 EUR | Mockups | 50 scenes, smart objects, 4K resolution |
| Essential Icon Set | 29 EUR | Icon Packs | 500+ icons, 3 styles, SVG/PNG/font. **NEW** |

**Price range:** 19 EUR to 79 EUR
**All products include commercial license.**

---

## 5. Portfolio Highlights (Case Studies to Reference)

Use these when pitching to demonstrate credibility and results:

### Zenith Capital Partners - Brand Identity
- Investment firm rebrand
- **Result:** Client acquisition increased 40% in 6 months
- Won them 2 major institutional partnerships

### NovaTech Solutions - Website
- B2B SaaS company site redesign
- **Result:** Demo requests up 280%, bounce rate dropped from 70% to 35%, 98 Lighthouse performance score

### Flora Luxe Cosmetics - Logo Design
- Premium organic cosmetics logo
- **Result:** Featured in Packaging of the World, secured shelf space in 150+ pharmacies in France, 78% brand recall

### Eco Collective - Full Brand Creation
- Sustainable fashion startup, from naming to website
- **Result:** Featured in Vogue France and Elle, Kickstarter raised 350% of goal

### Solaris Energy - Pitch Deck
- Investor pitch deck for renewable energy startup
- **Result:** Closed a 4.2M EUR Series A round. Investors cited the deck quality as a factor.

### UrbanFit Athletics - Social Media
- Fitness apparel social media design system
- **Result:** Instagram engagement from 1.2% to 5.8% in 3 months, gained 45,000 followers

### Maison Rouge Vineyards - Packaging
- Premium wine label redesign
- **Result:** 55% increase in international sales, Silver Medal at International Wine Label Design Awards

### Azure Dreams Travel - Website
- Luxury travel agency website
- **Result:** Online bookings up 190%, average booking value up 35%, won CSS Design Award for Best UX

---

## 6. Our Process (4 Steps)

When explaining how we work to prospects:

1. **Discovery** - We learn about the client's business, goals, audience, and competition
2. **Design** - We create concepts and present them for feedback
3. **Refine** - We iterate based on client feedback until it's perfect
4. **Deliver** - We hand over production-ready files with all formats needed

---

## 7. Target Clients

### Primary Targets
- **Startups** looking for brand identity, logos, and websites to launch
- **SMBs/SMEs** needing professional design to compete with bigger brands
- **Tech companies** (SaaS, AI, fintech) needing websites and pitch decks
- **Luxury/premium brands** (cosmetics, fashion, wine, hospitality)
- **Restaurants & food businesses** needing menus, packaging, social content

### Secondary Targets
- **Agencies** that need white-label design support
- **Freelancers** buying shop products (templates, kits, icons)
- **E-commerce brands** needing packaging and product photography
- **Event companies** needing materials (booths, banners, badges)
- **Consultants/coaches** needing pitch decks and LinkedIn content

### Geographic Focus
- Primary: France (Ile-de-France, Paris region)
- Secondary: Europe-wide (we work in EN and FR)
- Tertiary: International (15+ countries served)

---

## 8. Competitive Advantages (Talking Points)

When pitching Pulse Graphix, emphasize these:

1. **21+ years of experience** - Chicco has been in tech and design for over two decades
2. **Bilingual (EN/FR)** - We serve both French and international clients seamlessly
3. **Full-service** - Logo to website to social media to print, all under one roof. Clients don't need 5 different vendors.
4. **Results-driven** - Every case study includes measurable business results (not just pretty pictures)
5. **Modern tech stack** - Next.js, Tailwind CSS, Framer Motion. Websites we build are fast and future-proof
6. **98% client satisfaction** - Track record speaks for itself
7. **Premium website** - Our own site is beautifully designed with animated shader backgrounds, motion effects, and a polished UI (it's a showcase of what we can do)
8. **Digital shop** - Passive income channel selling templates and design resources

---

## 9. How to Book a Client

1. Direct them to the website: https://pulsegraphix.net
2. They can browse services, view portfolio case studies, and see pricing
3. Book a free consultation via Calendly: https://calendly.com/pulsegraphix
4. Or email directly: chicco@pulsegraphix.net
5. Phone: +33 6 12 77 64 98

---

## 10. Pricing Quick Reference

| Service | Starter | Professional | Enterprise |
|---------|---------|-------------|------------|
| Logo Design | 497 | 997 | 2,497 |
| Website | 1,497 | 2,997 | 5,997 |
| Branding | 997 | 2,497 | 4,997 |
| Print Design | 297 | 697 | 1,497 |
| Merch Design | 197 | 497 | 1,497 |
| Motion Graphics | 497 | 1,497 | 3,997 |
| Infographics | 297 | 697 | 1,497 |
| Social Media | 297 | 797 | 1,997/mo |
| Presentations | 297 | 697 | 1,497 |

*All prices in EUR.*

---

## 11. Brand Voice Guidelines

When communicating on behalf of Pulse Graphix, the tone should be:

- **Bold** - We're confident in what we deliver
- **Approachable** - Not stiff or corporate, we're human
- **Professional** - We know our craft and our numbers prove it
- **Innovative** - We use cutting-edge tools and techniques
- **Results-focused** - Always tie back to business outcomes, not just aesthetics

**Avoid:** Generic design jargon, overpromising, being pushy, discounting aggressively.

**Brand colors:** Neon Green (#00FF00) on Black (#0D0D0D). Clean, bold, modern.

---

## 12. FAQ for Prospects

**"Why should I choose Pulse Graphix over a freelancer on Fiverr?"**
We deliver strategic design backed by 21 years of experience and measurable business results. Our case studies show 40-280% improvements in key metrics. A cheap logo is just a drawing; we build brands.

**"Can you do just one service, or do I need a full package?"**
Each service is standalone. You can start with a logo and come back for a website later. But bundled projects get better consistency and often better value.

**"Do you work with clients outside of France?"**
Yes. We serve 15+ countries. The website is fully bilingual (EN/FR). Remote collaboration works seamlessly.

**"What's included in the free consultation?"**
A 30-minute call to understand the project, discuss goals, review timeline and budget, and recommend the right service tier. No commitment required.

**"Do you offer payment plans?"**
For larger projects (Professional and Enterprise tiers), we typically work with 50% upfront and 50% on delivery. Custom arrangements can be discussed.

---

*This document contains everything you need to effectively represent Pulse Graphix. If a prospect asks something not covered here, loop in Chicco directly.*

# üéØ Pulse Graphix ‚Äî Animated Template Business Strategy
*Extracted from AI Template Blueprint Analysis | Feb 13, 2026*
*Source: Video transcript analysis ‚Äî AI-powered template creation workflow*

---

## üìä MARKET OPPORTUNITY

### The Template Economy
| Metric | Value |
|--------|-------|
| **Price per template** | $50 - $100 USD |
| **Income per template (lifetime)** | $5,000 - $20,000 |
| **Top creators (annual)** | $100,000 - $300,000 |
| **Production time (traditional)** | ~2 weeks per template |
| **Production time (AI-powered)** | 30 min - few hours |
| **Speed increase** | 10x - 50x faster |

### Platforms to Sell Templates
| Platform | Commission | Notes |
|----------|-----------|-------|
| **Framer** | 0% (100% earnings) | Hot market, growing fast |
| **Webflow** | 5% (since Oct 2025) | Established, large user base |
| **Aura** | Coming soon | 65k users, marketplace launching |
| **Figma Community** | Free | Exposure, leads to paid work |
| **UI8** | ~30% | Premium marketplace |
| **ThemeForest** | 12.5-37.5% | WordPress/HTML templates |
| **Gumroad/Lemonsqueezy** | ~5% | Self-hosted sales |

---

## üõ†Ô∏è TOOLS & RESOURCES EXTRACTED

### AI Design Tools
| Tool | Purpose | URL | Cost |
|------|---------|-----|------|
| **Aura** | AI website/template builder | aura.build | $20/mo Pro |
| **Gemini 3** | Best AI for UI generation | ai.google.dev | Free/Paid |
| **Nano Banana Pro** | AI image gen, 3D mockups, product shots | Google DeepMind | Free/Paid |
| **GPT 5.1** | Fast AI for small edits | openai.com | Paid |

### Design Enhancement Tools
| Tool | Purpose | URL |
|------|---------|-----|
| **Unicorn Studio** | WebGL animations/backgrounds (no-code) | unicorn.studio |
| **Iconify** | 200k+ open-source icons (one-line JS) | iconify.design |
| **Solar Icons** | Premium icon set (outline, broken, duotone) | Part of Iconify |
| **Simple Icons** | Brand logos (SVG, monotone) | simpleicons.org |
| **Screen Studio** | Mac screen recorder (premium) | screen.studio |

### Inspiration Resources
| Resource | Purpose | URL |
|----------|---------|-----|
| **Superhero** | Hero section inspiration | superhero.so |
| **Bento Grids** | Card/bento layout examples | bentogrids.com |
| **Mobin** | Full website sections & animations | mobin.io |
| **Dribbble** | Design inspiration (features, layouts) | dribbble.com |
| **H1 Gallery** | Headlines & hooks inspiration | h1.gallery |
| **CTA Gallery** | Call-to-action section examples | cta.gallery |

### Typography (Google Fonts ‚Äî Free)
| Font | Style | Use Case |
|------|-------|----------|
| **Newsreader** | Serif + beautiful italic | Headlines, editorial |
| **Inter** | Sans-serif (most popular worldwide) | Body, clean UI |
| **Playfair Display** | Serif, elegant | Headlines, luxury |
| *Tip:* Pair serif + sans-serif for premium feel |

---

## üé® KEY ANIMATION TECHNIQUES

### Prompt Arsenal (for AI template generation)
```
1. "Create a hero section" ‚Äî Start here, spend 50% of time
2. "Add beam animation" ‚Äî 1px continuously around button shape
3. "Add marquee animation" ‚Äî For logos, scrolling elements
4. "Add noodles to connect with circle" ‚Äî Decorative lines
5. "Beam animate the noodles" ‚Äî Animated connecting lines
6. "Add vertical container size lines" ‚Äî Grid detail lines
7. "Use 01, 02, 03 steps" ‚Äî Numbered sections detail
8. "Fade in, blur in, slide in animation" ‚Äî Section transitions
9. "Add sticky element + steps" ‚Äî Scroll storytelling
10. "Change to [color], dark/light mode" ‚Äî Quick theme changes
11. "Adapt new section" ‚Äî Reference screenshot to generate
12. "Use Iconify Solar / Simple Icons" ‚Äî Professional icon sets
```

### Animation Types to Master
- **Beam animations** ‚Äî Light effect around buttons/elements
- **Marquee animations** ‚Äî Logo scrollers, text tickers
- **Circle/sonar animations** ‚Äî Pulsing elements
- **Scroll-triggered** ‚Äî Text completion, sticky elements
- **Hover effects** ‚Äî Button glow, card lift
- **WebGL backgrounds** ‚Äî Via Unicorn Studio

---

## üí° BUSINESS IDEAS FOR PULSE GRAPHIX

### Idea 1: Template Store (Passive Income) ‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê
**Revenue potential:** ‚Ç¨5,000 - ‚Ç¨25,000/month

**Strategy:**
1. Create 5-10 premium animated landing page templates
2. Sell on Framer (100% earnings) + Webflow (95% earnings)
3. Price: ‚Ç¨49-‚Ç¨99 per template
4. Target niches: SaaS, Restaurant, Agency, Portfolio, E-commerce
5. Use AI (Gemini 3 / Claude) to produce at 10x speed

**Why Pulse Graphix wins:**
- Kabundji has 21 years design experience = taste advantage
- Already has branding skills for premium aesthetics
- Can create French + English versions (wider market)
- AI-powered production = faster than competitors

### Idea 2: "Website-in-a-Day" Premium Service ‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê
**Revenue potential:** ‚Ç¨2,000 - ‚Ç¨5,000 per project

**Strategy:**
1. Use AI to generate stunning landing pages in hours
2. Add Unicorn Studio backgrounds + custom animations
3. Deliver in 24-48h what used to take 2 weeks
4. Premium positioning: "Agency-quality at freelancer prices"
5. Target: SMBs in Paris + remote clients

### Idea 3: Template Remix Service ‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê
**Revenue potential:** ‚Ç¨500 - ‚Ç¨1,500 per remix

**Strategy:**
1. Take existing templates, customize for specific businesses
2. Change language (FR/EN), colors, branding, content
3. Deploy on client's hosting
4. Quick turnaround (same-day possible with AI)
5. Perfect for the Torcy boulangerie prospects!

### Idea 4: Design Course / YouTube Channel ‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê
**Revenue potential:** ‚Ç¨1,000 - ‚Ç¨5,000/month (long term)

**Strategy:**
1. Document template creation process on YouTube
2. Share tips, prompts, and techniques in French market
3. Very few French creators doing this = blue ocean
4. Monetize via ads, affiliate links, template sales

### Idea 5: White-Label Template Agency ‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê
**Revenue potential:** ‚Ç¨3,000 - ‚Ç¨10,000/month

**Strategy:**
1. Create templates for other agencies to resell
2. Bulk pricing: 10 templates = ‚Ç¨2,000
3. Agencies add their branding and sell to end clients
4. Recurring revenue from template updates

---

## üîß SKILLS & TOOLS FOR CLAUDE CODE / OPENCLAW

### Already Available (Installed)
| Skill | Purpose |
|-------|---------|
| ‚úÖ **frontend-design** | Expert UI/landing page generation |
| ‚úÖ **designer** | Logo, visual systems, branding |
| ‚úÖ **shadcn-ui** | Component library integration |
| ‚úÖ **color-palette** | WCAG-compliant color systems |
| ‚úÖ **happy-hues** | Curated palettes for design |
| ‚úÖ **openai-image-gen** | AI image generation for assets |

### Can Be Built / Added
| Skill Needed | Purpose | Priority |
|-------------|---------|----------|
| üî® **template-generator** | Automated landing page creation from prompts | HIGH |
| üî® **animation-library** | CSS animation presets (beam, marquee, fade) | HIGH |
| üî® **icon-integration** | Iconify/Solar icon embedding | MEDIUM |
| üî® **template-publisher** | Auto-deploy to Framer/Webflow | MEDIUM |
| üî® **screenshot-to-html** | Reference image ‚Üí code conversion | LOW (Gemini better) |

### AI Model Recommendations for Templates
| Task | Best Model | Why |
|------|-----------|-----|
| UI Generation | **Gemini 3** | Best at visual design/HTML |
| Code Editing | **Claude Opus 4.5** | Best at code quality |
| Fast Small Edits | **GPT 5.1** | Fastest response time |
| Image Assets | **Nano Banana Pro** | Best for mockups, 3D |

---

## üìÖ ACTION PLAN

### Phase 1: Foundation (Week 1-2)
- [ ] Set up Aura account ($20/mo) ‚Äî explore templates
- [ ] Set up Unicorn Studio account ‚Äî learn WebGL backgrounds
- [ ] Bookmark all inspiration resources (Superhero, Mobin, etc.)
- [ ] Create first 3 landing page templates using AI
- [ ] Build CSS animation library (beam, marquee, fade, scroll)

### Phase 2: Portfolio (Week 3-4)
- [ ] Create 5 premium templates for different niches
- [ ] Add Unicorn Studio backgrounds to hero sections
- [ ] Set up Framer Creator account
- [ ] Set up Webflow Template marketplace account
- [ ] Deploy templates for review

### Phase 3: Launch (Month 2)
- [ ] List first 5 templates on Framer ($79-$99 each)
- [ ] List on Webflow marketplace
- [ ] Create social media covers (the Aura canvas technique)
- [ ] Start posting on Twitter/Instagram (1 template showcase/week)
- [ ] LinkedIn posts about the AI design workflow

### Phase 4: Scale (Month 3+)
- [ ] Produce 5-10 templates per week using AI
- [ ] Build email list from free template downloads
- [ ] Create YouTube tutorials (French market ‚Äî blue ocean!)
- [ ] Offer "Website-in-a-Day" premium service
- [ ] Train Alex Prime to auto-generate template starting points

---

## üîë KEY INSIGHTS (Most Important)

1. **50% of time should go to the hero section** ‚Äî it's the cover image that drives social media engagement
2. **Screenshots > prompts** ‚Äî Taking a screenshot of inspiration and feeding it to AI is faster than writing 1000 words
3. **Negative prompts matter** ‚Äî "Don't change anything else" prevents AI from breaking existing sections
4. **Edit mode vs Generate mode** ‚Äî Use edit mode for small changes, generate mode for new sections
5. **Icon sets differentiate** ‚Äî Using Solar/custom icons instead of default Lucide avoids "AI slop" look
6. **Font pairing is crucial** ‚Äî Serif + Sans-serif (e.g., Newsreader + Inter) = premium feel
7. **Color alternation** ‚Äî Don't make entire page one color, alternate backgrounds
8. **Framer = 100% earnings** ‚Äî Best marketplace for template income
9. **French market is UNDERSERVED** ‚Äî Very few French AI template creators
10. **Templates can be localized** ‚Äî AI can translate/adapt to any language instantly

---

## üí∞ REVENUE PROJECTIONS

### Conservative Estimate (6 months)
| Stream | Monthly Revenue |
|--------|----------------|
| Template sales (10 templates √ó 5 sales/mo √ó ‚Ç¨79) | ‚Ç¨3,950 |
| Client work (2 projects √ó ‚Ç¨1,500) | ‚Ç¨3,000 |
| Template remixes (4 √ó ‚Ç¨800) | ‚Ç¨3,200 |
| **TOTAL** | **‚Ç¨10,150/mo** |

### Optimistic Estimate (12 months)
| Stream | Monthly Revenue |
|--------|----------------|
| Template sales (30 templates √ó 10 sales/mo √ó ‚Ç¨79) | ‚Ç¨23,700 |
| Client work (3 projects √ó ‚Ç¨2,500) | ‚Ç¨7,500 |
| YouTube/Course revenue | ‚Ç¨2,000 |
| **TOTAL** | **‚Ç¨33,200/mo** |

---

*This document is the strategic foundation for Pulse Graphix's template business.*
*Created by Alex Prime | Feb 13, 2026*

# Agent Zero (A0) ‚Äî Analysis & Comparison
## What It Is, What We Can Learn, How It Compares to OpenClaw

**Researched:** February 14, 2026  
**By:** Alex Prime  
**Sources:** agent-zero.ai, GitHub (agent0ai/agent-zero), project paper  
**Purpose:** Reference document for improving our agent architecture

---

## 1. What Is Agent Zero?

Agent Zero is an **open-source autonomous AI agent framework** created by Jan Tom√°≈°ek (March 2024). It runs inside a **self-contained Docker Linux environment** ‚Äî essentially an AI with its own virtual computer.

**Website:** https://www.agent-zero.ai  
**GitHub:** https://github.com/agent0ai/agent-zero  
**License:** Open source  
**Mentioned in:** Linux Foundation's Decentralization and AI paper

### Core Philosophy
> "A personal, organic agentic framework that grows and learns with you"

Not a pre-programmed chatbot ‚Äî it's designed to be **dynamic, self-learning, and self-improving**. The AI can create its own tools, install its own software, and adapt to new tasks without being explicitly programmed for them.

---

```
‚îÇ  ‚îÇ  ‚îÇ Web UI (Port 50001)    ‚îÇ  ‚îÇ  ‚îÇ
‚îÇ  ‚îÇ  ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îò  ‚îÇ  ‚îÇ
‚îÇ  ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îò  ‚îÇ
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îò
```

### Key Components

| Component | Description |
|-----------|-------------|
| **Docker Container** | Full Linux environment, isolated from host |
| **LLM Integration** | OpenAI, Anthropic, Grok, OpenRouter, GitHub Copilot, Ollama (local) |
| **FAISS Vector Memory** | Hybrid memory with categories: facts, solutions, instruments |
| **SearXNG** | Self-hosted, privacy-respecting search engine |
| **Browser** | Integrated browser via browser-use (like OpenAI Operator) |
| **Web UI** | Clean, real-time streaming interface on port 50001 |
| **Code Execution** | Python, Node.js, Bash ‚Äî anything installable |
| **Speech** | TTS + STT (local Whisper model) |

---

## 3. Key Features & Strengths

### üü¢ Strengths (What Agent Zero Does Well)

**1. Full OS Access**
- Runs inside its own Linux OS (Docker)
- Can install packages, run scripts, manage files
- Complete isolation from host = safe experimentation
- Standardized environment that works the same everywhere

**2. Self-Creating Tools**
- No pre-programmed tool limitations
- Agent writes its own tools on the fly
- Stores successful tools in memory for reuse ("Instruments")
- This is a massive differentiator

**3. Hybrid Memory System (FAISS)**
- Vector-based semantic search (not just keyword)
- Memory categories:
  - **Main memories** ‚Äî core facts and instructions
  - **Conversation fragments** ‚Äî relevant past conversations
  - **Proven solutions** ‚Äî code/approaches that worked before
  - **Custom instruments** ‚Äî tools the agent created
- Dynamic context compression ‚Äî keeps conversations coherent even when long
- Memory Dashboard ‚Äî UI to browse, search, edit, delete memories

**4. Multi-Agent Cooperation**
- Hierarchical: every agent has a superior (human or another agent)
- Agents spawn subordinates for subtasks
- Each subordinate reports back to its superior
- Keeps each agent's context clean and focused
- Similar to our Subagent Pyramid but built-in

**5. Fully Customizable**
- Nothing is hard-coded
- All behavior defined by system prompts in `prompts/` folder
- All tools in `python/tools/` ‚Äî modifiable or replaceable
- Extensions system (Python) for deep behavior hooks
- The framework doesn't constrain the agent at all

**6. Skills System (SKILL.md Standard)**
- Uses the same SKILL.md standard as Claude Code, Cursor, Codex
- Portable, structured agent capabilities
- Compatible across platforms

**7. Project Isolation**
- Separate projects with dedicated agents, memory, and credentials
- Prevents context bleed across different work
- Great for multi-client agencies like Pulse Graphix

**8. A2A Protocol**
- Agent-to-Agent communication
- Multiple Agent Zero instances can collaborate
- FastA2A protocol for inter-agent messaging

**9. MCP Integration**
- Model Context Protocol support
- Acts as both MCP client AND server
- Tool interoperability with external systems

**10. Privacy-First**
- SearXNG = no tracking, no corporate search dependencies
- Self-hosted = data stays on your machine
- Docker = isolated from host system

### üî¥ Weaknesses / Limitations

**1. Resource Heavy**
- Full Docker container with Linux OS
- Requires decent server specs
- Higher costs than lightweight agents

**2. Setup Complexity**
- More complex than plug-and-play solutions
- Docker knowledge required
- Configuration through environment variables

**3. Security Risks**
- Full OS access = potentially dangerous
- Agent can run any command on its container
- Requires careful sandboxing and monitoring
- Their own docs warn: "Agent Zero Can Be Dangerous!"

**4. No Native Mobile/Messaging Integration**
- Web UI only (no Telegram, WhatsApp, Discord built-in)
- Would need custom integration for messaging platforms
- OpenClaw handles this natively

**5. Token-Heavy Memory System**
- FAISS vector search is powerful but memory retrieval can be token-expensive
- Dynamic context compression may lose nuance

**6. Crypto Token (A0T)**
- Governance via crypto token ‚Äî adds complexity
- Token value volatile, community governance untested at scale

---

## 4. Comparison: Agent Zero vs OpenClaw

| Feature | Agent Zero | OpenClaw (Alex Prime) |
|---------|-----------|----------------------|
| **Environment** | Full Docker Linux OS | Host OS (VPS/bare metal) |
| **Isolation** | Container sandbox | Process-level |
| **Memory** | FAISS vector + categories | File-based + memory_search |
| **Search** | SearXNG (self-hosted) | Brave API |
| **Browser** | browser-use integration | Playwright-based |
| **Multi-Agent** | Built-in hierarchical | Sub-agent spawning |
| **Messaging** | Web UI only | Telegram, WhatsApp, Discord, Signal, etc. |
| **Voice** | TTS + STT (Whisper) | TTS (ElevenLabs/OpenAI) |
| **Tools** | Self-creating (dynamic) | Skill-based (SKILL.md) |
| **Customization** | Prompt files + extensions | AGENTS.md + SOUL.md + config |
| **Skills** | SKILL.md standard | SKILL.md standard (same!) |
| **Projects** | Isolated workspaces | Single workspace |
| **Model Support** | Multi-provider | Multi-provider (OpenRouter) |
| **Cron/Scheduling** | Not built-in | Native cron system |
| **Heartbeats** | Not built-in | Native heartbeat system |
| **Setup** | Docker pull + run | npm install + config |
| **Cost** | Open source (free) | Open source (free) |
| **Community** | GitHub + token governance | Discord |

### Where Agent Zero Wins
1. **Full OS isolation** ‚Äî safer for dangerous operations
2. **Self-creating tools** ‚Äî no pre-programming needed
3. **Project isolation** ‚Äî multi-client work without context bleed
4. **Memory Dashboard** ‚Äî visual memory management UI
5. **A2A Protocol** ‚Äî standardized inter-agent communication

### Where OpenClaw Wins
1. **Native messaging** ‚Äî Telegram, WhatsApp, Discord, Signal built-in
2. **Heartbeat system** ‚Äî proactive, scheduled check-ins
3. **Cron jobs** ‚Äî precise scheduling and reminders
4. **Lighter footprint** ‚Äî no Docker overhead
5. **Channel routing** ‚Äî seamless multi-platform communication
6. **Session management** ‚Äî main + isolated sessions with spawning

---

## 5. Ideas to Steal / Implement

### üî• HIGH PRIORITY ‚Äî Implement Now

**1. Tiered Memory Categories (from FAISS system)**
- Currently: flat file-based memory
- Implement: Categorize memories into facts, solutions, lessons, instruments
- How: Already started with `docs/CONTEXT-MEMORY-SYSTEM.md` (3-tier architecture)

**2. Project Isolation**
- Currently: single workspace for everything
- Implement: Separate directories per client with isolated context
- How: `projects/pulse-graphix/`, `projects/client-2/`, etc.
- Each with own memory, TODO, and context files

**3. Dynamic Context Compression**
- Currently: OpenClaw handles compaction automatically
- Improve: Pre-compress context before it hits limits
- How: Follow CONTEXT-MEMORY-SYSTEM.md protocols

### üü° MEDIUM PRIORITY ‚Äî Implement When Needed

**4. Instruments (Reusable Tool Recipes)**
- Agent Zero stores successful tool combinations for reuse
- We could create `instruments/` folder with proven workflows
- Example: "prospect research" instrument with exact steps

**5. Memory Dashboard**
- Visual UI for browsing/editing agent memories
- Could add to our Next.js dashboard
- Browse, search, edit MEMORY.md and daily files

**6. A2A Protocol**
- When we deploy the Subagent Pyramid, use standardized communication
- Agent-to-agent messaging format
- Already partially done with sessions_send

### üü¢ LOW PRIORITY ‚Äî Nice to Have

**7. Self-Hosted Search (SearXNG)**
- Privacy-respecting, no rate limits
- Would eliminate Brave API rate limiting issues
- Docker: `docker pull searxng/searxng`

**8. Local LLM Support (Ollama)**
- For cost reduction on simple tasks
- Run small models locally for classification/routing
- Ollama: `docker pull ollama/ollama`

---

## 6. Key Takeaways

1. **Agent Zero and OpenClaw are complementary** ‚Äî A0 excels at isolated computing tasks, OpenClaw excels at communication and integration
2. **Memory management is the #1 differentiator** ‚Äî A0's FAISS system is more sophisticated than our file-based approach, but ours is more transparent and debuggable
3. **Self-creating tools is revolutionary** ‚Äî This is the biggest idea worth studying. Agents that build their own tools grow exponentially
4. **Project isolation prevents context bleed** ‚Äî Critical for multi-client work (Pulse Graphix + future clients)
5. **The SKILL.md standard is shared** ‚Äî Both platforms use it, meaning skills are portable between A0 and OpenClaw
6. **Docker isolation is the gold standard** for security ‚Äî Something to consider for risky operations

---

## 7. Recommendation for Our System

**Short-term (now):**
- Implement the 3-tier memory system (CONTEXT-MEMORY-SYSTEM.md) ‚úÖ
- Start categorizing memories (facts vs solutions vs lessons)
- Create project directories for client isolation

**Medium-term (1-2 months):**
- Build instruments system (reusable workflow recipes)
- Add memory management section to dashboard
- Consider SearXNG Docker for unlimited private search

**Long-term (3-6 months):**
- Evaluate running Agent Zero alongside OpenClaw for compute-heavy tasks
- Agent Zero for: code generation, data processing, server management
- OpenClaw for: communication, scheduling, client interaction
- Both sharing the same SKILL.md skills

---

*This document is a living reference. Update as Agent Zero evolves and as we implement features.*

# Claude Opus 4.6 Upgrade Plan
## Upgrading Alex Prime's Brain to the Latest Model

*Created: February 6, 2026*
*Author: Alex Prime*

---

## üß† What's New in Claude Opus 4.6

**Released:** February 5, 2026 (yesterday!)

### Key Improvements:

| Feature | Description |
|---------|-------------|
| **1 Million Token Context** | 4x larger than previous (was 256K) ‚Äî can handle entire codebases |
| **Agent Teams** | Multiple agents working in parallel on different parts of a task |
| **Better Coding** | Improved software development capabilities |
| **PowerPoint Integration** | Direct integration with Microsoft Office |
| **Enterprise Focus** | Designed for knowledge workers, not just developers |

### Pricing (Unchanged):
- **Input:** $5 per 1 million tokens
- **Output:** $25 per 1 million tokens
- **Extended context (>200K):** $10/$37.50 per million tokens

---

## üéØ Why Upgrade?

### Benefits for Alex Prime:

1. **Longer Memory per Session**
   - 1M tokens = ~750,000 words of context
   - Can read entire projects without forgetting earlier parts

2. **Agent Teams Feature**
   - Can spawn sub-agents that work in parallel
   - Faster completion of complex tasks
   - Better overnight work capability

3. **Better Coding**
   - Improved code generation
   - Better understanding of large codebases
   - More accurate debugging

4. **Same Price**
   - No cost increase from Opus 4.5
   - Same $20/month Anthropic plan works

---

## üìä Plan Options

### Option A: Stay on Current Plan ($20/month)
- ‚úÖ Get Opus 4.6 automatically (just model name change)
- ‚úÖ No action needed from you
- ‚ö†Ô∏è Limited usage (same token limits)

### Option B: Upgrade to Max Plan ($100/month)
- ‚úÖ 5x more usage
- ‚úÖ Priority access to new features
- ‚úÖ Agent teams preview access
- ‚úÖ Better for heavy overnight work
- ‚ö†Ô∏è Higher cost

### Option C: API Direct ($5/$25 per million tokens)
- ‚úÖ Pay only for what you use
- ‚úÖ No monthly cap
- ‚úÖ Full access to all features
- ‚ö†Ô∏è Can get expensive with heavy use
- ‚ö†Ô∏è Need to manage billing

---

## üõ†Ô∏è How to Upgrade

### Step 1: Update OpenClaw (if needed)
```bash
curl -fsSL https://openclaw.ai/install.sh | bash -s -- --no-onboard
```

### Step 2: Change Model in Config

**Option A ‚Äî Via OpenClaw CLI:**
```bash
# View current config
openclaw gateway config.get

# The model should auto-update if using "anthropic/claude-opus-4"
# If pinned to specific version, update manually
```

**Option B ‚Äî Edit Config Directly:**
```bash
nano ~/.openclaw/openclaw.json
```

Find the models section and change:
```json
"default": "anthropic/claude-opus-4-6"
```

### Step 3: Restart Gateway
```bash
openclaw gateway restart
```

### Step 4: Verify
```bash
openclaw status
# Should show: model=anthropic/claude-opus-4-6
```

---

## üí∞ Cost Comparison

| Plan | Monthly Cost | Best For |
|------|--------------|----------|
| Current (Anthropic $20) | $20 | Light usage, testing |
| Max Plan | $100 | Heavy daily use, overnight work |
| API Direct | Variable (~$50-200) | Predictable heavy workloads |

### Estimated Usage (Alex Prime):
- ~500K tokens/day average
- ~15M tokens/month
- **API cost:** ~$75-100/month (input) + ~$375-500/month (output)
- **Recommendation:** Max Plan ($100) is better value for consistent use

---

## üöÄ Upgrade Steps Summary

1. **Immediate (Free):**
   - Update OpenClaw to get Opus 4.6 support
   - Model may auto-switch or need config change

2. **If Upgrading Plan:**
   - Go to: https://console.anthropic.com
   - Upgrade to Max plan
   - Update API key if needed

3. **After Upgrade:**
   - Test with complex task
   - Monitor token usage
   - Verify agent teams work (if on API/Max)

---

## ‚ö†Ô∏è Important Notes

- Opus 4.6 is **backward compatible** ‚Äî all existing prompts work
- Agent teams requires API access or Max plan (preview)
- 1M context is opt-in (uses more tokens = more cost)
- Your personality files (SOUL.md, etc.) are NOT affected

---

## üîÆ Recommendation

**For Kabundji's Use Case:**

Given that you want Alex Prime to:
- Work overnight autonomously
- Handle complex multi-step tasks
- Be more productive

**Recommended:** Upgrade to **Max Plan ($100/month)** when ready.

This gives:
- Full Opus 4.6 access
- Agent teams preview
- 5x usage headroom
- Priority support

**Timeline:**
1. Week 1: Test Opus 4.6 on current plan
2. Week 2: Evaluate if usage hits limits
3. Week 3: Upgrade to Max if needed

---

*Questions? Ask Alex Prime or check https://docs.anthropic.com*

# Cloud Storage Services Comparison
*For Kabundji ‚Äî February 14, 2026*

## Your Use Case Summary
- **Need**: Backup workspace files, documents, templates
- **Location**: Remote VPS/workspace
- **Priority**: Reliable backup, easy integration for me (AI agent)
- **Ideal**: Large space at low cost, API/CLI access for automation

---

## TOP RECOMMENDATIONS ‚≠ê

### 1. Google Drive ‚≠ê BEST OVERALL
| Feature | Details |
|---------|---------|
| **Free Storage** | 15 GB (shared with Gmail, Photos) |
| **Paid Plans** | 100 GB: $1.67/mo ‚Üí 2 TB: $9.99/mo |
| **Max Storage** | 30 TB |
| **API Access** | ‚úÖ Excellent (Google Drive API) |
| **CLI Tools** | ‚úÖ rclone, drive CLI |
| **Sync** | Web, Desktop, Mobile |

**Pros:**
- ‚úÖ **Best integration with OpenClaw** ‚Äî likely already supported
- ‚úÖ Most generous free tier (15 GB)
- ‚úÖ API access for automation
- ‚úÖ Fast sync (1 Gbps speeds)
- ‚úÖ Built-in Docs/Sheets/Slides for quick editing
- ‚úÖ 5 TB file size limit

**Cons:**
- ‚ùå Privacy concerns (Google scans files)
- ‚ùå Shared quota with Gmail

**Price Examples (yearly = 16% discount):**
- 100 GB: $19.99/year ($1.67/mo)
- 2 TB: $99.99/year ($8.33/mo)
- 5 TB: $249.99/year

**Verdict**: **RECOMMENDED** ‚Äî Best value, easy API, generous free storage

---

### 2. IDrive ‚≠ê BEST FOR BACKUP
| Feature | Details |
|---------|---------|
| **Free Storage** | 10 GB |
| **Paid Plans** | **5 TB: $24.88 first year** ‚Üí then $69.95/year |
| **Max Storage** | 50 TB+ (plans scale) |
| **API Access** | ‚úÖ Yes (REST API) |
| **CLI Tools** | ‚úÖ Linux/Windows/Mac CLI |
| **Backup Type** | Continuous, block-level sync |

**Pros:**
- ‚úÖ **CHEAPEST storage per TB** by far
- ‚úÖ Can backup to physical drives they send you
- ‚úÖ Can backup AWS, Dropbox, Google Drive (clone other clouds!)
- ‚úÖ Continuous backup (changes sync instantly)
- ‚úÖ Linux/Windows/Mac CLI available

**Cons:**
- ‚ùå Not as user-friendly as Google Drive
- ‚ùå Sharing not as seamless

**Pricing (Annual ‚Äî 50% off first year):**
| Plan | First Year | Regular | Per TB/Year |
|------|------------|---------|-------------|
| Mini (100 GB) | $3.71 | $9.95 | ~$100 |
| Personal (5 TB) | **$24.88** | $69.95 | **$14/TB** |
| Personal (10 TB) | $49.88 | $99.95 | **$10/TB** |

**Verdict**: **BEST VALUE FOR PURE BACKUP** ‚Äî 5TB for $25 first year

---

### 3. Dropbox ‚Äî Best for Collaboration
| Feature | Details |
|---------|---------|
| **Free Storage** | 2 GB (worst free tier) |
| **Paid Plans** | 2 TB: $10/mo ‚Üí 3 TB: $17/mo |
| **API Access** | ‚úÖ Yes |
| **CLI Tools** | ‚úÖ Yes |
| **Unique** | Block-level sync, eSignatures |

**Pros:**
- ‚úÖ Block-level sync (only changed chunks synced)
- ‚úÖ Best third-party integrations
- ‚úÖ eSignatures built-in
- ‚úÖ Fast sync

**Cons:**
- ‚ùå Expensive ($10/mo for 2TB vs $25 first year for 5TB with IDrive)
- ‚ùå Free tier only 2 GB
- ‚ùå Security breaches in past

**Pricing:**
- Plus (2 TB): $9.99/mo or $119.88/year
- Family (2 TB, 6 users): $16.99/mo

**Verdict**: Good for collaboration, but **overpriced** for pure storage

---

### 4. Microsoft OneDrive ‚Äî Good for Office Users
| Feature | Details |
|---------|---------|
| **Free Storage** | 5 GB |
| **Paid Plans** | 100 GB: $1.67/mo ‚Üí 6 TB: $8.33/mo |
| **API Access** | ‚úÖ Yes |
| **CLI Tools** | ‚úÖ Via rclone |
| **Unique** | Personal Vault, Office Online |

**Pros:**
- ‚úÖ Good value (6 TB for $8.33/mo)
- ‚úÖ Personal Vault (secure file storage)
- ‚úÖ Block-level sync
- ‚úÖ Built-in Office apps

**Cons:**
- ‚ùå Works best with Windows
- ‚ùå Smaller ecosystem than Google Drive

**Pricing:**
- 100 GB: $1.99/mo
- Microsoft 365 (1 TB): $6.99/mo (includes Office apps)
- Family (6 TB across 6 users): $9.99/mo

**Verdict**: Good if already using Microsoft 365

---

## QUICK COMPARISON TABLE

| Service | Free | 2 TB Cost | 5 TB Cost | API | Best For |
|---------|------|-----------|-----------|-----|----------|
| **Google Drive** | 15 GB | $8.33/mo | ‚Äî | ‚úÖ | General use, productivity |
| **IDrive** | 10 GB | ‚Äî | $24.88/yr (1st yr) | ‚úÖ | **Cheapest backup** |
| **Dropbox** | 2 GB | $10/mo | $17+/mo | ‚úÖ | Collaboration, sync |
| **OneDrive** | 5 GB | Included in M365 | $8.33/mo | ‚úÖ | Office integration |
| **pCloud** | 10 GB | $9.99/mo | ‚Äî | ‚úÖ | Lifetime plans |
| **Sync.com** | 5 GB | $8/mo | ‚Äî | ‚úÖ | **Privacy** |

---

## RECOMMENDATION FOR YOUR USE CASE

### Option A: Budget-Focused ‚Üí **IDrive**
- **5 TB for $24.88 first year** ($69.95/year after)
- Perfect for automated backups of workspace
- Can backup entire VPS/image disks
- CLI tools for automation

### Option B: Balanced ‚Üí **Google Drive**
- Start with free 15 GB
- Upgrade to 2 TB: $99.99/year
- Best API/integration with my tools
- Can access files anywhere, edit in Docs

### Option C: Privacy-Focused ‚Üí **Sync.com**
- Client-side encryption
- 5 GB free
- 2 TB: $8/month
- Zero-knowledge (even they can't read your files)

---

## FOR AI AGENT (MY) WORKFLOW

**What I Need:**
1. A folder/directory in cloud storage
2. API key or connection method
3. Automation to sync key files

**Best Setup:**
```
Workspace ‚Üí (rsync/rclone) ‚Üí Google Drive OR IDrive
```

**What to Back Up:**
- `/workspace/templates/*` ‚Äî Your templates
- `/workspace/prospects/*` ‚Äî Prospect research
- `/workspace/business/*` ‚Äî Strategy documents
- `/workspace/memory/*.md` ‚Äî Daily logs
- `/workspace/dashboard/*` ‚Äî Dashboard files

---

## NEXT STEPS

1. **Pick a service** from above (I recommend IDrive or Google)
2. **Set up account** and share credentials/API key with me
3. **I'll configure** automated backup scripts
4. **I'll push** current workspace files to the cloud

**Want me to:**
- [ ] Create a backup script once you choose?
- [ ] Compare specific features in more detail?
- [ ] Research enterprise options (if needed)?

---

*Sources: Cloudwards.net 2026 review, IDrive pricing, CNET, PCMag, Zapier*
*Research completed: 2026-02-14*

files.name: CONTEXT-MEMORY-SYSTEM.md
files.content:
# üß† CONTEXT & MEMORY MANAGEMENT SYSTEM
## Alex Prime ‚Äî Intelligent Context Management Protocol

**Created:** February 14, 2026  
**Author:** Alex Prime (designed with Opus 4.6 deep thinking)  
**Purpose:** Prevent context overflow, maintain accuracy, and ensure continuity across sessions  
**Status:** ACTIVE ‚Äî Follow this protocol every session

---

## The Problem

Context windows have a hard limit. When conversations get long:
- Older messages get compressed or dropped
- Important details get lost in the noise
- Accuracy degrades as context fills with completed/irrelevant data
- Token costs increase unnecessarily
- Agent performance drops

## The Solution: 3-Tier Memory Architecture

### Tier 1: HOT MEMORY (Always in Context)
**Location:** Loaded every session via AGENTS.md directive  
**Max Size:** ~2,000 tokens combined  
**Contains:** Only what's needed RIGHT NOW

| File | Purpose | Max Size | Update Frequency |
|------|---------|----------|-----------------|
| `SOUL.md` | Identity & personality | 500 tokens | Rarely |
| `USER.md` | Who Kabundji is | 800 tokens | Monthly |
| `HEARTBEAT.md` | Current workflow rules | 500 tokens | As needed |
| `IDENTITY.md` | Agent identity | 200 tokens | Rarely |

**Rules:**
- Keep these files LEAN ‚Äî every word costs tokens
- No completed tasks, no history, no archives
- Only active directives and current identity

### Tier 2: WARM MEMORY (Loaded on Demand)
**Location:** `MEMORY.md` + `memory/YYYY-MM-DD.md`  
**Max Size:** MEMORY.md ‚â§ 3,000 tokens; daily files ‚â§ 2,000 tokens each  
**Contains:** Recent context, active projects, key decisions

| File | Purpose | When to Load |
|------|---------|-------------|
| `MEMORY.md` | Curated long-term memory | Main sessions only |
| `memory/today.md` | Today's activity log | Every session |
| `memory/yesterday.md` | Yesterday's context | If needed for continuity |
| `TODO.md` | Active task tracker | On heartbeats |

**Rules:**
- MEMORY.md is curated ‚Äî NOT a dump of everything
- Use `memory_search` to find specific info instead of loading entire files
- Daily files get archived after 7 days (see Tier 3)

### Tier 3: COLD MEMORY (Searchable Archive)
**Location:** `memory/archive/` + `docs/` + `business/`  
**Max Size:** Unlimited (stored on disk)  
**Contains:** Completed work, historical decisions, reference documents

| Location | Contents |
|----------|----------|
| `memory/archive/YYYY-MM.md` | Monthly summaries (compressed from daily files) |
| `memory/archive/decisions.md` | Key decisions log with dates and reasoning |
| `memory/archive/lessons.md` | Lessons learned (mistakes, insights) |
| `docs/` | Reference documents, guides, research |
| `business/` | Business documents, briefs, strategies |
| `social-media/` | Strategy documents |
| `prospects/` | Lead research |
| `templates/` | Design templates |

**Rules:**
- Never load cold memory into context unless specifically needed
- Use `memory_search` to find relevant snippets
- Summarize before loading ‚Äî never dump raw files into context

---

## Context Budget Protocol

### Per-Session Token Budget (Target)

```
CATEGORY              | MAX TOKENS | NOTES
‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îº‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îº‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ
System Prompt         |   ~3,000   | OpenClaw injects this
Hot Memory (Tier 1)   |   ~2,000   | SOUL + USER + HEARTBEAT + IDENTITY
Warm Memory (Tier 2)  |   ~3,000   | MEMORY.md (only in main sessions)
Conversation History  |  ~50,000   | Managed by OpenClaw compaction
Working Space         |  ~40,000   | For actual task work
‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îº‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îº‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ
TOTAL AVAILABLE       | ~100,000   | Varies by model
```

### Rules for Staying Within Budget

1. **Write to files, not inline** ‚Äî If output > 500 tokens, write to a file and summarize
2. **Don't repeat context** ‚Äî If info is in a file, reference it, don't paste it
3. **Compress completed work** ‚Äî Move done tasks from TODO.md to archive
4. **Use memory_search** ‚Äî Search before loading entire files
5. **Batch tool outputs** ‚Äî Process results, don't echo them verbatim
6. **Summarize sub-agent results** ‚Äî Don't paste full transcripts

---

## Daily Memory Maintenance Protocol

### Every Morning (First Heartbeat After 06:00 UTC)
1. Archive yesterday's daily file if > 2,000 tokens:
   - Summarize key events into 500-token version
   - Move original to `memory/archive/raw/YYYY-MM-DD.md`
   - Keep summary as `memory/YYYY-MM-DD.md`
2. Review MEMORY.md ‚Äî remove anything no longer relevant
3. Create today's daily file: `memory/YYYY-MM-DD.md`

### Weekly (Every Monday)
1. Compress last 7 daily files into weekly summary
2. Update `memory/archive/YYYY-WNN.md` (week number)
3. Review and trim MEMORY.md:
   - Remove completed project details (keep only lessons)
   - Update active project status
   - Remove outdated credentials/links
4. Clean TODO.md ‚Äî move completed items to archive

### Monthly (First Monday of Month)
1. Create monthly summary: `memory/archive/YYYY-MM.md`
2. Review all warm memory files for relevance
3. Update `memory/archive/decisions.md` with month's key decisions
4. Update `memory/archive/lessons.md` with new insights
5. Audit MEMORY.md ‚Äî should be < 3,000 tokens

---

## MEMORY.md Structure (Keep This Lean!)

```markdown
# MEMORY.md ‚Äî Alex Prime Long-Term Memory
*Last Updated: YYYY-MM-DD*

## üî• ACTIVE RIGHT NOW (remove when done)
- Current project: [name] ‚Äî [1-line status]
- Blocked on: [what]
- Next action: [what]

## üë§ Key Context
- [Only things that affect EVERY interaction]
- [Kabundji preferences that matter daily]

## üè¢ Business Quick Reference
- [Company name, key URLs, pricing summary]
- [NOT full briefs ‚Äî those live in business/ folder]

## üîë Credentials & Access
- [Active credentials only]
- [Remove expired/unused]

## üìù Lessons Learned
- [Only lessons that prevent repeated mistakes]
- [Max 10 items ‚Äî archive the rest]

## üîó Key File Locations
- [Map of where important files live]
- [So we can find them without loading everything]
```

**Target:** MEMORY.md should be readable in 30 seconds. If it takes longer, it's too long.

---

## Smart Context Loading Rules

### Session Start Checklist
```
1. Read SOUL.md ‚úì (always)
2. Read USER.md ‚úì (always)
3. Read HEARTBEAT.md ‚úì (always)
4. Read IDENTITY.md ‚úì (always)
5. IF main session ‚Üí Read MEMORY.md
6. IF heartbeat ‚Üí Read TODO.md
7. IF specific topic ‚Üí memory_search for relevant context
8. NEVER load more than 2 reference docs at once
```

### During Conversation
```
- Need old info? ‚Üí memory_search first, then memory_get specific lines
- Need a file's content? ‚Üí Read only relevant sections (use offset/limit)
- Creating output? ‚Üí Write to file if > 500 tokens
- Sub-agent result? ‚Üí Summarize in 2-3 sentences, reference file location
- Repeating yourself? ‚Üí Stop. Reference the file instead.
```

### Before Responding
```
- Is my response > 1,000 tokens? ‚Üí Consider writing to file
- Am I pasting file contents? ‚Üí Just reference the path
- Am I listing completed tasks? ‚Üí Summarize count, reference TODO.md
- Am I echoing tool output? ‚Üí Extract key info only
```

---

## Compaction-Friendly Practices

OpenClaw automatically compacts conversation history when context gets long. To make compaction work better:

1. **Front-load important info** ‚Äî Key decisions at start of messages
2. **Use clear section headers** ‚Äî Compaction preserves structure
3. **Don't spread one topic across many messages** ‚Äî Consolidate
4. **Mark what matters** ‚Äî Use üî• or ‚ö†Ô∏è for critical items
5. **End messages with status** ‚Äî "Status: X done, Y pending" helps recovery

---

## Emergency Context Recovery

If context gets corrupted or compacted too aggressively:

1. Read `MEMORY.md` ‚Äî curated essentials
2. Read `TODO.md` ‚Äî current task status
3. Read `memory/YYYY-MM-DD.md` (today) ‚Äî what happened today
4. Run `memory_search` for specific topics
5. Check git log for recent commits: `git log --oneline -20`

This should reconstruct 90%+ of needed context in < 5,000 tokens.

---

## File Size Limits (Enforced)

| File | Max Lines | Max Tokens | Action When Exceeded |
|------|-----------|------------|---------------------|
| MEMORY.md | 150 | 3,000 | Archive old sections |
| TODO.md | 120 | 2,500 | Move completed to archive |
| HEARTBEAT.md | 50 | 1,000 | Keep only active rules |
| Daily memory | 100 | 2,000 | Summarize, archive raw |
| SOUL.md | 30 | 500 | Keep minimal |
| USER.md | 80 | 800 | Keep essential only |

---

## Implementation Checklist

- [ ] Create `memory/archive/` directory
- [ ] Create `memory/archive/decisions.md`
- [ ] Create `memory/archive/lessons.md`
- [ ] Trim MEMORY.md to < 150 lines
- [ ] Archive old daily memory files (> 7 days)
- [ ] Update AGENTS.md to reference this system
- [ ] Add weekly maintenance reminder to HEARTBEAT.md

---

*"The goal isn't to remember everything ‚Äî it's to remember what matters and know where to find the rest."*

files.name: EMAIL_SETUP_GUIDE.md
files.content:
# üìß EMAIL SETUP GUIDE
## Setting Up Gmail Access for Alex Prime

*Email: john.melo.testing01@gmail.com*

---

## Overview

We'll use **`gog` (Google CLI)** ‚Äî a powerful tool that gives me access to:
- ‚úâÔ∏è **Gmail** ‚Äî Send, receive, search emails
- üìÖ **Calendar** ‚Äî Manage events
- üìÅ **Drive** ‚Äî Access files
- üìá **Contacts** ‚Äî Manage contacts
- üìä **Sheets** ‚Äî Read/write spreadsheets
- üìÑ **Docs** ‚Äî Access documents

---

## Setup Steps

### Step 1: Install gog CLI

Run this command on the server:

```bash
# On Ubuntu/Linux
curl -fsSL https://gogcli.sh/install.sh | bash

# Or via npm
npm install -g gogcli
```

---

### Step 2: Create Google Cloud Project (One-time)

1. Go to: https://console.cloud.google.com/
2. Create a new project (name: "Alex Prime" or similar)
3. Enable these APIs:
   - Gmail API
   - Google Calendar API
   - Google Drive API
   - Google Contacts API
   - Google Sheets API
   - Google Docs API

---

### Step 3: Create OAuth Credentials

1. In Google Cloud Console ‚Üí **APIs & Services** ‚Üí **Credentials**
2. Click **Create Credentials** ‚Üí **OAuth client ID**
3. Application type: **Desktop app**
4. Name: "Alex Prime CLI"
5. Download the `client_secret_*.json` file

---

### Step 4: Configure gog with Credentials

Upload the `client_secret.json` to the server and run:

```bash
# Register the OAuth credentials
gog auth credentials /path/to/client_secret.json

# Add the Gmail account
gog auth add john.melo.testing01@gmail.com --services gmail,calendar,drive,contacts,docs,sheets
```

This will open a browser for OAuth consent. Complete the authorization.

---

### Step 5: Verify Setup

```bash
# List authorized accounts
gog auth list

# Test Gmail access
gog gmail search 'in:inbox' --max 5 --account john.melo.testing01@gmail.com
```

---

## What I Can Do Once Set Up

### üìß Email Operations

```bash
# Send email
gog gmail send --to recipient@example.com \
  --subject "Meeting Request" \
  --body "Hello, I'd like to schedule a meeting..."

# Search emails
gog gmail search 'from:client@company.com newer_than:7d' --max 10

# Read specific email
gog gmail read <messageId>

# Reply to email
gog gmail send --to recipient@example.com \
  --subject "Re: Meeting" \
  --body "Thanks for your response..." \
  --reply-to-message-id <originalMsgId>

# Create draft (for review before sending)
gog gmail drafts create --to recipient@example.com \
  --subject "Proposal" \
  --body-file ./proposal.txt
```

### üìÖ Calendar Operations

```bash
# List upcoming events
gog calendar events primary --from 2026-01-31 --to 2026-02-07

# Create event
gog calendar create primary \
  --summary "Client Meeting" \
  --from "2026-02-01T10:00:00" \
  --to "2026-02-01T11:00:00"
```

### üìÅ Drive Operations

```bash
# Search files
gog drive search "project proposal" --max 10

# List files
gog drive list --max 20
```

---

## Alternative: Simple SMTP/IMAP (If OAuth is too complex)

If you prefer a simpler password-based approach:

### Enable Gmail App Password

1. Go to: https://myaccount.google.com/security
2. Enable **2-Step Verification**
3. Go to: https://myaccount.google.com/apppasswords
4. Create an App Password for "Mail" ‚Üí "Other (Custom name)" ‚Üí "Alex Prime"
5. Save the 16-character password

### Add to .env

```bash
# In .env file
GMAIL_USER=john.melo.testing01@gmail.com
GMAIL_APP_PASSWORD=xxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxx
```

### Use with himalaya (IMAP/SMTP CLI)

```bash
# Install himalaya
openclaw skills install himalaya

# Configure in ~/.config/himalaya/config.toml
```

---

## Recommended Approach

**For full functionality:** Use `gog` with OAuth
- Most secure
- Full API access
- No password storage

**For quick testing:** Use App Password + SMTP
- Simpler setup
- Limited features
- Password stored locally

---

## Security Notes

‚ö†Ô∏è **Important:**
- Never share OAuth credentials publicly
- Store App Passwords in `.env` (not in code)
- Use a dedicated email for agent operations (you're already doing this!)
- Review sent emails periodically

---

## Next Steps for Kabundji

1. **Create Google Cloud Project** (5 min)
   - https://console.cloud.google.com/

2. **Enable APIs** (2 min)
   - Gmail, Calendar, Drive, Contacts, Sheets, Docs

3. **Create OAuth Credentials** (3 min)
   - Download `client_secret.json`

4. **Share the `client_secret.json` with me** (upload to server)
   - I'll complete the setup

5. **Complete OAuth flow** (2 min)
   - One-time browser authorization

---

## Questions for You

1. **Do you want full Google Workspace access** (Gmail + Calendar + Drive)?
   Or just email?

2. **OAuth or App Password?**
   - OAuth = More secure, more features
   - App Password = Simpler, email only

3. **Can you access Google Cloud Console?**
   - If yes, we use OAuth
   - If not, we use App Password

---

*Guide ready. Let me know which approach you prefer and I'll walk you through it.*

**‚Äî Alex Prime üéØ**

**For Pulse Graphix Template Business**

- Consistent typography, spacing, colors
