files.name: GLM-5-RESEARCH.md
files.content:
# GLM-5 Research ‚Äî Adding to Our LLM Stack
*Date: 2026-02-13 | Released: Feb 11, 2026 (2 days ago!)*

---

## üî• What is GLM-5?

**GLM-5** is Zhipu AI's (Z.ai) new flagship open-source LLM.

| Spec | Value |
|------|-------|
| **Parameters** | 744B total (40B active ‚Äî MoE architecture) |
| **Context** | 128K tokens |
| **License** | MIT (fully open-source, commercial use!) |
| **Released** | February 11, 2026 |
| **Beats** | GPT-5.2 on BrowseComp, Vending Bench 2 & Terminal-Bench |
| **Competes with** | Claude Opus 4.5, GPT-5.2, Gemini 3.0 Pro |
| **Specialty** | Complex systems engineering, long-horizon agentic tasks |

---

## üí∞ Pricing (Z.ai Direct API)

| Model | Input (per 1M tokens) | Output (per 1M tokens) | Notes |
|-------|----------------------|------------------------|-------|
| **GLM-5** | $1.00 | $3.20 | Flagship |
| **GLM-5-Code** | $1.20 | $5.00 | Coding specialist |
| **GLM-4.7** | $0.60 | $2.20 | Previous gen |
| **GLM-4.7-Flash** | **FREE** | **FREE** | Fast, free forever |
| **GLM-4.5-Flash** | **FREE** | **FREE** | Free forever |
| **GLM-4.5-Air** | $0.20 | $1.10 | Lightweight |

**Cached input is limited-time FREE for all paid models!**

---

## üÜì FREE Access Options

### 1. Z.ai Direct (Free Trial Credits)
- **URL:** https://z.ai
- **API:** https://api.z.ai/api/paas/v4/chat/completions
- **Free credits for new users** on signup
- **GLM-4.7-Flash & GLM-4.5-Flash = permanently FREE**
- Coding plan from $10/mo (supports Claude Code, OpenClaw)

### 2. OpenRouter
- **URL:** https://openrouter.ai/z-ai/glm-5
- Already on OpenRouter ‚Äî we have an OpenRouter account!
- Can add to our fallback chain immediately

### 3. Puter.js (Unlimited, No API Key)
- **URL:** https://developer.puter.com/tutorials/free-unlimited-zai-glm-api/
- Free unlimited access via Puter.js SDK
- "User-Pays" model ‚Äî each user covers costs
- Works for web apps

### 4. Ollama (Self-hosted, FREE)
- Download weights from HuggingFace: https://huggingface.co/zai-org/GLM-5
- Run locally with Ollama
- Completely free, no API limits
- Requires significant GPU (744B model)

### 5. Modal (Free Trial)
- **URL:** https://modal.com/blog/try-glm-5
- Free trial available

---

## üîß How to Add GLM-5 to OpenClaw

### Option A: Via OpenRouter (Easiest)
We already have OpenRouter configured. GLM-5 is available at:
- Model ID: `z-ai/glm-5`
- Provider: `openrouter`
- Full path: `openrouter/z-ai/glm-5`

**To add:** Update OpenClaw config to include `openrouter/z-ai/glm-5` as a fallback model.

### Option B: Z.ai Direct API
1. Sign up at https://z.ai
2. Get API key
3. Add to OpenClaw config as custom provider:
   - Base URL: `https://api.z.ai/api/paas/v4`
   - OpenAI-compatible API format
   - Model: `glm-5`

### Option C: Free Flash Models
For cost optimization, add the FREE models:
- `openrouter/z-ai/glm-4.7-flash` (FREE!)
- `openrouter/z-ai/glm-4.5-flash` (FREE!)

---

## üìä Comparison with Our Current Models

| Model | Input Cost | Output Cost | Quality | Speed |
|-------|-----------|-------------|---------|-------|
| Claude Opus 4.6 | $15.00 | $75.00 | ‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê | Slow |
| **GLM-5** | **$1.00** | **$3.20** | ‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê | Medium |
| Groq Llama 3.3 | Free | Free | ‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê | Ultra-fast |
| **GLM-4.7-Flash** | **FREE** | **FREE** | ‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê | Fast |
| NVIDIA Kimi K2.5 | Free credits | Free credits | ‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê | Medium |

**GLM-5 is 15x cheaper than Claude Opus for input, 23x cheaper for output!**

---

## üéØ Recommendation

1. **Immediately add GLM-4.7-Flash (FREE)** to our fallback chain via OpenRouter
2. **Add GLM-5** via OpenRouter for high-quality tasks at 15x lower cost
3. **Sign up at Z.ai** for direct API access + free trial credits
4. **Updated fallback chain:** Opus ‚Üí GLM-5 ‚Üí Groq ‚Üí GLM-4.7-Flash ‚Üí NVIDIA ‚Üí OpenRouter

---

*This model could save us significant costs while maintaining quality for coding and agentic tasks.*

files.name: LLM-COST-OPTIMIZATION.md
files.content:
# LLM Cost Optimization Guide

*Goal: Maximize AI usage while minimizing costs*

---

## üÜì FREE Options

### 1. OpenRouter Free Models
**URL:** https://openrouter.ai/collections/free-models

Available free models include:
- **Llama 3.3 70B** ‚Äî Meta's best open model, 128K context
- **GPT-OSS 120B** ‚Äî OpenAI's open-weight MoE model
- **Mistral models** ‚Äî Various free tiers
- **Qwen models** ‚Äî Some free variants

**Setup:** Create account at openrouter.ai, get API key, no credit card needed for free tier.

---

### 2. Groq (Extremely Fast + Free Tier)
**URL:** https://console.groq.com

- **Llama 3.3 70B Versatile** ‚Äî 128K context, tool use, JSON mode
- **Speed:** 100+ tokens/second (fastest inference available)
- **Free tier:** Yes, with rate limits
- **Paid:** Very cheap when you exceed free tier

**Why use:** Best for quick tasks that need speed over deep reasoning.

---

### 3. GitHub Copilot ($10/month = Unlimited Claude Access!)
**URL:** https://github.com/features/copilot

For $10/month you get:
- Unlimited GPT-5-mini access
- **300 requests/month to Claude Sonnet 4.5**
- Access to premium models
- Can bring your own API key too

**Bonus:** There's a reverse proxy project that exposes Copilot as OpenAI/Anthropic compatible API:
https://github.com/ericc-ch/copilot-api

---

### 4. NVIDIA API Catalog
**URL:** https://build.nvidia.com

- Free trial with **1,000-5,000 credits**
- Various LLMs, vision, speech models
- Good for experimentation

---

### 5. Cloudflare Workers AI
- **10,000 neurons/day FREE**
- Edge deployment
- Fast, lightweight

---

## üí∞ CHEAP Options (Best Value)

### 1. Kimi K2 (Moonshot AI) ‚Äî BEST VALUE
**URL:** https://platform.moonshot.ai

**Pricing:**
- Input: $0.60/million tokens
- Output: $2.50/million tokens
- Cache hits: $0.15/million tokens

**Specs:**
- 1 trillion parameters (32B activated)
- 256K context
- State-of-the-art for coding & reasoning
- OpenAI/Anthropic compatible API

**Even cheaper via DeepInfra:**
- $0.55/$2.20 per million tokens (in/out)

---

### 2. DeepInfra
**URL:** https://deepinfra.com

- Hosts Kimi K2, DeepSeek R1/V3, Llama, etc.
- Pay-per-use, no contracts
- Often cheapest for open-source models

---

### 3. Qwen 3 (Alibaba)
**URL:** https://qwen.ai/apiplatform

- Alibaba's flagship model
- Competitive pricing
- Strong multilingual support
- Available via multiple providers

---

## üîß OpenClaw Fallback Setup

Configure OpenClaw to use cheap models for routine tasks, Opus for complex ones:

```json
{
  "agents": {
    "defaults": {
      "model": {
        "primary": "anthropic/claude-opus-4-5",
        "fallbacks": [
          "openrouter/meta-llama/llama-3.3-70b-instruct",
          "groq/llama-3.3-70b-versatile"
        ]
      }
    }
  },
  "models": {
    "providers": {
      "openrouter": {
        "baseUrl": "https://openrouter.ai/api/v1",
        "apiKey": "YOUR_OPENROUTER_KEY",
        "models": [
          {"id": "meta-llama/llama-3.3-70b-instruct", "name": "Llama 3.3 70B"}
        ]
      },
      "groq": {
        "baseUrl": "https://api.groq.com/openai/v1",
        "apiKey": "YOUR_GROQ_KEY",
        "models": [
          {"id": "llama-3.3-70b-versatile", "name": "Llama 3.3 70B Groq"}
        ]
      }
    }
  }
}
```

---

## üìä Cost Comparison (per 1M tokens)

| Provider | Model | Input | Output |
|----------|-------|-------|--------|
| Anthropic | Claude Opus 4.5 | $15 | $75 |
| Anthropic | Claude Sonnet 4.5 | $3 | $15 |
| OpenAI | GPT-4 | $10 | $30 |
| Moonshot | Kimi K2 | $0.60 | $2.50 |
| DeepInfra | Kimi K2 | $0.55 | $2.20 |
| Groq | Llama 3.3 70B | ~$0.60 | ~$0.80 |
| OpenRouter | Llama 3.3 70B | FREE | FREE |

**Opus is ~30x more expensive than Kimi K2!**

---

## üéØ Recommended Strategy

1. **Complex reasoning/important tasks:** Claude Opus 4.5
2. **Coding/general tasks:** Kimi K2 or Sonnet 4.5
3. **Quick queries/drafts:** Groq Llama (fastest)
4. **Experimentation:** OpenRouter free models

---

## üîë API Keys to Get

1. **OpenRouter** (free): https://openrouter.ai/keys
2. **Groq** (free): https://console.groq.com
3. **Moonshot/Kimi** ($1 min): https://platform.moonshot.ai
4. **DeepInfra** (pay-per-use): https://deepinfra.com
5. **GitHub Copilot** ($10/mo): https://github.com/features/copilot

---

*Last Updated: 2026-02-01*

files.name: MODEL-ALLOCATION.md
files.content:
# Model Allocation Strategy

*Alex Prime's intelligent model routing for optimal cost/performance*

---

## üéØ Overview

Different tasks need different models. Here's my allocation strategy:

| Task Type | Primary Model | Fallback | Speed Model |
|-----------|--------------|----------|-------------|
| **Coding/Development** | Claude Opus 4.5 | Kimi K2.5 (NVIDIA) | Groq Llama 3.3 |
| **Research/Analysis** | Claude Opus 4.5 | OpenRouter Llama | Groq |
| **Social Media** | Claude Opus 4.5 | Groq Llama 3.3 | Groq |
| **Quick Chat** | Claude Opus 4.5 | Claude Haiku | Groq |
| **Image Generation** | Flux / DALL-E | - | - |
| **Voice/TTS** | ElevenLabs | OpenAI TTS | - |

---

## üíª Coding & Development

### Primary: Claude Opus 4.5
- **Why:** Best reasoning, code quality, debugging
- **Cost:** $5/$25 per MTok (input/output)
- **Use for:** Architecture decisions, complex code, refactoring

### Fallback: Kimi K2.5 (NVIDIA)
- **Why:** Free credits, good at code
- **Cost:** Free tier
- **Use for:** When Anthropic budget is tight

### Speed: Groq Llama 3.3 70B
- **Why:** Ultra-fast, free
- **Cost:** Free tier
- **Use for:** Quick code snippets, syntax questions

---

## üîç Research & Analysis

### Primary: Claude Opus 4.5
- **Why:** Deep reasoning, nuanced analysis
- **Use for:** Complex research, strategic decisions

### Web Search: Brave API
- **Cost:** Free tier (2000 queries/month, 1/sec rate limit)
- **Use for:** Current information, fact-checking

### Summaries: Claude Sonnet 4.5
- **Cost:** $3/$15 per MTok
- **Use for:** Summarizing large documents (cheaper than Opus)

---

## üì± Social Media

### Content Creation: Claude Opus 4.5
- **Use for:** Thoughtful posts, strategy

### Quick Posts: Groq Llama 3.3
- **Use for:** Fast replies, simple updates

### Images: Flux / DALL-E 3
- **Use for:** Visual content generation

---

## üí¨ Chat & Communication

### Primary: Claude Opus 4.5 (via OpenClaw)
- Main session handler
- WhatsApp/Telegram/Discord

### Quick Reply Mode: Claude Haiku 4.5
- **Cost:** $1/$5 per MTok (5x cheaper than Opus)
- **Use for:** Simple acknowledgments, quick responses

### Voice: ElevenLabs (if configured)
- **Use for:** Audio messages, storytime

---

## üí∞ Cost Optimization Rules

1. **Opus for thinking** - Complex tasks, reasoning, coding
2. **Haiku for speed** - Quick responses, simple tasks
3. **Free tiers first** - Groq/NVIDIA for non-critical work
4. **Batch when possible** - 50% off with Anthropic batch API
5. **Cache prompts** - System prompts are cached automatically

---

## üìä Anthropic Plans Comparison

### Current: API Pay-per-token ($20 credit)
| Model | Input | Output |
|-------|-------|--------|
| Opus 4.5 | $5/MTok | $25/MTok |
| Sonnet 4.5 | $3/MTok | $15/MTok |
| Haiku 4.5 | $1/MTok | $5/MTok |

### Claude Max Plan (NOT API)
- **$100/month:** 5x Pro usage limits (web/app only)
- **$200/month:** 20x Pro usage limits
- ‚ö†Ô∏è This is for claude.ai web, NOT API access
- ‚ö†Ô∏è No "unlimited API" plan exists

### Recommendation for Kabundji
1. Keep current $20/month API approach
2. Use free tier providers (Groq, NVIDIA) for backup
3. Consider Max only if doing heavy claude.ai web usage
4. For true unlimited: Enterprise negotiation needed

---

## üîÑ Fallback Chain

```
Primary: Anthropic Claude Opus 4.5
    ‚Üì (if rate limited or error)
Fallback 1: Groq Llama 3.3 70B (free, ultra-fast)
    ‚Üì (if unavailable)
Fallback 2: NVIDIA Kimi K2.5 (free credits)
    ‚Üì (if unavailable)  
Fallback 3: OpenRouter Llama/Qwen (free tier)
    ‚Üì (if unavailable)
Fallback 4: Moonshot Kimi K2 (cheap backup)
```

---

## üéõÔ∏è OpenClaw Model Override

You can override my model per-session:
```
/status ‚Üí See current model
session_status(model="sonnet") ‚Üí Switch to Sonnet
session_status(model="default") ‚Üí Reset to Opus
```

---

---

## üìÖ Update: February 3, 2026 - Cost Optimization Implemented

### Changes Applied

| Setting | Before | After | Savings |
|---------|--------|-------|---------|
| **Heartbeat Model** | Opus 4.5 | Haiku 4 | ~80% cheaper |
| **Heartbeat Interval** | 10s | 1 hour | 360x fewer calls |
| **Subagent Model** | Opus 4.5 | Kimi K2.5 (free) | ~$100+/month |

### Model Aliases Now Available

- `/status model=opus` ‚Üí Claude Opus 4.5
- `/status model=sonnet` ‚Üí Claude Sonnet 4.5
- `/status model=haiku` ‚Üí Claude Haiku 4
- `/status model=kimi` ‚Üí Kimi K2.5 (NVIDIA)
- `/status model=groq` ‚Üí Llama 3.3 70B (Groq)

### Sonnet 5 "Fennec" - Coming Soon?

Leaked info suggests Claude Sonnet 5 may launch today (Feb 3). If confirmed:
- 50% cheaper than Opus 4.5
- May match or exceed Opus performance
- Will add as primary when available

See: `docs/SONNET5-RESEARCH.md` for full analysis.

---

*Last Updated: 2026-02-03*

files.name: OPENCLAW-UPDATE-GUIDE.md
files.content:
# OpenClaw Update Guide for Ubuntu
## How to Update Alex Prime Without Losing Settings

*Created: February 6, 2026*
*Author: Alex Prime*

---

## üìã Pre-Update Checklist

Before updating, verify these are backed up (they won't be touched, but safety first):

```bash
# Check your backup is recent
ls -la /tmp/alex-prime-backups/

# Or run a fresh backup now
/home/ubuntu/.openclaw/workspace/scripts/daily-backup.sh
```

**Safe files (never touched by updates):**
- `~/.openclaw/openclaw.json` ‚Äî Main config
- `~/.openclaw/workspace/` ‚Äî All personality files (SOUL.md, MEMORY.md, etc.)
- `~/.openclaw/credentials/` ‚Äî API keys, WhatsApp session

---

## üöÄ Update Methods

### Method 1: One-Line Installer (Recommended)

```bash
curl -fsSL https://openclaw.ai/install.sh | bash -s -- --no-onboard
```

This will:
- Detect existing install
- Upgrade in place
- Run `openclaw doctor` automatically
- Keep all your settings

---

### Method 2: Manual NPM Update

```bash
# Step 1: Check current version
openclaw --version

# Step 2: Update to latest
npm i -g openclaw@latest

# Step 3: Run health check
openclaw doctor

# Step 4: Restart gateway
openclaw gateway restart

# Step 5: Verify health
openclaw health
```

---

### Method 3: Update via OpenClaw Command

```bash
# If installed from source (git)
openclaw update

# This does everything automatically:
# - Fetches latest code
# - Installs dependencies
# - Runs doctor
# - Restarts gateway
```

---

## üîß Post-Update Verification

After any update, run these checks:

```bash
# 1. Check new version
openclaw --version

# 2. Check gateway status
openclaw gateway status

# 3. Check system health
openclaw health

# 4. Check logs for errors
openclaw logs --follow
# (Press Ctrl+C to exit logs)
```

---

## üîÑ Switching Update Channels

```bash
# Switch to beta (newer features, less stable)
openclaw update --channel beta

# Switch to dev (bleeding edge)
openclaw update --channel dev

# Switch back to stable
openclaw update --channel stable
```

---

## ‚è™ Rollback (If Something Breaks)

### Rollback to specific version:
```bash
# Install known-good version
npm i -g openclaw@2026.1.29

# Restart
openclaw gateway restart

# Run doctor
openclaw doctor
```

### Check available versions:
```bash
npm view openclaw versions --json | tail -20
```

---

## üîê What's Preserved During Updates

| Component | Location | Preserved? |
|-----------|----------|------------|
| Main config | `~/.openclaw/openclaw.json` | ‚úÖ YES |
| Personality | `~/.openclaw/workspace/` | ‚úÖ YES |
| Credentials | `~/.openclaw/credentials/` | ‚úÖ YES |
| WhatsApp session | `~/.openclaw/credentials/whatsapp/` | ‚úÖ YES |
| Memory database | `~/.openclaw/memory/` | ‚úÖ YES |
| Agent sessions | `~/.openclaw/agents/` | ‚úÖ YES |

---

## üìû Troubleshooting

### Gateway won't start after update:
```bash
openclaw doctor
openclaw gateway restart
```

### Config issues:
```bash
# View current config
openclaw gateway config.get

# Reset to defaults (careful!)
openclaw doctor --repair
```

### Check for errors:
```bash
openclaw logs --follow
```

---

## üìÖ Update Schedule Recommendation

- **Stable releases**: Update monthly
- **Security patches**: Update immediately
- **Major versions**: Test on non-critical system first

---

*For support: https://discord.gg/clawd*
*Docs: https://docs.openclaw.ai*

files.name: REMOTION-SKILLS-GUIDE.md
files.content:
# Remotion Skills Guide ‚Äî Programmatic Video Creation

## What is Remotion?

**Remotion** = React + Video. You write TypeScript/React code ‚Üí export MP4 videos.

- **Creator:** Jonny Burger (Twitter: @JnyBgr)
- **License:** Free for individuals/small teams (3 people)
- **Pricing:** $25/mo per seat (creators) OR $0.01/render + $100/mo min (automation)
- **Output:** Real MP4 files, not screen recordings

---

## Why Remotion for Pulse Graphix?

| Problem | Old Way | Remotion Way |
|---------|---------|--------------|
| 10 TikToks/week | 5 hours editing | 10 minutes generating |
| Consistent branding | Templates in Canva | Code-based templates |
| A/B testing thumbnails | Manual creation | Change one variable, re-render |
| Multi-language content | Re-edit manually | Change text prop, re-render 10 languages |
| Data-driven videos | Impossible | Feed API data ‚Üí generate 100 videos |

---

## Core Concepts

### 1. Frames
Videos are 30-60fps. Frame 0 = start, Frame 900 = 15 seconds at 60fps.

### 2. Interpolation
Smooth transitions using `interpolate()`:
```typescript
const opacity = interpolate(frame, [0, 30], [0, 1]); // Fade in over 1 sec
```

### 3. Spring Animation
Physics-based animations:
```typescript
const scale = spring({frame, fps, config: {damping: 12}});
```

### 4. Sequences
Time-based content organization:
```typescript
<Sequence from={0} durationInFrames={60}> // Frames 0-60
  <Intro />
</Sequence>
<Sequence from={60} durationInFrames={90}> // Frames 60-150
  <MainContent />
</Sequence>
```

---

## Template Library (For Your Use)

### Template 1: "3 Tips" Video
**Platform:** TikTok/Reels (1080√ó1920, 12-15 sec)
**Use case:** Quick tips, listicles, "X things you need to know"
**Code location:** `remotion-templates/VideoTemplate.tsx`

**How to customize:**
```typescript
const TIPS = [
  {emoji: 'üê¢', text: 'Slow load times', color: '#E74C3C'},
  {emoji: 'üì±', text: 'Bad mobile UX', color: '#3498DB'},
  {emoji: 'üîò', text: 'No clear CTA', color: '#27AE60'},
];
// Change this array ‚Üí new video in seconds
```

### Template 2: "Quote Card" Video
**Platform:** All platforms
**Use case:** Motivational content, testimonials
**Animation:** Text reveal line-by-line

### Template 3: "Before/After"
**Platform:** LinkedIn, Instagram
**Use case:** Portfolio showcase
**Animation:** Slider reveal

### Template 4: "Number Counter"
**Platform:** LinkedIn
**Use case:** Stats, results, case studies
**Animation:** Numbers count up

### Template 5: "Day in Life"
**Platform:** TikTok/Reels
**Use case:** Behind the scenes, personal brand
**Animation:** Photo slideshow + text overlays

---

## CLI Commands

```bash
# Start development server (preview in browser)
npx remotion studio src/index.ts

# Render video to MP4
npx remotion render src/index.ts VideoTemplate out/video.mp4

# Render specific composition
npx remotion render src/index.ts MyVideo out.mp4 --props='{"title":"Hello"}'

# Render still frame
npx remotion still src/index.ts TitleCard title.png
```

---

## Integration with Your Workflow

### Plan A: Local Development (Start here)
1. Design templates in code
2. Preview in browser
3. Generate videos manually
4. Upload to social platforms

### Plan B: n8n Automation (Scale up)
```
Google Sheet (content) 
  ‚Üí n8n trigger
    ‚Üí Remotion render API call
      ‚Üí Save to Google Drive
        ‚Üí Buffer/Post to Social
```

### Plan C: Remotion Cloud (Enterprise)
- Use Remotion's Lambda for serverless rendering
- No local setup needed
- Pay per render ($0.01/sec)

---

## Pricing Breakdown

| Plan | Cost | Best For |
|------|------|----------|
| **Free** | $0 | Individuals, testing |
| **Creator** | $25/mo/seat | You making videos for yourself |
| **Automator** | $0.01/render + $100/mo | Building tools for clients |
| **Enterprise** | $500+/mo | Custom contracts |

**Your use case:** Start with Free ‚Üí Creator ($25/mo) ‚Üí Automator if building Pulse Graphix video tool

---

## Sample Commands for Your Workflow

```bash
# Generate 10 quote videos from CSV
cat quotes.csv | xargs -I {} npx remotion render src/index.ts QuoteCard "out/{}.mp4" --props="{\"quote\":\"{}\"}"

# Batch render for the week
for tip in tips/*.json; do
  npx remotion render src/index.ts TipsVideo "out/$(basename $tip .json).mp4" --props="$(cat $tip)"
done
```

---

## Resources

- **Docs:** https://www.remotion.dev/docs
- **Examples:** https://github.com/remotion-dev/remotion/tree/main/packages/example
- **Discord:** https://discord.gg/remotion
- **GitHub:** https://github.com/remotion-dev/remotion

---

*Created: February 25, 2026*
*Status: Remotion installed, first template created*
*Next: Build remaining templates, connect to n8n automation*

files.name: SEARCH_API_ALTERNATIVES.md
files.content:
# Search API Alternatives Research
*For Kabundji ‚Äî February 14, 2026*

## Current Situation
- **Brave Search API**: Free tier = 1 request/second, 2,000 queries/month
- **Status**: Rate limited (hit quota)
- **Need**: Alternative search APIs for prospect research

---

## RECOMMENDED: Google Programmable Search API ‚≠ê

### Free Tier
- **100 queries/day** (3,000/month)
- **$5 per 1,000 queries** after free tier
- **Hard cap**: 10,000 queries/day ($50/day max)

### Pros
- ‚úÖ Google index (largest)
- ‚úÖ JSON API, easy integration
- ‚úÖ Custom search engine setup
- ‚úÖ Region/language filtering
- ‚úÖ Image search available

### Cons
- ‚ùå Not real Google results (simplified, no knowledge graphs)
- ‚ùå Smaller result set than real Google
- ‚ùå May differ from actual Google rankings

### Setup
1. Create Google Cloud account
2. Enable Custom Search JSON API
3. Create Programmable Search Engine
4. Get API key + CX (search engine ID)

### Best For
- Local business prospecting
- General web search automation
- SEO ranking checks

---

## OPTION 2: Bing Search API (Retiring Soon ‚ö†Ô∏è)

### Pricing
- **Free**: 1,000 transactions/month
- **Paid**: $15-25 per 1,000 searches

### ‚ö†Ô∏è CRITICAL: Bing retiring API on August 11, 2025
- Microsoft replacing with "Grounding with Bing Search"
- Only works within Azure AI Foundry
- NOT recommended for new projects

---

## OPTION 3: SerpApi (Paid, Best for Real Results)

### Pricing
- **Developer**: $50/month = 5,000 searches
- **$2 per 1,000** at scale (1M+ searches)
- Can do 100M+ searches/month

### Pros
- ‚úÖ Real Google/Bing/Yahoo/Yandex/DuckDuckGo results
- ‚úÖ All search engines (Google, Bing, Yandex, Baidu, etc.)
- ‚úÖ No rate limits like official APIs
- ‚úÖ Knowledge graphs, carousels, all result types
- ‚úÖ Good for SEO tracking

### Cons
- ‚ùå $50/month minimum
- ‚ùå Web scraping approach (may break if engines change)

### Best For
- High-volume prospecting
- SEO monitoring
- Real Google results needed

---

## OPTION 4: Tavily AI Search API

### Pricing
- **Free**: 1,000 API calls/month
- **Paid**: Starts at ~$0.01 per search

### Pros
- ‚úÖ AI-optimized results
- ‚úÖ Summarized content
- ‚úÖ Good for research tasks

### Cons
- ‚ùå Smaller index than Google
- ‚ùå French locale coverage unknown

---

## OPTION 5: Exa (formerly Metaphor)

### Pricing
- **Free**: 100 searches/month
- **Paid**: $0.015 per search

### Pros
- ‚úÖ Semantic/expert search
- ‚úÖ Good for finding authoritative sources

### Cons
- ‚ùå Smaller index
- ‚ùå Expensive for high volume

---

## COMPARISON TABLE

| Provider | Free Tier | Paid Tier | Real Google? | French Results | Best Use |
|----------|-----------|-----------|--------------|----------------|----------|
| **Brave** (current) | 2,000/mo | $3/1K | No (own index) | ‚úÖ Good | Privacy-focused |
| **Google Custom** ‚≠ê | 3,000/mo | $5/1K | Partial | ‚úÖ Excellent | Best replacement |
| **SerpApi** | None | $2-10/1K | ‚úÖ Yes | ‚úÖ Yes | High volume/SEO |
| **Tavily** | 1,000/mo | ~$0.01/search | AI summarizer | ? | AI research |
| **Exa** | 100/mo | $0.015/search | No (semantic) | ? | Expert search |

---

## RECOMMENDATION

### Immediate Action
1. **Sign up for Google Programmable Search API**
   - 100 free searches/day = enough for prospect research
   - Easy to integrate ($5/1K after free tier)
   - URL: https://programmablesearchengine.google.com/about/

### Long Term
2. **Consider SerpApi** if volume > 5,000/month
   - $50/month for real Google results
   - No rate limits
   - Best for serious prospecting automation

---

## INTEGRATION NOTES

### OpenClaw Config
Currently using `brave` provider. Can switch to:
- `google` (Custom Search API)
- Or use direct HTTP calls to other services

### Contact
Need help with API integration? I can write the config once you have keys.

---

*Research completed: 2026-02-14*  
*Use this for planning which APIs to subscribe to*

files.name: SECURITY_AUDIT_2026-02-13.md
files.content:
# OpenClaw Security Audit Report
**Date:** 2026-02-13  
**System:** Ubuntu 24.04.3 LTS (AWS EC2)  
**User:** ubuntu (non-root)  
**Audit By:** Alex Prime

---

## üö® CRITICAL Finding: Firewall Disabled

**Status:** **INSECURE - IMMEDIATE ACTION REQUIRED**

Ubuntu UFW firewall is **INACTIVE**. Your VPS is exposed on all ports.

```
Status: inactive
```

**Risk:** Any service listening is accessible from the internet without filtering.

**Fix Required:**
```bash
# Enable UFW with safe defaults
sudo ufw default deny incoming
sudo ufw default allow outgoing
sudo ufw allow 22/tcp    # SSH (required for access)
sudo ufw allow 443/tcp   # HTTPS (if using)
sudo ufw allow 80/tcp    # HTTP (if using)
sudo ufw enable

# Verify
sudo ufw status verbose
```

---

## üîë Credentials Security Assessment

### ‚úÖ Good: File Permissions

| File/Directory | Permission | Status |
|----------------|------------|--------|
| `~/.openclaw/credentials/` | 700 (drwx------) | ‚úÖ Secure |
| `~/.openclaw/openclaw.json` | 600 (-rw-------) | ‚úÖ Secure |
| `github_token.txt` | 600 | ‚úÖ Secure |
| `vercel_token.txt` | 600 | ‚úÖ Secure |
| `n8n.json` | 600 | ‚úÖ Secure |
| `google_client_secret.json` | 600 | ‚úÖ Secure |
| `~/.ssh/` | 700 | ‚úÖ Secure |
| `~/.ssh/authorized_keys` | 600 | ‚úÖ Secure |

### ‚ö†Ô∏è API Keys Stored In Plain Text

**Location:** `~/.openclaw/openclaw.json`

API keys are stored in this file with proper permissions (600), but they are:
- Visible to the ubuntu user
- In JSON format (human readable)
- Not encrypted at rest

**Keys Found:**
- OpenRouter API key
- Other model provider keys

**Mitigation:** File permissions prevent other users from reading. This is the expected OpenClaw behavior.

---

## üåê Network Exposure

### Open Ports (Active Listening)

| Port | Protocol | Bind Address | Service | Risk |
|------|----------|--------------|---------|------|
| 22 | TCP | 0.0.0.0 (all) | SSH | ‚ö†Ô∏è Needs firewall |
| 53 | UDP/TCP | 127.0.0.53 | System DNS | ‚úÖ Local only |
| 323 | UDP | 127.0.0.1 | NTP | ‚úÖ Local only |
| 5353 | UDP | 0.0.0.0 / [::] | mDNS (OpenClaw) | ‚ö†Ô∏è Multicast only |
| 18789 | TCP | 127.0.0.1 | OpenClaw Gateway | ‚úÖ Local only |
| 18792 | TCP | 127.0.0.1 | OpenClaw Gateway | ‚úÖ Local only |
| 44573 | UDP | 0.0.0.0 | Ephemeral | Low risk |

**Good News:**
- OpenClaw gateway only listens on localhost (127.0.0.1)
- Cannot be accessed from external network directly

---

## üîí SSH Security

### ‚úÖ Key-Based Authentication
- `~/.ssh/authorized_keys` exists
- Proper permissions (600)
- SSH directory proper permissions (700)

### ‚ö†Ô∏è Unknown Configuration
Could not read `/etc/ssh/sshd_config` (requires sudo)

**Recommended Checks:**
```bash
sudo grep -E "^(PermitRootLogin|PasswordAuthentication|PubkeyAuthentication)" /etc/ssh/sshd_config
```

**Best Practices:**
- `PermitRootLogin no` (disable root login)
- `PasswordAuthentication no` (keys only)
- `PubkeyAuthentication yes` (ensure enabled)

---

## üõ°Ô∏è OpenClaw Security Configuration

### OpenClaw Config File
**Location:** `~/.openclaw/openclaw.json`
- Version: 2026.2.6-3
- Permissions: 600 (good)

### Security Features Available
Run these commands to audit and fix:
```bash
# OpenClaw security audit
openclaw security audit --deep

# Apply safe defaults (prompts before changes)
openclaw security audit --fix
```

---

## üìú Prompt Injection Risks

### Current State
- System prompt includes safety guidelines
- OpenClaw uses instruction hierarchies
- Model-level safety filters active

### Additional Recommendations
1. **Disable tool auto-execution** for critical operations
2. **Add confirmation prompts** before:
   - Sending messages
   - Executing shell commands
   - Accessing credentials
3. **Log all external actions** for review

---

## üîß Remediation Plan

### Priority 1: Enable Firewall (CRITICAL)
```bash
sudo ufw default deny incoming
sudo ufw default allow outgoing
sudo ufw allow 22/tcp
sudo ufw enable
sudo ufw status
```

### Priority 2: Harden SSH
```bash
# Run as root or sudo
sudo sed -i 's/^#*PermitRootLogin.*/PermitRootLogin no/' /etc/ssh/sshd_config
sudo sed -i 's/^#*PasswordAuthentication.*/PasswordAuthentication no/' /etc/ssh/sshd_config
sudo systemctl restart sshd
```

### Priority 3: Enable Automatic Security Updates
```bash
sudo apt install unattended-upgrades
sudo dpkg-reconfigure unattended-upgrades
# Select "Yes" for automatic updates
```

### Priority 4: OpenClaw Security Hardening
```bash
# Run OpenClaw security audit
openclaw security audit --deep

# Review and apply fixes
openclaw security audit --fix
```

### Priority 5: Verify Credentials Security
```bash
# Check all credential files have 600 permissions
ls -la ~/.openclaw/credentials/
ls -la ~/.openclaw/openclaw.json
ls -la ~/.ssh/

# Fix if needed:
chmod 700 ~/.openclaw/credentials/
chmod 600 ~/.openclaw/credentials/*
chmod 600 ~/.openclaw/openclaw.json
chmod 700 ~/.ssh/
chmod 600 ~/.ssh/authorized_keys
```

---

## üìä Security Score

| Category | Score | Notes |
|----------|-------|-------|
| Firewall | üî¥ 0/10 | Disabled - CRITICAL |
| SSH | üü° 6/10 | Key auth, unknown config |
| Credentials | üü¢ 8/10 | Good permissions, plain text |
| OpenClaw | üü¢ 7/10 | Localhost only, needs audit |
| Updates | üü° 5/10 | Unknown auto-update status |
| **Overall** | üü° **5.2/10** | **Fix firewall ASAP** |

---

## üìã Status Check Commands

Run these anytime to verify security:

```bash
# Check firewall
sudo ufw status verbose

# Check open ports
ss -ltnup

# Check OpenClaw security
openclaw security audit --deep

# Check file permissions
ls -la ~/.openclaw/credentials/
ls -la ~/.ssh/

# Check SSH config
sudo grep -E "^(PermitRootLogin|PasswordAuthentication)" /etc/ssh/sshd_config
```

---

## üîÑ Schedule Periodic Audits

Recommend weekly security checks:
```bash
# Add to crontab (run Sundays at 2am)
0 2 * * 0 /usr/local/bin/openclaw security audit --deep >> ~/.openclaw/security-audit.log 2>&1
```

---

## Next Actions Required

1. **Approve firewall enablement?** (Y/N)
2. **Approve SSH hardening?** (Y/N)
3. **Run OpenClaw security audit --fix?** (Y/N)
4. **Schedule weekly security audits?** (Y/N)

---

*Document stored in: `docs/SECURITY_AUDIT_2026-02-13.md`*  
*Last updated: 2026-02-13 16:05 UTC*

# Claude Sonnet 5 "Fennec" Research Report

*Research Date: February 3, 2026*

---

## üî¥ BREAKING: Sonnet 5 May Launch TODAY

A Vertex AI error log leaked `claude-sonnet-5@20260203` pointing to **February 3, 2026** - TODAY.

### What We Know (From Leaks)

| Aspect | Details |
|--------|---------|
| **Codename** | Fennec |
| **Release Date** | Possibly Feb 3, 2026 (unconfirmed) |
| **Pricing** | ~50% cheaper than Opus 4.5 |
| **Performance** | May match or exceed Opus 4.5 |
| **Context Window** | 128k‚Äì1M tokens |
| **SWE-Bench** | 80.9%+ (if true, best coding model) |
| **Infrastructure** | TPU-optimized (Google TPU access) |

### Estimated Pricing Comparison

| Model | Input (per MTok) | Output (per MTok) |
|-------|------------------|-------------------|
| **Opus 4.5** | $5.00 | $25.00 |
| **Sonnet 5** (est) | ~$2.50 | ~$12.50 |
| **Sonnet 4.5** | $3.00 | $15.00 |
| **Haiku 4.5** | $1.00 | $5.00 |

### Key Features (Rumored)

1. **Dev Team Mode** - Autonomous sub-agents for:
   - Backend development
   - QA testing
   - Research
   
2. **Enhanced Claude Code Integration** - Specialized sub-agents working in parallel

3. **TPU-Optimized** - Faster inference, higher throughput

### Credibility Assessment

**Why this might be real:**
- Anthropic announced 1M+ Google TPUs in Oct 2025
- TPU optimization claims align with infrastructure
- Competitive pressure (Gemini 3.5, GPT-5.3 rumors)
- Testing shows strong coding output

**Why to be cautious:**
- No official Anthropic announcement
- Only 10 weeks since Sonnet 4.5
- Could be internal test build
- Anthropic doesn't typically surprise-drop models

---

## üí∞ Cost Impact Analysis

If Sonnet 5 matches Opus 4.5 quality at half the price:

### Current Monthly Estimate (Opus 4.5)
- ~600k tokens/day average
- ~18M tokens/month
- Cost: ~$350-500/month at full price

### With Sonnet 5 (~50% cheaper)
- Same usage: ~$175-250/month
- **Potential savings: $150-250/month**

### Combined with Guide Optimizations

| Optimization | Monthly Savings |
|--------------|-----------------|
| Sonnet 5 as brain | ~$150+ |
| Haiku for heartbeat | ~$50+ |
| Free tiers for fallback | ~$50+ |
| **Total Potential** | **~$250+/month** |

---

## üéØ Recommendation

### Immediate Actions
1. ‚úÖ Configure Haiku 4.5 for heartbeat (done)
2. ‚úÖ Set heartbeat interval to 1 hour (done)
3. ‚úÖ Use Kimi K2.5/Groq for subagents (done)

### When Sonnet 5 Launches
1. Add to config as soon as available
2. Test on coding tasks first
3. If performance matches Opus, consider as primary
4. Keep Opus as premium fallback

### Monitor
- Anthropic blog/X for official announcement
- API model list for `claude-3-5-sonnet` or similar
- OpenRouter for immediate availability

---

## üîó Sources

---

*This report is based on unconfirmed leaks. Wait for official Anthropic announcement before major changes.*

# Subagent Pyramid Architecture
*Proposed Multi-Agent System for Pulse Graphix*  
*Design: 2026-02-14 | Status: Draft for Review*

---

## Overview

**Goal:** Scale Alex Prime's capabilities by delegating to specialized subagents  
**Structure:** 1 Executive (Alex Prime) ‚Üí 4 Managers ‚Üí 15+ Specialists

```
                    ‚îå‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îê
                    ‚îÇ  Alex Prime ‚îÇ
                    ‚îÇ  (You)      ‚îÇ
                    ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚î¨‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îò
                           ‚îÇ
           ‚îå‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚î¨‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îº‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚î¨‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îê
           ‚ñº       ‚ñº       ‚ñº       ‚ñº       ‚ñº
        ‚îå‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îê ‚îå‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îê ‚îå‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îê ‚îå‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îê
        ‚îÇBD  ‚îÇ ‚îÇOPS ‚îÇ ‚îÇDEV ‚îÇ ‚îÇMKT ‚îÇ
        ‚îÇMgr ‚îÇ ‚îÇMgr ‚îÇ ‚îÇMgr ‚îÇ ‚îÇMgr ‚îÇ
        ‚îî‚îÄ‚î¨‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îò ‚îî‚îÄ‚î¨‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îò ‚îî‚îÄ‚î¨‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îò ‚îî‚îÄ‚î¨‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îò
          ‚îÇ      ‚îÇ      ‚îÇ      ‚îÇ
       3-4    3-4    3-4    3-4
     Agents  Agents  Agents  Agents
```

---

## Manager Agents (4)

### 1. BD Manager ‚Äî "Kai"
**Focus:** Business Development, Prospecting, Sales

**Reports to:** Alex Prime  
**Manages:**
- Research Agent ‚Äî Lead discovery, qualification
- Outreach Agent ‚Äî Cold calling, email sequences
- Proposal Agent ‚Äî Quote generation, presentations
- Closer Agent ‚Äî Negotiation, contract signing

**KPIs:**
- Leads generated per week
- Conversion rate (lead ‚Üí meeting ‚Üí client)
- Revenue per quarter

**Skills Required:**
- `web_search` ‚Äî Find prospects
- `web_fetch` ‚Äî Research companies
- `message` ‚Äî Send outreach
- `sessions_spawn` ‚Äî Delegate research tasks

---

### 2. Ops Manager ‚Äî "Aria"
**Focus:** Operations, Admin, Client Management

**Reports to:** Alex Prime  
**Manages:**
- Project Agent ‚Äî Timeline tracking, deliverables
- Finance Agent ‚Äî Invoicing, payments, reporting
- Support Agent ‚Äî Client communication, tickets
- CRM Agent ‚Äî Data entry, follow-ups

**KPIs:**
- On-time delivery rate
- Client satisfaction score
- Invoice-to-payment time

**Skills Required:**
- `gog` ‚Äî Calendar, email
- `cron` ‚Äî Scheduled tasks
- `n8n` ‚Äî Workflow automation
- `memory_search` ‚Äî Context retrieval

---

### 3. Dev Manager ‚Äî "Zen"
**Focus:** Development, Templates, Technical Output

**Reports to:** Alex Prime  
**Manages:**
- Frontend Agent ‚Äî HTML, CSS, React components
- Framer Agent ‚Äî Template building, marketplace
- Automation Agent ‚Äî n8n workflows, scripts
- QA Agent ‚Äî Testing, validation

**KPIs:**
- Templates shipped per month
- Code quality score
- Client project delivery time

**Skills Required:**
- `write`/`edit` ‚Äî Code generation
- `exec` ‚Äî Testing, deployment
- `browser` ‚Äî Visual QA
- `canvas` ‚Äî Asset generation

---

### 4. Marketing Manager ‚Äî "Nova"
**Focus:** Content, Social, Brand

**Reports to:** Alex Prime  
**Manages:**
- Content Agent ‚Äî Blog posts, case studies
- Social Agent ‚Äî LinkedIn, Twitter posts
- Design Agent ‚Äî Graphics, thumbnails
- Video Agent ‚Äî Scripts, editing guidance

**KPIs:**
- Content pieces per week
- Engagement rate
- Lead attribution from content

**Skills Required:**
- `web_search` ‚Äî Topic research
- `image` ‚Äî Thumbnail/design generation
- `tts` ‚Äî Voice content
- `message` ‚Äî Social posting

---

## Specialist Agents (15)

| Manager | Specialist | Role | Key Tools |
|---------|-----------|------|-----------|
| **Kai (BD)** | Research Agent | Lead discovery | web_search, web_fetch |
| | Outreach Agent | Cold outreach | message, memory |
| | Proposal Agent | Quotes/proposals | write, canvas |
| | Closer Agent | Negotiation | message, sessions_send |
| **Aria (Ops)** | Project Agent | Timeline tracking | cron, gog, memory |
| | Finance Agent | Invoicing | write, gog |
| | Support Agent | Client comms | message, sessions_send |
| | CRM Agent | Data management | n8n, memory |
| **Zen (Dev)** | Frontend Agent | HTML/CSS/React | write, edit, browser |
| | Framer Agent | Template builder | browser, exec |
| | Automation Agent | n8n/scripts | write, exec |
| | QA Agent | Testing | browser, exec |
| **Nova (Mkt)** | Content Agent | Writing | write, web_search |
| | Social Agent | Posting | message |
| | Design Agent | Graphics | canvas, image |

---

## Communication Flow

```
Kabundji ‚Üí Alex Prime (Executive)
                ‚îÇ
                ‚îú‚îÄ‚Üí Kai (BD) ‚Üí [Research, Outreach, Proposal, Closer]
                ‚îú‚îÄ‚Üí Aria (Ops) ‚Üí [Project, Finance, Support, CRM]
                ‚îú‚îÄ‚Üí Zen (Dev) ‚Üí [Frontend, Framer, Automation, QA]
                ‚îî‚îÄ‚Üí Nova (Mkt) ‚Üí [Content, Social, Design, Video]
```

**Protocol:**
1. Specialists report to Managers
2. Managers report to Alex Prime
3. Alex Prime reports to Kabundji
4. Emergency escalations skip levels

---

## Implementation Phases

### Phase 1: Foundation (Week 1-2)
- [ ] Create 4 Manager agent definitions
- [ ] Set up session spawning templates
- [ ] Define handoff protocols
- [ ] Test with simple task delegation

### Phase 2: Core Team (Week 3-4)
- [ ] Deploy Kai (BD) + Research Agent
- [ ] Deploy Zen (Dev) + Frontend Agent
- [ ] Set up reporting dashboards
- [ ] Refine communication patterns

### Phase 3: Full Pyramid (Month 2)
- [ ] Add remaining Specialists
- [ ] Automate manager-to-manager handoffs
- [ ] Build overview dashboard
- [ ] Optimize based on usage patterns

### Phase 4: Autonomy (Month 3+)
- [ ] Managers self-delegate to Specialists
- [ ] Alex Prime only escalations + strategic
- [ ] Weekly all-hands summary reports

---

## Cost Projection

| Resource | Estimate | Notes |
|----------|----------|-------|
| Sessions/month | ~500 | 4 managers √ó daily + specialists |
| Avg session cost | $0.05 | Quick tasks, cached context |
| Monthly cost | ~$25 | Negligible vs value generated |
| Setup time | 20 hours | One-time investment |

---

## Technical Setup

### Session Spawning Pattern
```javascript
// Example: Delegate research task to Kai's Research Agent
sessions_spawn({
  agentId: "kai-research-agent",
  task: "Find 10 boulangerie prospects in Torcy without websites",
  label: "prospect-research-001",
  timeout: 300
})
```

### Communication Template
```
[FROM: Kai (BD Manager)]
[TO: Alex Prime]
[TYPE: Daily Report]

‚úÖ Completed: 5 prospects researched
üîç Found: C.C.P Fournil, Le Belv√©d√®re, Pho Quynh...
üìä Conversion: 4 qualified, 1 low priority
‚è∞ Next: Outreach tomorrow 14h

[Attach: prospects/daily-YYYY-MM-DD.md]
```

---

## ACTION REQUIRED

**For Kabundji Review:**
1. [ ] Approve architecture design
2. [ ] Prioritize which managers to deploy first
3. [ ] Decide: Build all at once or phased?
4. [ ] Resource allocation approval

---

*Document: `docs/SUBAGENT-PYRAMID-ARCHITECTURE.md`*  
*Next Step: Deploy Kai (BD Manager) + Research Agent as MVP*

| Aura | Monthly? | Medium (speed tool) | MEDIUM |

### Aura

# HEARTBEAT.md

## ‚ö†Ô∏è CRITICAL: DO ACTUAL WORK, NOT JUST ACK!
Kabundji's directive: "You haven't been productive" ‚Äî use heartbeat time for REAL work.

## On Each Heartbeat (every 10 min):

### 1. Update Dashboard Status (MANDATORY!)
Run the data sync script to generate fresh status.json + data.json from workspace, then push:
```bash
cd /home/ubuntu/.openclaw/workspace
VERCEL_TOKEN=$(cat credentials/vercel_token.txt)
# Alex Prime dashboard
node scripts/generate-dashboard-data.js
cd dashboard && git add -A && git commit -m "Heartbeat $(date +%H:%M)" && git push origin main && vercel --prod --yes --token "$VERCEL_TOKEN"
# Pulse Graphix dashboard
cd /home/ubuntu/.openclaw/workspace
node scripts/generate-pulse-graphix-data.js
cd pulse-graphix-dashboard && git add -A && git commit -m "Heartbeat $(date +%H:%M)" && git push origin main && vercel --prod --yes --force --token "$VERCEL_TOKEN"
```

Dashboard URL: https://dashboard-ten-mu-52.vercel.app

Fields to update:
- `lastUpdate` ‚Äî current timestamp
- `lastHeartbeat` ‚Äî current timestamp  
- `status` ‚Äî active/working/idle
- `currentTask` ‚Äî what you're doing RIGHT NOW
- `recentActions` ‚Äî last 5 things you did
- `pendingTasks` ‚Äî what's next
- `completedTasks` ‚Äî what's done

### 2. CHECK FOR PENDING WORK (ALWAYS)
Read `TODO.md` ‚Äî if there's unfinished work, **DO IT NOW**. Don't wait for instructions.

### 3. Quick Checks (rotate through these)
- [ ] Unread urgent emails (gog CLI)
- [ ] Calendar events in next 2 hours
- [ ] Any new messages to respond to

### 4. PRODUCTIVE ACTIONS (pick at least one if nothing urgent)
- Continue unfinished tasks from TODO.md
- Build/improve templates or tools
- Create marketing drafts
- Research leads
- Organize files
- Commit and push changes

### 5. Log Activity
Append note to `memory/YYYY-MM-DD.md` if something notable happened.

---

## üö® RULES FOR HEARTBEAT RESPONSES:
- **If there's pending work** ‚Üí DO THE WORK, don't say HEARTBEAT_OK
- **If you completed something** ‚Üí Report what you did
- **Only reply HEARTBEAT_OK** if you genuinely checked everything AND there's nothing to do

*"I want to wake up every morning and be like, 'Wow, you got a lot done while I was sleeping.'"* ‚Äî Kabundji

files.name: content-week-1.md
files.content:
# Week 1 Content Plan ‚Äî Pulse Graphix
## 15 Posts Across 5 Platforms (Feb 26 - Mar 4)

---

## LINKEDIN (5 posts)

### Post 1: Thought Leadership (Monday)
**Hook:** "95% of business websites are leaking money."

**Body:**
Here's what 20 years in tech has taught me:

Your website isn't a brochure.
It's a 24/7 salesperson.

Yet most businesses treat it like an expense instead of an investment.

3 signs your website is costing you customers:

1Ô∏è‚É£ Loads slower than 3 seconds = 53% of mobile visitors bounce
2Ô∏è‚É£ No clear CTA = visitors don't know what to do
3Ô∏è‚É£ No social proof = visitors don't trust you

Fix these 3 things and watch your inquiry rate climb.

Or keep wondering why competitors book more calls.

Your move.

**Hashtags:** #WebDesign #SmallBusiness #DigitalMarketing #Entrepreneurship

---

### Post 2: Portfolio Showcase (Wednesday)
**Visual:** Before/after website mockup

**Body:**
Before: Generic template, blurry images, broken mobile layout
After: Clean custom design, optimized photos, perfect mobile experience

**Result:** Client went from 2 inquiries/month to 12.

Lesson: Design isn't decoration. Design is revenue.

Swipe for the full transformation ‚Üí

[Link to case study]

**Hashtags:** #WebDesign #BeforeAfter #CaseStudy #DesignThinking

---

### Post 3: Checklist (Friday)
**Hook:** "Website Audit Checklist: Does yours pass?"

**Body:**
Your website has 10 seconds to convince visitors.

Here's your 10-point survival checklist:

‚òëÔ∏è Loads under 3 seconds
‚òëÔ∏è Mobile-first design
‚òëÔ∏è Clear headline (what you do)
‚òëÔ∏è Visible contact info
‚òëÔ∏è Pricing or "starting at"
‚òëÔ∏è Portfolio/examples
‚òëÔ∏è Testimonials/reviews
‚òëÔ∏è Social media links
‚òëÔ∏è Booking form/button
‚òëÔ∏è SSL certificate (https)

How many did you check?

1-3: üö® Critical
4-6: ‚ö†Ô∏è Needs work
7-10: ‚úÖ Strong

Comment your score üëá

**Hashtags:** #WebsiteTips #SmallBusiness #DigitalPresence

---

### Post 4: Personal Story (Sunday)
**Hook:** "I almost quit after my first client."

**Body:**
2004. First freelance gig.

Client wanted a website. Simple enough.

3 weeks of work. Countless revisions. Sleepless nights.

Delivery day: "This isn't what I wanted." Refused payment.

I was devastated. Questioning everything.

Then my mentor said something that changed everything:

"You didn't fail. You learned what questions to ask next time."

I went back. Asked better questions. Understood the vision.

Redesigned it. Client paid. Referred 3 friends.

20 years later: lesson still applies.

The client isn't the enemy. Clarity is the solution.

**Hashtags:** #FreelanceLife #Entrepreneurship #DesignThinking

---

### Post 5: Poll (Tuesday)
**Question:** What's your biggest website challenge?

**Options:**
A) Getting traffic to the site
B) Converting visitors to customers
C) Mobile optimization
D) Don't have a website yet

**Follow-up:** Will comment with solutions based on top response.

**Hashtags:** #Poll #WebDesign #SmallBusiness

---

## INSTAGRAM STORIES (5 stories daily = 35, here are highlights)

### Story 1: Behind the Scenes
**Visual:** Screenshot of design tools, workspace
**Text:** "Designing websites in Paris at 7 AM. Coffee ‚òï code üíª repeat."
**Sticker:** Location Paris

### Story 2: Quick Tip
**Visual:** Canva-made graphic with tip
**Text:** "üöÄ Quick Win: Add your phone number to your website header. 47% more calls."
**CTA:** "Swipe up for more tips"

### Story 3: Before/After Reveal
**Visual:** Split screen comparison
**Text:** "Client transformation üéØ"
**Interactive:** Poll sticker ‚Äî "Which grabs you? Left or Right?"

### Story 4: Question Sticker
**Visual:** Typing on keyboard
**Text:** "Working on something new. What website feature do you wish you had?"
**Interactive:** Question sticker responses

### Story 5: Testimonial
**Visual:** Quote card design
**Text:** "3x more bookings in 2 months" ‚Äî Sarah, Bakery Owner
**CTA:** "DM 'WEBSITE' for details"

---

## TIKTOK/REELS (3 videos)

### Video 1: "3 Website Mistakes Costing You Money"
**Hook:** (0-3 sec) Point at camera: "Your website is losing customers. Here's why."
**Content:**
- Mistake #1: No clear CTA
- Mistake #2: Slow loading
- Mistake #3: Bad mobile design
**CTA:** "Follow for more web tips"
**Music:** Trending chime/success sound

### Video 2: "POV: Before vs After Website Redesign"
**Visual:** Side-by-side scroll through both sites
**Hook:** "POV: You finally invested in a proper website"
**Text overlays:**
- BEFORE: "Templated. Generic. Ignored."
- AFTER: "Custom. Bold. Booked out."
**CTA:** "Which would you choose?"

### Video 3: "Day in the Life: Web Designer/Founder"
**Content:** Morning routine ‚Üí client call ‚Üí design work ‚Üí coffee break ‚Üí evening review
**Behind the scenes:** Real workspace, real process
**Trending audio:** Popular motivational/inspirational track
**Text:** "Building digital dreams in Paris üá´üá∑"

---

## FACEBOOK (2 posts)

### Post 1: Educational (Thursday)
**Headline:** "Why Your Website Isn't Converting (And How to Fix It)"

**Body:**
You've spent money on ads. You have traffic.
But the phone isn't ringing.

Here's the uncomfortable truth: your website is the problem.

5 conversion killers:

1. Confusing navigation ‚Äî Visitors can't find what they need
2. No clear value proposition ‚Äî They don't know why to choose you
3. Weak calls-to-action ‚Äî "Contact us" isn't compelling
4. Missing trust signals ‚Äî No reviews, testimonials, or proof
5. Poor mobile experience ‚Äî 60%+ of your traffic is mobile

The fix? Audit your site against these 5 points. Be brutal.

Your website should work harder than you do.

**Hashtags:** #WebDesignTips #SmallBusinessGrowth #DigitalMarketing

### Post 2: Engagement (Saturday)
**Question:** "What made you choose your current website platform? WordPress? Wix? Squarespace? Something else?"

**Follow-up strategy:** Comments asking about their experience ‚Üí DM with tailored advice ‚Üí soft pitch for Pulse Graphix services

---

## YOUTUBE COMMUNITY (1 post)

### Community Post
**Visual:** Thumbnail sneak peek
**Text:** "New video dropping Thursday: 'How to Build a Website That Actually Converts' ‚Äî Are you subscribed so you don't miss it?"
**Poll:** "What's your biggest website struggle? A) Design | B) Traffic | C) Conversions | D) Tech"

# Email Sequences ‚Äî All 4 Companies

**Created:** 2026-02-20 (Overnight session)  
**Status:** Drafts ready for review  
**Path:** `/home/ubuntu/.openclaw/workspace/marketing/email-sequences/`

---

## üìß What's Included

4 complete 3-email sequences for automated cold outreach:

| Company | Sequence File | Target | CTA Strategy |
|---------|--------------|--------|--------------|
| **Pulse Graphix** | `email-sequence-pulse-graphix.html` | Local businesses (restaurants, salons, shops) | Free 15-min call + free audit |
| **Nexus AI Academy** | `email-sequence-nexus-ai.html` | Companies needing AI team training | AI skills gap assessment + consultation |
| **Invest in Congo** | `email-sequence-invest-congo.html` | Investors interested in DRC | Private briefing + NDA deals |
| **Pulse Architects** | `email-sequence-pulse-architects.html` | Architects needing portfolio + revenue | Portfolio demo + revenue calculator |

---

## üìÖ Email Sequence Structure

### Email 1 ‚Äî Introduction (Day 0)
- **Goal:** Get attention, establish credibility
- **Content:** Problem observation + solution preview + soft CTA
- **Tone:** Helpful, observant, not salesy

### Email 2 ‚Äî Value/Proof (Day 3-5)
- **Goal:** Build trust, show results
- **Content:** Case study/story + specific numbers + free resource
- **Tone:** Informative, social proof-focused

### Email 3 ‚Äî Final CTA (Day 7-14)
- **Goal:** Get commitment or permission to stay in touch
- **Content:** Two clear options + graceful exit + newsletter offer
- **Tone:** Respectful, professional, non-pushy

---

## üé® Design Features

- **Dark theme:** Matches current UI aesthetic
- **Brand colors:** Each company has its signature palette
- **Responsive:** Works on mobile and desktop
- **Template variables:** `{{first_name}}`, `{{business_name}}`, etc.
- **Unsubscribe:** GDPR-compliant footer on every email

---

## ‚öôÔ∏è How to Use

1. **Review** the HTML files in-browser (open in Chrome/Firefox)
2. **Customize** the template variables at the top:
   - Replace `{{first_name}}` with actual first name
   - Replace `{{calendar_link}}` with your Calendly/Cal.com URL
   - Replace case study details with real examples
3. **Extract** the HTML for your email platform (remove the preview wrapper)
4. **Test** send to yourself before live deployment
5. **Automate** via n8n, Mailchimp, or similar (set delays between emails)

---

## üîÑ Integration Options

| Platform | How to integrate |
|----------|-----------------|
| **n8n** | HTML node + delay node + Gmail/SendGrid node |
| **Mailchimp** | Import HTML as template, set automation workflow |
| **Brevo** | Create campaign, paste HTML, set trigger rules |
| **HubSpot** | Email template + workflow automation |

---

## üìù Next Steps (Pending Kabundji Approval)

- [ ] Review tone and messaging
- [ ] Add real case studies (currently placeholders)
- [ ] Replace `{{calendar_link}}` with actual Calendly URLs
- [ ] Set up email automation in n8n or chosen platform
- [ ] Test send sequences to yourself first
- [ ] Launch to prospect lists

---

## üí° Optional Enhancements

- Add A/B test variants (different subject lines)
- Create plain-text fallback versions
- Add tracking pixel for open/click rates
- Segment by industry (different sequences per sector)
- Add SMS follow-up for non-openers

---

**Ready for review!** Check each HTML file to see the full email preview with styling. üéØ

files.name: likelemba-gtm-strategy.md
files.content:
# Likelemba Go-To-Market Strategy
## Digital Marketing Plan for African ROSCA App Launch

---

## Executive Summary

**Product:** Likelemba ‚Äî Flutter mobile app digitizing traditional African ROSCA (tontine/likelemba) savings groups
**Target Market:** DRC (primary), expanding across Africa
**Launch Timeline:** TBD ‚Äî awaiting Google Play approval
**Budget Estimate:** $0-$2,000/month for organic + paid growth

---

## Phase 1: Pre-Launch (Weeks -4 to 0)

### 1.1 Landing Page & Waitlist
**Objective:** Collect emails/phone numbers before app launch

**Components:**
- Simple one-page landing (Webflow/Framer)
- Headline: "Likelemba ‚Äî La tontine, version 2024"
- Subheadline: "G√©rez vos groupes d'√©pargne comme un pro. Simple. S√©curis√©. Gratuit."
- Email + WhatsApp signup form
- "Soyez inform√© du lancement" CTA
- Demo video placeholder (30 sec teaser)
- Testimonials from beta users (once available)

**Platforms:**
- Facebook Page: Likelemba DRC
- Instagram: @likelemba.app
- TikTok: @likelemba (short educational content)

### 1.2 Content Teaser Campaign

**WhatsApp Status/Broadcast (Daily):**
- J-7: "Quelque chose de grand arrive pour les √©panueurs √† Kinshasa..."
- J-5: "Tired of Excel sheets for your tontine? There's a better way."
- J-3: Sneak peek screenshot
- J-1: "Demain. 9h. Soyez pr√™ts."

**TikTok Teasers (3 videos before launch):**
- Video 1: "POV: You still manage tontine with WhatsApp groups"
- Video 2: "How Likelemba works" (screen recording)
- Video 3: "Meet the founder" ‚Äî your story

---

## Phase 2: Launch Week (Days 0-7)

### 2.1 Day 0 ‚Äî Go Live

**WhatsApp Broadcast (to waitlist):**
```
üéâ LIKELEMBA EST LANC√â!

T√©l√©chargez maintenant: [link]

‚úÖ G√©rez vos groupes d'√©pargne
‚úÖ Suivez les paiements automatiquement
‚úÖ Recevez des notifications
‚úÖ 100% gratuit

Commencez votre premi√®re tontine en 5 minutes.

Chicco & L'√©quipe Likelemba
```

**Facebook/Instagram Launch Post:**
- Carousel: 5 slides showing app features
- Caption with download link
- Paid boost: $50/day for 3 days targeting Kinshasa

### 2.2 Days 1-3 ‚Äî Organic Spread

**WhatsApp Groups Strategy:**
- Join 20 Kinshasa community groups
- Soft pitch: "Qui ici g√®re une tontine? J'ai cr√©√© une app qui simplifie tout √ßa"
- Link to app
- Follow up with individual DMs

**TikTok Launch Series:**
- Day 1: "L'application que j'ai cod√©e en Flutter"
- Day 2: "Comment cr√©er une tontine en 60 secondes"
- Day 3: User testimonials (if available)

### 2.3 Days 4-7 ‚Äî Influencer Push

**Micro-Influencer Outreach:**
- Target: Kinshasa-based TikTokers (10k-100k followers)
- Pitch: Free Premium subscription for review
- Budget: 5 influencers √ó $50 = $250

**Facebook Groups:**
- "Entrepreneurs de Kinshasa"
- "Tontine RDC"
- "√âpargne et Investissement Afrique"
- Soft introduction + value-add content

---

## Phase 3: Growth (Week 2+)

### 3.1 Referral Program

**Mechanics:**
- "Invite un ami, gagne $1 de cr√©dit"
- Unique referral code per user
- Track in-app
- Push notification: "Vous avez gagn√© $1! Continuez √† inviter."

**WhatsApp Share Template:**
```
Je viens de d√©couvrir Likelemba pour g√©rer les tontines.
C'est gratuit et super pratique!

T√©l√©charge avec mon code: [CODE]
On gagne tous les deux $1 üòâ

[link]
```

### 3.2 Content Calendar

**Weekly Rhythm:**

| Day | Platform | Content |
|-----|----------|---------|
| Mon | LinkedIn | Founder story, fintech trends |
| Tue | TikTok | Quick tip/tutorial |
| Wed | Instagram | User testimonial |
| Thu | WhatsApp | Group savings tips |
| Fri | TikTok | "Results of the week" |
| Sat | Facebook | Community spotlight |
| Sun | All | Week ahead preview |

### 3.3 Paid Advertising (Month 2+)

**Facebook/Instagram Ads:**
- Audience: Kinshasa, 25-45, interested in finance/savings
- Creative: Screen recordings, testimonials
- Budget: $300/month
- Objective: App installs

**Google Play ASO:**
- Keywords: "tontine RDC", "√©pargne groupe", "likelemba", "ROSCA"
- Screenshots: 5 key features
- Description: Optimized for search
- Reviews: Encourage 5-star ratings

---

## Target Metrics (First 90 Days)

| Metric | Target |
|--------|--------|
| App Downloads | 5,000 |
| Active Groups | 500 |
| Monthly Active Users | 2,000 |
| WhatsApp Waitlist (pre-launch) | 500 |
| Social Followers | 1,000 |
| Referral Rate | 15% |

---

## Content Templates

### WhatsApp Status Templates

**Template 1: Educational**
```
üí° Le saviez-vous?

Les tontines en Afrique repr√©sentent plus de $50 milliards par an.

Likelemba vous aide √† g√©rer votre part de mani√®re professionnelle.

#Likelemba #Tontine #Epargne
```

**Template 2: Social Proof**
```
"Likelemba a chang√© notre fa√ßon de g√©rer la tontine familiale."
‚Äî Marie, Kinshasa

Rejoignez les [X] groupes qui utilisent d√©j√† l'app.

[link]
```

**Template 3: Feature Spotlight**
```
üÜï NOUVEAUT√â: Notifications automatiques

Plus besoin de rappeler les membres de payer.
Likelemba le fait pour vous.

Mettez √† jour: [link]
```

### TikTok Scripts

**Script 1: Problem/Solution**
```
HOOK: "Vous g√©rez encore vos tontines sur WhatsApp?"

PROBLEM: Stress, oublis, mauvaise humeur quand quelqu'un paie pas

SOLUTION: Likelemba ‚Äî liasse l'app flag ebele

CTA: "Lien en bio. Gratuit."
```

**Script 2: Tutorial**
```
HOOK: "Comment cr√©er une tontine en 60 secondes"

DEMO: Screen recording showing
1. Open app
2. Tap "+ Nouveau groupe"
3. Add members
4. Set amount & cycle
5. Done

CTA: "Tague quelqu'un qui en a besoin"
```

---

## Competitive Positioning

| Competitor | Likelemba Advantage |
|------------|---------------------|
| WhatsApp groups | Automated tracking, no spam |
| Excel sheets | Mobile-first, real-time sync |
| Traditional tontine | Transparency, security, history |
| WhatsApp Pay | Multiple payment options, group management |

**Key Messages:**
- "La transparence que votre tontine m√©rite"
- "Plus de stress, plus de r√©sultats"
- "Gratuit pour les petits groupes"

---

## Budget Summary (Month 1)

| Item | Cost |
|------|------|
| Landing page (Framer) | $0 (free tier) |
| Facebook/Instagram ads | $150 |
| TikTok organic | $0 |
| Influencer partnerships | $250 |
| Referral incentives | $100 |
| **Total** | **$500** |

---

## Risk Mitigation

**Risk:** Low initial downloads
**Mitigation:** Heavy WhatsApp leveraging, personal network activation

**Risk:** Technical issues at launch
**Mitigation:** Beta testing with 50 users first

**Risk:** Competition from established fintechs
**Mitigation:** Focus on community/tontine niche, not general banking

---

## Next Steps

1. ‚úÖ Create landing page
2. ‚úÖ Set up social media accounts
3. ‚úÖ Produce 5 TikTok videos
4. ‚úÖ Build waitlist (target: 500)
5. ‚è≥ Submit to Google Play
6. ‚è≥ Soft launch with beta users
7. ‚è≥ Full launch campaign

---

*Created: February 26, 2026*
*For: Likelemba Flutter App Launch*
*Markets: DRC ‚Üí Africa*

files.name: posts-batch-1.md
files.content:
# LinkedIn Post Drafts - Batch 1 (Feb 18-21, 2026)
*Ready for Kabundji's review and approval*

---

## Post 1: Thought Leadership - AI Transformation
**Type:** Perspective/Opinion | **Hook:** Strong opening statement | **CTA:** Comment your experience

### Draft:

"AI won't replace designers. But designers who use AI will replace those who don't.

I've seen the divide forming in real-time:

‚Üí 6 months ago: "AI art is a trend"
‚Üí Today: Top agencies using AI deliver 3x faster, slash costs by 40%
‚Üí 6 months from now: It'll be the baseline expectation

Here's what most get wrong:

‚ùå Thinking AI is a replacement (it's a multiplier)
‚ùå Using generic outputs (you still need taste + direction)
‚ùå Ignoring the craftsmanship that clients actually pay for

What clients want hasn't changed:
- Strategy that understands their business
- Designs that convert, not just look pretty
- Partners who think, not just execute

AI just removed the 80% of repetitive work that's been slowing you down.

The designers winning right now?
They spend 20% less time on production.
They reinvest that time into:
‚Üí Better client conversations
‚Üí Sharper strategy
‚Üí Higher-margin creative work

---

3 questions for my network:

1. Which side of this divide are you building toward?
2. What repetitive tasks are you trying to eliminate?
3. What would you create with 20% more time?

Drop a comment ‚Äî I'm curious where everyone stands on this change.

---

#DesignAgency #AITransformation #BusinessStrategy #CreativeDirection #PulseGraphix"

---

## Post 2: Portfolio Showcase (Carousel Style)
**Type:** Visual showcase | **Hook:** "Swipe through this transformation" | **CTA:** Visit profile

### Draft:

"85% of businesses in our local market have websites that lose customers instead of attracting them.

Swipe through 4 transformations we delivered this quarter üé®

‚Üí Slide 1: Before (cluttered, confusing, mobile-unfriendly)
‚Üí Slide 2: After (clean hierarchy, clear CTAs, 40% faster load)
‚Üí Slide 3: Results (metrics + client testimonial)
‚Üí Slide 4: The process (AI-assisted + human craft)

üìä Real numbers from a recent project:
- Page load: 4.2s ‚Üí 1.1s
- Bounce rate: 68% ‚Üí 34%
- Mobile conversion: +127%

The client almost gave up on their website entirely. They thought "people just don't buy from small businesses online."

Turns out?
People don't buy from confusing websites. Period.

Big or small, the principles are the same:
‚úì Clear value in 3 seconds
‚úì Trust signals front-loaded
‚úì Friction removed at every step

DM "AUDIT" if you'd like me to look at your current site ‚Äî I'll send you 3 quick wins, no pitch.

---

#WebDesign #ConversionOptimization #LocalBusiness #BeforeAfter #PulseGraphix"

---

## Post 3: Value Checklist (High-engagement format)
**Type:** "Save this" content | **Hook:** "Bookmark this" | **CTA:** Follow for more

### Draft:

"üö® Graphic design red flags that scream 'amateur':

If your designer does these, get a second opinion before you pay:

‚ùå 1. No grid system ‚Äî Everything placed 'by eye'
‚ùå 2. 3+ fonts on one page (chaos, not character)
‚ùå 3. No hierarchy ‚Äî your eye doesn't know where to go first
‚ùå 4. Stock photos that don't match your brand tone
‚ùå 5. Center-aligned body text (hard to read long-form)
‚ùå 6. Generic color palettes (blue/gray for tech, red for urgency)
‚ùå 7. Design without strategy ‚Äî "looks good" isn't the goal

Here's what separates professionals:

‚úÖ Grid systems that create visual rhythm
‚úÖ 1-2 fonts max, used with intention
‚úÖ Clear visual hierarchy (what's most important?)
‚úÖ Curated imagery that reinforces brand story
‚úÖ Left-aligned body text for readability
‚úÖ Colors chosen for psychology, not trends
‚úÖ Every design decision tied to business outcome

My rule: If you can't explain WHY a design choice was made, it shouldn't be there.

---

üíæ Save this for your next project brief.

üìå Bookmark for your next designer screening.

üîî Follow for weekly design tips (I post these every Tuesday)

---

#DesignTips #Branding101 #HiringDesigners #GraphicDesign #MarketingMaterials #PulseGraphix"

---

## Post 4: Lesson Learned / Behind the Scenes
**Type:** Story/Personal insight | **Hook:** "I used to think..." | **CTA:** Share your story

### Draft:

"I used to say yes to every project.

'Of course I can do that website'
'Logo design? Easy'
'Can you also do the copywriting? Sure'

Then I hit burnout. And my work suffered. And clients were... fine, not thrilled.

The turning point? Saying no.

I turned down 3 projects last month. All paid decent money.

Why?

They weren't a fit. And 'decent money' is expensive if it costs your reputation.

Now I run every opportunity through this filter:

‚Üí Is this in my core competency? (Design + AI)
‚Üí Does this client understand the value? (not just price)
‚Üí Will this work sample attract similar clients I want?
‚Üí Can I deliver exceptional results, not just acceptable?

If 4/4 aren't yes ‚Üí it's a no.

The paradox?
Fewer projects ‚Üí higher revenue.

Because I can charge premium rates for specialized work.
Because clients get outcomes, not outputs.
Because word spreads when you nail it every time.

Not every project is your project.
Not every client is your client.

And that's okay.

---

What filter do you use for new opportunities?

I'm genuinely curious ‚Äî I learn from how others operate.

---

#FreelanceLife #BusinessLessons #ClientRelationships #DesignBusiness #PulseGraphix #InvestInCongo"

---

## Post 5: Poll / Engagement Starter
**Type:** Poll | **Hook:** "Quick poll" | **CTA:** Vote + explain in comments

### Draft:

"Quick poll for my fellow agency owners and freelancers üéØ

You're onboarding a new client. What's your biggest friction point?

A) Getting clear requirements (vague briefs)
B) Pricing conversations (scope creep fear)
C) Setting expectations on timelines
D) The actual design work (rarely the problem üòâ)

Bonus question in comments:
‚Üí How do YOU solve this? Drop your process ‚Äî let's crowdsource best practices.

---

My answer: It's 100% 'A' for me.

I solved it with a mandatory discovery call + standardized brief template.

Takes 30 minutes. Saves 10 hours of revisions.

Your turn üëá

---

#AgencyLife #ClientOnboarding #FreelanceTips #DesignBusiness #PulseGraphix"

---

## üìã Scheduling Recommendations

| Post | Best Day | Best Time | Estimated Performance |
|------|----------|-----------|----------------------|
| Post 1 (AI Thought) | Tuesday | 8:00 AM | High - controversial topic |
| Post 2 (Portfolio) | Thursday | 10:00 AM | Medium-High - visual appeal |
| Post 3 (Checklist) | Tuesday | 1:00 PM | High - save-for-later content |
| Post 4 (Story) | Friday | 3:00 PM | Medium - weekend engagement |
| Post 5 (Poll) | Wednesday | 9:00 AM | High - easy engagement |

---

## ‚úÖ Pre-Publish Checklist

## POST 1: Thought Leadership ‚Äî AI & Design Industry Trend

**Platform:** LinkedIn

**Type:** Thought Leadership  
**Target Brand:** Nexus AI

### Hook
ü§ñ AI won't replace designers. But designers who use AI will replace those who don't.

### Body
I've been testing AI web design tools for the past 6 months, and here's the uncomfortable truth nobody's talking about:

The debate isn't "Human vs Machine" anymore. It's "Enhanced Human vs Unenhanced Human."

**What's changing:**
‚Ä¢ Design iteration speed: 10√ó faster with AI prototyping
‚Ä¢ Personalization at scale: What used to take weeks now takes hours
‚Ä¢ Creative exploration: AI generates 50 variations while you sleep

**What's NOT changing:**
‚Ä¢ Strategy still requires human insight
‚Ä¢ Client relationships can't be automated
‚Ä¢ Taste and judgment remain deeply human skills

The designers thriving in 2026 aren't the ones fighting AI. They're the ones learning to dance with it.

**My prediction:** By 2027, "AI-fluent designer" won't be a specialty ‚Äî it'll be table stakes.

Are you upskilling or watching from the sidelines?

### Body
Faites le test en 2 minutes ‚Äî et soyez honn√™te :

**3. TEST D'ACTION CLAIRE**

## POST 6: Educational ‚Äî SEO Basics for Small Business

### Hook
üîç SEO en 2026 : Les 5 actions qui comptent vraiment pour les PME (oubliez le reste)

### Body
J'entends encore "Le SEO c'est trop technique, trop long, trop compliqu√©."

Faux. Voici les 5 actions √† fort impact que TOUTE PME peut faire ‚Äî sans √™tre un expert.

**1. OPTIMISEZ VOTRE GOOGLE BUSINESS PROFILE** ‚è±Ô∏è 30 min

**2. CR√âEZ 1 PAGE PAR SERVICE** ‚è±Ô∏è 2h par page

‚Ä¢ "Combien co√ªte..." / "Comment choisir..." / "Pourquoi mon..."
‚Ä¢ Format article de blog 600-1000 mots

**Ce que vous n'avez PAS besoin de faire :**

‚ùå Acheter des liens louches

‚ùå Duplicate content entre pages

## POST 7: Behind-the-Scenes ‚Äî Client Challenge

**Platform:** LinkedIn  
**Language:** English  
**Type:** Behind-the-Scenes Story  
**Target Brand:** Nexus AI

### Hook
üí¨ "Can you build this by Friday?" ‚Äî A client story about impossible deadlines (and what I learned)

### Body
Last month, a startup founder called me in panic.

Their investor pitch was Monday. Their website? A broken WordPress disaster from 2019.

"We need a complete redesign by Friday. Can you do it?"

**Old me would have said:** "Sure!" (then panic-worked 72 hours straight)

**2026 me said:** "No. But here's what we CAN do."

**The conversation:**
ME: "What's the actual goal for Monday's pitch?"
CLIENT: "Investors need to see we're legit and understand what we do."
ME: "Do you need a full website or a killer landing page?"
CLIENT: "...I guess just a landing page?"

**What we did in 3 days:**
‚úÖ 1 high-converting landing page (not 15 pages)
‚úÖ AI-generated hero visuals (Midjourney + editing)
‚úÖ Clear value prop + 3-point pitch
‚úÖ Email capture for "early access"
‚úÖ Mobile-optimized, fast-loading

**What we DIDN'T waste time on:**
‚ùå Blog (no one reads startup blogs pre-launch anyway)
‚ùå About page with every team member's biography
‚ùå Complex navigation
‚ùå Custom animations

**The result:**
They nailed the pitch. Investors loved the clarity.

3 weeks later, we built the full site ‚Äî with actual user feedback to guide decisions.

**The lesson:**
Sometimes "impossible deadline" is code for "unclear priorities."

Instead of working faster, ask:
‚Ä¢ What's the real outcome you need?
‚Ä¢ What's the minimum viable version?
‚Ä¢ What can wait until we have real data?

Speed is good. Clarity is better.

Have you ever turned down a project to save it from itself?

### Hashtags
#WebDesign #ClientStories #StartupLife #Entrepreneurship #ProjectManagement #DesignThinking #LessonsLearned #FreelanceLife #DigitalAgency

---

## POST 8: Behind-the-Scenes ‚Äî Lessons Learned

**Platform:** LinkedIn  
**Language:** English  
**Type:** Behind-the-Scenes Reflection  
**Target Brand:** Pulse Graphix

### Hook
üß† I wasted $8,000 building the wrong website. Here's what I learned.

### Body
2024. A retail client came to us wanting "a Shopify store like [famous brand]."

We said yes. Built it. Launched it.

**3 months later:** 0.4% conversion rate. They were bleeding money on ads going nowhere.

**What went wrong?**

We built what they ASKED for, not what they NEEDED.

**The mistakes:**
1. We copied a brand with $2M ad budget and brand recognition
2. We didn't question their product-market fit
3. We focused on design, ignored customer research
4. We assumed "more features = better" (it never is)

**What we SHOULD have done:**
‚úÖ Week 1: Interview 10 target customers before touching Figma
‚úÖ Week 2: Analyze top 5 competitors ‚Äî what converts, what doesn't
‚úÖ Week 3: Build a minimal MVP (10 products, basic design)
‚úÖ Week 4: Launch, track, learn
‚úÖ Month 2-3: Iterate based on DATA, not opinions

**The turnaround:**
We rebuilt from scratch. This time:
‚Ä¢ Simplified to 3 product categories (from 12)
‚Ä¢ Added customer reviews front and center
‚Ä¢ Changed hero message based on actual customer language
‚Ä¢ Added trust badges (return policy, local delivery, real testimonials)

**New results after 6 weeks:**
üìä Conversion rate: 3.2% (8√ó improvement)
üìä Average order value: +47%
üìä Customer support questions: -60% (clearer messaging)

**The real lesson:**
You're not paid to execute requests. You're paid to solve problems.

Next time a client says "I want X," my first question is:

**"What problem are you trying to solve?"**

Most expensive lesson of my career. Best investment in my skills.

What's a project failure that made you a better professional?

### Hashtags
#WebDesign #LessonsLearned #Entrepreneurship #EcommerceTips #ClientWork #DesignThinking #Failure #GrowthMindset #DigitalMarketing #Shopify

## POST 10: Prediction / Hot Take

**Platform:** LinkedIn  
**Language:** French  
**Type:** Hot Take / Controversial Opinion  
**Target Brand:** Pulse Graphix / Nexus AI

### Hook
üî• TAKE CHAUD : Votre site WordPress DIY tue votre business (et vous ne le voyez m√™me pas)

### Body
Je vais me faire des ennemis, mais quelqu'un doit le dire :

**Ton site WordPress fait avec un template √† 49‚Ç¨ et "un pote qui s'y conna√Æt en informatique" te co√ªte plus cher que ce qu'il t'a √©conomis√©.**

Voici pourquoi :

**1. LE CO√õT INVISIBLE DE LA LENTEUR**
‚Ä¢ Template surcharg√© : 37 plugins dont 29 inutiles
‚Ä¢ Temps de chargement : 8 secondes (Google recommande < 3s)
‚Ä¢ Taux d'abandon : 53% des visiteurs mobiles partent avant m√™me de voir ton contenu
‚Ä¢ **Co√ªt r√©el :** Milliers d'euros en trafic publicitaire gaspill√©

**2. LE SEO CATASTROPHE**
‚Ä¢ Th√®me g√©n√©rique utilis√© par 100 000 autres sites
‚Ä¢ Images non-optimis√©es (5 Mo par photo, s√©rieux ?)
‚Ä¢ Pas de structure s√©mantique
‚Ä¢ Mobile-friendly de fa√ßade (√ßa bug sur la moiti√© des smartphones)
‚Ä¢ **Co√ªt r√©el :** Tu n'apparais jamais sur Google. Tes concurrents mangent tes clients.

**3. LA CONVERSION INEXISTANTE**
‚Ä¢ Design "joli" mais aucune strat√©gie de conversion
‚Ä¢ Call-to-action invisible ou inexistant
‚Ä¢ Formulaire de contact g√©n√©rique que personne ne remplit
‚Ä¢ **Co√ªt r√©el :** 98% de tes visiteurs repartent sans action. Argent jet√© par la fen√™tre.

**4. LA S√âCURIT√â FANT√îME**
‚Ä¢ Plugins pas mis √† jour depuis 2021
‚Ä¢ Mot de passe admin = "admin123"
‚Ä¢ Un jour tu te r√©veilles, ton site affiche des pubs pour des contrefa√ßons
‚Ä¢ **Co√ªt r√©el :** Cr√©dibilit√© ruin√©e + perte de donn√©es clients

**"MAIS J'AI √âCONOMIS√â 3 000‚Ç¨ !"**

Calcul rapide :
‚Ä¢ -500‚Ç¨/mois en clients perdus (site lent + mauvaise UX)
‚Ä¢ -800‚Ç¨/mois en pubs qui convertissent √† 0,2% au lieu de 3%
‚Ä¢ -1 200‚Ç¨/mois en opportunit√©s SEO manqu√©es

= **-2 500‚Ç¨/mois = -30 000‚Ç¨/an**

Ton "√©conomie" de 3 000‚Ç¨ te co√ªte **30 000‚Ç¨** sur 12 mois.

**LA VRAIE QUESTION :**

Combien co√ªte un site professionnel ? 5 000-15 000‚Ç¨.

Combien co√ªte un site amateur ? Des dizaines de milliers en opportunit√©s perdues.

**Ce que font les entreprises qui croissent :**
‚úÖ Elles investissent dans un vrai site (strat√©gie + design + tech)
‚úÖ Elles mesurent le ROI, pas juste "c'est joli"
‚úÖ Elles consid√®rent leur site comme un employ√© √† plein temps (qui travaille 24/7)

**Ce que font les entreprises qui stagnent :**
‚ùå "Mon cousin peut me faire √ßa pour 500‚Ç¨"
‚ùå "Un site c'est un site, √ßa marche tous pareil"
‚ùå "On verra plus tard quand on aura le budget"

**Le site web n'est pas une d√©pense. C'est un investissement.**

Si tu payes 3 000‚Ç¨ pour gagner 30 000‚Ç¨/an, c'est du ROI √ó 10.

Mais vas-y, continue √† √©conomiser sur le seul outil qui travaille pour toi 24/7 ü§∑

**Pr√™t √† arr√™ter de perdre de l'argent ?** Mes DMs sont ouverts.

(Je sais, ce post va trigger. Mais si √ßa fait r√©fl√©chir 1 entrepreneur, mission accomplie.)

Vous √™tes #TeamDIY ou #TeamPro ? (D√©bat dans les commentaires üëá)

### Hashtags
#WebDesign #Entrepreneuriat #WordPress #SiteWeb #ROI #PME #MarketingDigital #InvestissementDigital #CroissanceEntreprise #TakeChaud #Controverse #Strat√©gieDigitale

---

## USAGE NOTES

**Posting Schedule Recommendation:**
- Monday: Thought leadership (sets the tone for the week)
- Tuesday: Educational content (value-add)
- Wednesday: Portfolio showcase (proof)
- Thursday: Behind-the-scenes / Story (human connection)
- Friday: Poll or Hot Take (engagement boost)

**Engagement Strategy:**
- Respond to ALL comments within 24 hours
- Ask follow-up questions to commenters
- Share poll results in a follow-up post
- Tag relevant people/companies when appropriate (but don't overdo it)

**Content Mix Rationale:**
- 20% Thought leadership (positions as industry expert)
- 20% Educational (builds trust, provides value)
- 20% Portfolio/proof (demonstrates results)
- 20% Story/behind-the-scenes (relatability, authenticity)
- 20% Engagement (polls, hot takes ‚Äî drives algorithm)

**Performance Tracking:**
Monitor these metrics per post:
- Impressions
- Engagement rate (likes + comments + shares / impressions)
- Click-through to website
- DM inquiries
- Profile views

Adjust future content based on what performs best!
