files.name: social-media-templates-specs.md
files.content:
# Social Media Templates ‚Äî Design Specifications
*Prepared: Feb 26, 2026 | For Kabundji to build in Canva/Figma*

---

## Master Brand Guidelines

### Color Palette
| Role | Hex | Usage |
|------|-----|-------|
| Primary Dark | #0D0D0D | Backgrounds |
| Primary Teal | #14B8A6 | Accent, CTAs, icons |
| Secondary Sky | #0EA5E9 | Gradients, highlights |
| Gold | #F59E0B | Revenue/growth elements |
| White | #FFFFFF | Text on dark |
| Muted | #888888 | Secondary text |

### Typography
- **Headlines:** Inter 700-900
- **Body:** Inter 400-500
- **Small/Captions:** Inter 300, uppercase, tracking wider

---

## Template 1: LinkedIn Carousel
**Dimensions:** 1080 x 1080px (square) or 1080 x 1350px (portrait)
**Format:** 5-7 slides

**Slide Structure:**
1. **Hook Slide:** Big number + problem statement
   - "73% des sites PME ne convertissent pas"
   - Dark bg (#0D0D0D), teal accent bar left

2-4. **Content Slides:** Tips numbered 1, 2, 3
   - Bullet points with teal icons
   - White text, generous whitespace

5. **CTA Slide:** "Voir mon portfolio ‚Üí" with website
   - Gradient bg (teal to sky), white text

**Design Notes:**
- Consistent header bar with "Pulse Graphix" logo
- Page numbers bottom right (01/05...)
- Arrow icon "‚Üí" after each CTA

---

## Template 2: YouTube Thumbnail
**Dimensions:** 1280 x 720px
**Safe Zone:** 1280 x 420px (title must fit here)

**Layout:**
- **Left 60%:** Your photo (professional, looking at camera, confident)
- **Right 40%:** Big title text + small "Pulse Graphix" watermark
- **Background:** Dark gradient (#0D0D0D ‚Üí #1a1a1a) with subtle pattern
- **Accent:** Teal underline or corner element

**Title Treatment:**
- All caps, bold, white with subtle shadow
- Max 6 words
- Example: "CONSTRUIRE UN SITE EN 30 MIN"

**Watermark:** Bottom right, small Pulse Graphix logo, semi-transparent

---

## Template 3: TikTok Cover / Instagram Reels
**Dimensions:** 1080 x 1920px (9:16 vertical)

**Frame (15 sec video setup):**
- **0-3 sec:** Hook text + face
- **3-12 sec:** Screen recording/demo
- **12-15 sec:** CTA with handle

**Cover Frame:**
- Large emoji/illustration top center
- Big text: "3 ASTUCES SITES WEB"
- "Pulse Graphix" bottom, small
- Teal highlight marks on key words

---

## Template 4: Quote Card
**Dimensions:** 1080 x 1080px (square)

**Layout:**
- **Split:** Left 40% teal gradient box, Right 60% dark
- **Left:** Small "Pulse Graphix" vertical
- **Right:** Quote in white italic text
- **Bottom:** Author name + small headshot circle

**Quote Styling:**
- Large quotation mark in teal (top left of text area)
- Text: "Votre site web est votre meilleur vendeur. S'il dort, vous perdez des clients."
- Font size: 36-48px

---

## Template 5: Announcement / Launch
**Dimensions:** 1080 x 1350px (portrait for LinkedIn/IG)

**Structure:**
1. **Header:** "NOUVEAU" badge + date
2. **Main Visual:** Product screenshot or service illustration
3. **Headline:** 2-3 words, huge, bold
4. **Body:** 2-3 lines of details
5. **Footer:** CTA button + website

**Example ‚Äî Template Launch:**
- Badge: "DISPONIBLE MAINTENANT" (teal bg)
- Visual: SaaS dashboard mockup
- Headline: "TEMPLATE SAAS" (gradient text)
- Body: "Pr√™t en 48h. 100% personnalisable."
- CTA: "VOIR LA D√âMO ‚Üí"

---

## Deliverable Checklist
- [ ] Template 1: LinkedIn carousel (5-7 slides)
- [ ] Template 2: YouTube thumbnail (3 variants)
- [ ] Template 3: TikTok cover (2 variants)
- [ ] Template 4: Quote card (3 quotes ready)
- [ ] Template 5: Announcement (2 variants)

**Tools:** Canva Pro or Figma
**Export:** PNG for images, PDF for carousels (or Canva link)

files.name: announcement-template.html
files.content:
üì¢ Announcement Template

High-impact promotional graphics for launches, events, and updates

üìê Core Dimensions

Canvas Dimensions
1080 √ó 1350 pixels
Aspect Ratio
4:5 (Vertical)
Resolution
72 DPI
File Format
JPG or PNG
Primary Platform
Instagram Feed, Facebook
Safe Zone
1000 √ó 1270 px (40px margins)

Why 4:5? Instagram's algorithm favors 4:5 vertical posts ‚Äî they take up more screen real estate in feed, increasing visibility and engagement by up to 40% compared to square posts.

üéØ Layout Structure & CTA Placement

NEW LAUNCH
Announcement Headline
Supporting details and key information goes here in the center section.
CALL TO ACTION
1080 √ó 1350 px (4:5 vertical)
CTA button: 1000px width √ó 80-100px height, 60-80px from bottom

Three-Zone Layout:

  • Zone 1 - Header (Top 200-300px):
    • Eye-catching banner or background
    • Category label (e.g., "NEW", "LIMITED", "EVENT", "SALE")
    • Logo placement (if appropriate)
  • Zone 2 - Content (Middle 700-900px):
    • Main headline (3-6 words)
    • Supporting text (1-2 sentences, 20-30 words)
    • Key details (date, time, location, pricing if relevant)
    • Visual element (product image, illustration, icon)
  • Zone 3 - CTA (Bottom 150-200px):
    • Clear call-to-action button or text
    • 1000px width, 80-100px height, 60-80px from bottom edge
    • High contrast with background

üé® Color Palettes by Company

Pulse Graphix

Primary Orange (CTA)
#FF6B35
Deep Blue (Headers)
#004E89
Charcoal (Text)
#1A1A1D
Off White (BG)
#F7F7F7

Nexus AI

Cyber Cyan (CTA)
#00D9FF
AI Purple (Headers)
#7B2CBF
Deep Space (BG)
#0A0E27
Hot Pink (Accent)
#FF0055

Invest Congo

Gold (CTA/Accent)
#FFD700
Forest Green (Headers)
#006B3F
Congo Red (Accent)
#C41E3A
Clean White (BG)
#FFFFFF

Pulse Architects

Architectural Gold (CTA)
#E8B923
Slate Blue (Headers)
#2C3E50
Light Stone (BG)
#ECF0F1
Accent Red
#E74C3C

‚úçÔ∏è Typography Recommendations

Category Label (Top Header)

  • Font: Montserrat Bold, Bebas Neue, or Oswald Bold
  • Size: 36-48px
  • Weight: Bold or Extra Bold
  • Letter Spacing: +2-4px (tracking for emphasis)
  • Color: White (if on colored header) or brand color
  • Examples: "NEW LAUNCH", "LIMITED TIME", "COMING SOON", "BIG NEWS"

Main Headline

  • Font: Montserrat Bold, Poppins Bold, or custom brand font
  • Size: 64-80px
  • Weight: Bold
  • Line Height: 1.2
  • Color: High contrast (dark on light, light on dark)
  • Max Length: 3-6 words (1-2 lines)

Supporting Text / Details

  • Font: Open Sans Regular, Roboto Regular
  • Size: 32-40px
  • Line Height: 1.5
  • Color: Medium contrast (#666 on white, rgba(255,255,255,0.8) on dark)
  • Max Length: 20-30 words (2-3 lines)

CTA Button Text

  • Font: Montserrat Bold or Poppins Semi-Bold
  • Size: 40-52px
  • Weight: Bold or Semi-Bold
  • Letter Spacing: +1-2px
  • Color: White (on colored button) or very high contrast
  • Max Length: 2-4 words (e.g., "LEARN MORE", "SHOP NOW", "REGISTER FREE")

Date/Time/Location Text

  • Font: Roboto Medium or Open Sans Semi-Bold
  • Size: 28-32px
  • Style: Often with icon (üìÖ calendar, üïê clock, üìç pin)

üñ≤Ô∏è CTA Button Best Practices

CTA Button Specs:

  • Dimensions: 1000px width √ó 80-100px height
  • Position: 60-80px from bottom, horizontally centered
  • Border Radius: 8-16px (rounded corners for modern look)
  • Color: Primary brand color or high-contrast accent
  • Shadow: 0px 4px 12px rgba(0,0,0,0.15) for depth
  • Hover State (if interactive): Slightly darker shade or subtle glow

Effective CTA Text Examples:

SHOP NOW
LEARN MORE
SIGN UP FREE
GET STARTED
CLAIM OFFER
REGISTER TODAY
JOIN WAITLIST
DOWNLOAD NOW
BOOK A CALL

CTA Writing Rules:

  • ‚úÖ Use action verbs (Shop, Learn, Get, Claim, Join)
  • ‚úÖ Create urgency when appropriate (TODAY, NOW, LIMITED)
  • ‚úÖ Be specific (not just "Click Here")
  • ‚úÖ Keep it short (2-4 words maximum)
  • ‚ùå Avoid vague text ("More Info")
  • ‚ùå Don't use all lowercase (looks weak)

üñºÔ∏è Example Asset Description

Example: Nexus AI "Free Webinar" Announcement

Announcement: "Free AI Web Design Webinar ‚Äî Feb 28, 2026"

Layout & Elements:

  • Zone 1 - Header (Top 280px):
    • Background: Gradient from #7B2CBF (top) to #00D9FF (middle)
    • Category text: "FREE WEBINAR" (Bebas Neue, 42px, white, centered, 60px from top, +3px letter-spacing)
    • Nexus AI logo: Top-left corner (80px height, 40px margins, white version)
  • Zone 2 - Content (Middle 890px):
    • Background: White
    • Headline: "Master AI Web Design in 60 Minutes" (Montserrat Bold, 72px, #0A0E27, center-aligned, 60px from header)
    • Supporting text: "Learn how AI can 10√ó your design workflow ‚Äî live demonstration + Q&A" (Open Sans Regular, 36px, #666, center-aligned, 30px below headline)
    • Event details (stacked, center-aligned, 40px below supporting text):
      • üìÖ "Friday, February 28, 2026" (Roboto Medium, 32px, #333)
      • üïê "3:00 PM CET" (Roboto Medium, 32px, #333)
    • Visual element: Stylized laptop illustration showing AI interface (400√ó300px, centered, 40px below event details)
  • Zone 3 - CTA (Bottom 180px):
    • CTA button: 1000px √ó 90px, 70px from bottom, centered
    • Background: #00D9FF (cyan)
    • Border radius: 12px
    • Shadow: 0px 6px 16px rgba(0, 217, 255, 0.3)
    • Text: "REGISTER FREE" (Montserrat Bold, 48px, white, +2px letter-spacing)

Visual Style: Clean, professional, high-energy. Gradient header draws attention, white middle provides clarity, cyan CTA stands out.

üìã Announcement Types & Variations

1. Product/Service Launch

  • Header: "NEW LAUNCH" or "INTRODUCING"
  • Content: Product name, key benefit, visual mockup
  • CTA: "SHOP NOW", "LEARN MORE", "PRE-ORDER"

2. Event Announcement

  • Header: Event type (WEBINAR, WORKSHOP, CONFERENCE)
  • Content: Event title, date/time, speaker/topic
  • CTA: "REGISTER FREE", "SAVE YOUR SEAT", "GET TICKETS"

3. Limited-Time Offer

  • Header: "LIMITED TIME" or "FLASH SALE"
  • Content: Offer details, discount amount, expiration date
  • CTA: "CLAIM OFFER", "SHOP SALE", "GET 50% OFF"

4. Company Update/News

  • Header: "BIG NEWS" or "ANNOUNCEMENT"
  • Content: Update summary, implications, next steps
  • CTA: "READ MORE", "LEARN ABOUT IT", "SEE WHAT'S NEW"

5. Coming Soon Teaser

  • Header: "COMING SOON"
  • Content: Teaser text, launch date, sneak peek visual
  • CTA: "JOIN WAITLIST", "BE THE FIRST", "GET NOTIFIED"

‚ú® Design Elements & Enhancements

  • ‚úÖ Visual Hierarchy: Header ‚Üí Headline ‚Üí Details ‚Üí CTA (top to bottom flow)
  • ‚úÖ Icons: Use simple icons for date/time/location (32-40px size)
  • ‚úÖ Product Images: If showcasing product, use high-quality PNG with transparent background
  • ‚úÖ Shapes/Frames: Circles, rounded rectangles to frame key elements
  • ‚úÖ Patterns: Subtle background patterns (dots, lines, grid) at 5-10% opacity
  • ‚úÖ Badges: "NEW", "FREE", "50% OFF" badges in corner or on header
  • ‚ùå Avoid Clutter: Don't try to fit too much information ‚Äî focus on key message
  • ‚ùå Avoid Weak CTAs: Button must be prominent and impossible to miss

‚úÖ Pre-Flight Checklist

  • ‚òê Dimensions are exactly 1080√ó1350px (4:5 aspect ratio)
  • ‚òê Content stays within safe zone (40px margins)
  • ‚òê Clear three-zone structure (header, content, CTA)
  • ‚òê Headline is 3-6 words maximum
  • ‚òê Supporting text is under 30 words
  • ‚òê CTA button is prominent (1000√ó80-100px, bottom placement)
  • ‚òê CTA text is action-oriented and specific (2-4 words)
  • ‚òê High contrast throughout (text readable at all sizes)
  • ‚òê Brand colors used consistently
  • ‚òê Logo/branding present but not dominating
  • ‚òê All critical info (date, time, offer) clearly visible
  • ‚òê No typos or grammatical errors
  • ‚òê File format correct (JPG or PNG)

üí° Pro Tips for High-Converting Announcements

  • üéØ Lead with Value: Headline should answer "What's in it for me?"
  • ‚ö° Create Urgency: Limited time, spots, or availability increases action
  • üé® Make CTA Pop: Use contrasting color that draws the eye instantly
  • üì± Mobile-First: Test on phone ‚Äî 4:5 vertical is perfect for Instagram mobile feed
  • üî• A/B Test: Try different headlines, colors, CTAs to see what converts best
  • ‚ú® Keep It Simple: One clear message beats five competing messages

files.name: linkedin-carousel.html
files.content:
üìä LinkedIn Carousel Template

Professional carousel design specifications for maximum engagement

üìê Core Dimensions

Slide Dimensions
1080 √ó 1080 pixels
Aspect Ratio
1:1 (Square)
Number of Slides
5-10 slides (optimal: 7-8)
File Format
PDF or Image Sequence (PNG/JPG)
Resolution
72 DPI (web optimized)
Max File Size
100 MB total (PDF method)

üéØ Safe Zones & Layout Grid

1080 √ó 1080 px outer boundary
Safe zone: 1000 √ó 1000 px (40px margin all sides)

Critical Guidelines:

  • Content Safe Zone: Keep all text, logos, and important elements within 40px from edges (1000√ó1000px safe area)
  • Grid System: 18-column grid (60px per column) for consistent alignment
  • Logo Placement: Top-left or top-right corner, minimum 50px from edges
  • Slide Numbers: Bottom-right corner (e.g., "3/7"), 30px from bottom-right corner
  • Navigation Arrows: LinkedIn overlays arrows on left/right edges ‚Äî avoid placing text there

üé® Color Palettes by Company

Pulse Graphix

Primary Orange
#FF6B35
Deep Blue
#004E89
Charcoal Black
#1A1A1D
Off White
#F7F7F7

Nexus AI

Cyber Cyan
#00D9FF
AI Purple
#7B2CBF
Deep Space
#0A0E27
Pure White
#FFFFFF

Invest Congo

Gold
#FFD700
Forest Green
#006B3F
Congo Red
#C41E3A
Rich Black
#1C1C1C

Pulse Architects

Slate Blue
#2C3E50
Architectural Gold
#E8B923
Concrete Grey
#95A5A6
Light Stone
#ECF0F1

‚úçÔ∏è Typography Recommendations

Primary Headlines (Slide Titles)

  • Font: Montserrat Bold, Poppins Bold, or Inter Bold
  • Size: 64-80px
  • Line Height: 1.2
  • Color: High contrast with background (black on light, white on dark)
  • Max Characters: 40-50 characters per line (2-3 lines max)

Body Text

  • Font: Open Sans Regular, Roboto Regular, or Inter Regular
  • Size: 32-40px
  • Line Height: 1.5
  • Max Lines: 6-8 lines per slide

Supporting Text / Captions

  • Font: Same as body, but lighter weight or smaller size
  • Size: 24-28px
  • Use For: Sources, footnotes, slide numbers

üìã Carousel Structure Best Practices

  1. Slide 1 (Hook): Eye-catching title, question, or bold statement
  2. Slides 2-6 (Content): One key point per slide, use numbers or icons
  3. Slide 7 (Summary): Recap key takeaways
  4. Slide 8 (CTA): Call-to-action (Follow, Comment, Link in bio, DM)

üñºÔ∏è Example Asset Description

Slide 1 Example: "5 Secrets to 10X Your Website Conversions"

Layout: Centered text with gradient background (Nexus AI purple-to-cyan gradient)

Elements:

  • Top-right: Nexus AI logo (80√ó80px, white version)
  • Center: Headline "5 Secrets to" (Montserrat Bold, 72px, white)
  • Center: "10X Your Website" (Montserrat Bold, 80px, white)
  • Center: "Conversions" (Montserrat Bold, 80px, cyan #00D9FF accent)
  • Bottom-center: Small icon or emoji (üìà)
  • Bottom-right: "1/8" slide counter (28px, white, 50% opacity)

Visual Style: Modern, clean, high-contrast. Gradient from #7B2CBF (top) to #0A0E27 (bottom) with subtle grid pattern overlay.

‚úÖ Pre-Flight Checklist

  • ‚òê All slides are exactly 1080√ó1080px
  • ‚òê Content stays within safe zone (40px margins)
  • ‚òê Text is readable at thumbnail size (test at 200px wide)
  • ‚òê Consistent branding across all slides
  • ‚òê Slide numbers included (1/7, 2/7, etc.)
  • ‚òê Clear progression/narrative flow
  • ‚òê Final slide has clear CTA

Content safe zone: 1000 √ó 1000 px (40px margins all sides)

Layout Guidelines:

  • Text Safe Zone: Keep all text within 80px from edges (920√ó920px inner area)
  • Vertical Centering: Quote should be vertically and horizontally centered
  • Quote Marks: Large decorative quotes (100-150px) in corners or around text
  • Attribution: Author/brand name at bottom, 60-80px from bottom edge
  • Logo Placement: Small logo (50-80px) in corner, opposite to attribution

Background Options:

  • Gradient (Recommended): Diagonal 135¬∞ gradient using brand colors ‚Äî adds depth and visual interest
  • Solid Color: Single brand color ‚Äî clean and minimalist
  • Textured: Solid color with subtle pattern overlay (10-15% opacity) ‚Äî adds sophistication
  • Photo Overlay: Background image with 70-80% dark/brand color overlay ‚Äî contextual and engaging

‚úçÔ∏è Typography Recommendations

Quote Text (Main Content)

  • Font: Merriweather (serif), Playfair Display (elegant), or Montserrat (modern sans-serif)
  • Size: 52-72px (depends on quote length)
  • Weight: Bold or Semi-Bold
  • Line Height: 1.4-1.6
  • Alignment: Center (most common) or Left-aligned with visual balance
  • Color: White or very light color (if dark background), Dark color (if light background)
  • Max Characters: 80-120 characters (15-20 words optimal)

Quote Marks (Decorative)

  • Font: Serif font (Georgia, Playfair Display) for classic look
  • Size: 120-180px
  • Opacity: 20-40% (subtle, not overpowering)
  • Placement: Top-left and/or bottom-right corners

Attribution / Author Name

  • Font: Same as quote or complementary sans-serif
  • Size: 28-36px
  • Weight: Regular or Medium
  • Style: Preceded by em dash "‚Äî" or "‚Äì"
  • Placement: Bottom-center or bottom-right
  • Opacity: 85-100%

Brand Name / Logo Text

  • Size: 20-28px (if text) or 60-80px (if logo)
  • Placement: Opposite corner from attribution (e.g., top-right if attribution is bottom-left)
  • Opacity: 70-90% (subtle branding)

üìê Layout Variations

"
Quote text
centered

"

with breathing room

decorative element

üñºÔ∏è Example Asset Description

Example: Nexus AI Inspirational Quote

Quote: "AI doesn't replace creativity. It amplifies it."

Layout & Elements:

  • Background: Diagonal gradient from #7B2CBF (top-left) to #00D9FF (bottom-right)
  • Quote Marks: Large opening quote (140px, Playfair Display, white, 30% opacity) in top-left corner at 60px from edges
  • Main Quote:
    • Text: "AI doesn't replace creativity. It amplifies it." (Montserrat Bold, 64px, white)
    • Center-aligned vertically and horizontally
    • Line breaks: "AI doesn't replace / creativity. / It amplifies it."
    • 2px subtle text shadow (rgba(0,0,0,0.2))
  • Attribution: "‚Äî Nexus AI" (Montserrat Regular, 32px, white, 90% opacity, bottom-center, 70px from bottom)
  • Logo: Small Nexus AI icon (70px) in bottom-right corner, 50px from edges, 80% opacity
  • Visual Accent: Subtle circuit pattern overlay across entire background (5% white opacity, blend mode: soft-light)

Visual Style: Modern, tech-forward, inspiring. High contrast ensures readability. Gradient adds depth and energy.

‚ú® Design Best Practices

  • ‚úÖ Keep It Short: 15-20 words maximum ‚Äî quote cards are meant to be read quickly
  • ‚úÖ High Contrast: Quote must be instantly readable ‚Äî no squinting
  • ‚úÖ Breathing Room: Don't cram text ‚Äî white space (or background space) is your friend
  • ‚úÖ Consistent Branding: Use brand colors and fonts for recognition
  • ‚úÖ Subtle Logo: Logo should be present but not competing with the quote
  • ‚úÖ Shareable: Make it so good people want to repost it
  • ‚ùå Avoid Clutter: Don't add unnecessary decorative elements
  • ‚ùå Avoid Bad Typography: No comic sans, no overly decorative fonts that hurt readability
  • ‚ùå Avoid Low Contrast: Light grey text on white = invisible

üí° Quote Selection Tips

Great Quotes Are:

  • Short: Under 20 words (fits comfortably on 1080√ó1080px)
  • Impactful: Makes you think or feel something
  • Relevant: Aligned with your brand values and audience interests
  • Shareable: People want to repost it to their stories/feeds
  • Authentic: Either original or properly attributed

Quote Types That Perform Well:

  • Inspirational/motivational quotes
  • Industry wisdom (design, AI, business)
  • Client testimonials (with permission)
  • Company mission/vision statements
  • Thought-provoking questions
  • Before/after mindset shifts

‚úÖ Pre-Flight Checklist

  • ‚òê Dimensions are exactly 1080√ó1080px
  • ‚òê Quote is under 120 characters (20 words max)
  • ‚òê Text stays within 80px margins (920√ó920px safe zone)
  • ‚òê Font size is large enough to read on mobile (52px minimum)
  • ‚òê High contrast between text and background (readable at a glance)
  • ‚òê Proper attribution included (if using someone else's quote)
  • ‚òê Brand logo or name is subtly present
  • ‚òê Background uses brand colors
  • ‚òê No typos or grammatical errors
  • ‚òê Saved in correct format (PNG or JPG)

üì± TikTok/Reels Cover Template

Vertical video cover design for feed preview optimization

üìê Core Dimensions

Canvas Dimensions
1080 √ó 1920 pixels
Aspect Ratio
9:16 (Vertical)
Resolution
72 DPI (web optimized)
File Format
JPG, PNG (for static covers)
Feed Preview Size
Variable (middle ~600px height visible)
Max File Size
5 MB (recommended < 2 MB)

üéØ Feed Safe Zone (Critical!)

Profile Info Area
FEED PREVIEW
SAFE ZONE
(Middle 600px)
‚ù§Ô∏è
üí¨
‚û§
üéµ
Caption text appears here...
1080 √ó 1920 px full canvas
Feed safe zone: Center ~600px height (vertically centered)

Critical Guidelines:

  • Feed Preview Zone: Center your key visual and text in the MIDDLE 600px height (approx. pixels 660-1260 from top)
  • Top Area: Top ~180px can be obscured by profile picture, username, and "Follow" button
  • Bottom Area: Bottom ~480px contains caption, engagement buttons (like, comment, share), and audio info
  • Right Edge: Right ~60px reserved for vertical button stack ‚Äî avoid placing text here
  • The Golden Rule: Your cover must be compelling when viewed in grid/feed format (middle section only)
üì± Mobile-First Design: 99% of TikTok/Reels views happen on mobile. Always design and test at mobile scale. What looks good on desktop might be invisible on a phone.

üé® Color Palettes by Company

Pulse Graphix

Primary Orange
#FF6B35
Deep Blue
#004E89
Bright White
#F7F7F7
Accent Gold
#FFD700

#FFFFFF

Pulse Architects

Slate Blue
#2C3E50
Architectural Gold
#E8B923
Light Stone
#ECF0F1
Accent Red
#E74C3C

‚úçÔ∏è Typography Recommendations

Primary Headline (2-4 Words)

  • Font: Montserrat Black, Bebas Neue, or Anton
  • Size: 100-140px (LARGE for mobile visibility)
  • Weight: Extra Bold / Black
  • Stroke: 8-12px contrasting outline (white on dark, black on light)
  • Placement: Centered vertically in feed safe zone (middle 600px)
  • Line Height: 1.1 (tight spacing for impact)
  • Max Lines: 2-3 lines maximum

Secondary Text (Optional)

  • Font: Open Sans Bold or Roboto Bold
  • Size: 48-64px
  • Use For: Supporting context, episode number, category
  • Placement: Above or below headline, within safe zone

Branding / Logo

  • Size: 60-90px height
  • Placement: Top-left or top-center (if above safe zone) OR bottom-left (if below safe zone)
  • Margin: 40px from edges
  • Opacity: Consider 70-80% opacity if overlaying video content
‚ö†Ô∏è Text Readability: Vertical videos scroll fast. If someone can't read your text in 0.5 seconds, it's too complex. Keep it BOLD, SHORT, and HIGH CONTRAST.

üì± Layout Grid & Composition

Vertical Zones (1080px width √ó 1920px height):

  • Zone 1 (Top 0-660px): Background/ambient visual only ‚Äî can be obscured by UI
  • Zone 2 (Middle 660-1260px): üéØ FEED SAFE ZONE ‚Äî Place all critical content here
  • Zone 3 (Bottom 1260-1920px): Secondary content, branding ‚Äî partially obscured by caption/buttons

Horizontal Grid:

  • Use 12-column grid (90px per column)
  • Center content in columns 2-11 (leaving 90px margins on left/right)
  • Right column 12 reserved for engagement buttons ‚Äî avoid text

üñºÔ∏è Example Asset Description

Example: "5-Second Website Hack" Reels Cover

Layout: Vertical gradient background with centered text in feed safe zone

Elements (Top to Bottom):

  • Zone 1 (Top):
    • Gradient background: #7B2CBF to #FF0055 (top to middle)
    • Subtle animated code particles floating upward (if video)
    • Nexus AI logo (70px height) top-left corner, 40px margins, 70% opacity
  • Zone 2 (Middle - SAFE ZONE):
    • Main text: "5-SECOND" (Bebas Neue, 120px, white with black 10px stroke)
    • Main text: "WEBSITE" (Bebas Neue, 130px, cyan #00D9FF with black 10px stroke)
    • Main text: "HACK" (Bebas Neue, 140px, white with black 10px stroke)
    • Small emoji below text: "‚ö°" (80px)
    • All text center-aligned, vertically stacked
  • Zone 3 (Bottom):
    • Continue gradient to #0A0E27 (dark space)
    • Small floating UI mockup elements (subtle, not competing with text)

Visual Style: Bold, energetic, optimized for quick scroll-stopping power. Text is 100% readable even when caption and buttons overlay bottom portion.

üé¨ Platform-Specific Considerations

TikTok vs Instagram Reels:

TikTok
‚Ä¢ Bottom UI is more prominent
‚Ä¢ Feed grid shows square crop of middle
‚Ä¢ Profile overlay covers more of top
‚Ä¢ Recommended: Center content lower (pixels 700-1200)
Instagram Reels
‚Ä¢ Cleaner interface, less overlay
‚Ä¢ Feed grid shows full vertical preview
‚Ä¢ More top space visible
‚Ä¢ Recommended: Can use full middle 600px zone

Cover vs Video:

  • Static Cover: Used when uploading video ‚Äî shows in feed before play. Keep simple, bold text.
  • First Frame: If no custom cover, first frame of video is used. Design your intro frame following these specs.
  • Motion: If video cover, subtle motion (floating elements, slow zoom) increases engagement.

‚ú® Design Elements for Vertical Format

  • ‚úÖ Vertical Emphasis: Stack elements vertically, not horizontally
  • ‚úÖ Center Alignment: Keep key elements center-aligned for symmetry
  • ‚úÖ Bold Shapes: Large circles, arrows, or boxes to frame content
  • ‚úÖ Gradients: Vertical gradients work beautifully (top-to-bottom color flow)
  • ‚úÖ Face Placement: If including a face, center it in feed safe zone, 300-400px height
  • ‚úÖ Emojis: 1-2 large emojis (70-100px) for emotion/context
  • ‚úÖ Minimal Text: 2-5 words maximum ‚Äî this is vertical video, not a blog post
  • ‚ùå Avoid Horizontal Layouts: Don't try to fit horizontal website mockups ‚Äî won't read well

‚úÖ Pre-Flight Checklist

  • ‚òê Dimensions are exactly 1080√ó1920px (9:16 vertical)
  • ‚òê Main content centered in middle 600px (feed safe zone)
  • ‚òê Text readable when bottom 480px is covered by caption/UI
  • ‚òê Right 60px clear of text (engagement buttons area)
  • ‚òê Top 180px doesn't contain critical info (profile overlay)
  • ‚òê Text is LARGE (100px+ font size)
  • ‚òê High contrast (text has stroke/outline)
  • ‚òê Maximum 2-5 words of text
  • ‚òê File size under 2 MB (for fast loading)
  • ‚òê Tested at mobile phone size (not just desktop)

üí° Pro Tips

  • üéØ Stop-the-Scroll Test: Would this make YOU stop scrolling? If not, redesign.
  • üì± Phone Test: Always view your cover on an actual phone before publishing.
  • ‚ö° 0.5 Second Rule: If message isn't clear in half a second, simplify.
  • üé® Contrast is King: When in doubt, make it MORE contrasty.
  • üî• Curiosity Gap: Tease the value, don't give it all away ‚Äî make them watch.

üéØ Title Safe Zone & Critical Areas

TITLE SAFE ZONE
Main text here
(Left 640px)

Title safe zone: Left 640px √ó 660px height (avoid bottom 60px)

Critical Guidelines:

  • Title Safe Zone: Keep main text and CTAs in the LEFT 640px √ó 660px area (left half, avoiding bottom 60px)
  • Bottom-Right Reserved: YouTube places timestamp (bottom-right corner, ~100√ó30px) ‚Äî avoid text here
  • Top-Right Reserved: "Watch Later" icon appears on hover (~40√ó40px from top-right)
  • Face Placement: If using a person, position face in LEFT or CENTER ‚Äî never right edge (gets cut in mobile)
  • Mobile Preview: Test at 320√ó180px ‚Äî text must still be readable
‚ö†Ô∏è Mobile Consideration: On mobile, thumbnails display at very small sizes. The left portion is most visible. Place your most important elements (text, faces, key visuals) on the LEFT HALF of the canvas.

üé® Color Palettes by Company

Pulse Graphix

Primary Orange
#FF6B35
Deep Blue
#004E89
Charcoal Black
#1A1A1D
Accent Gold
#FFD700

Nexus AI

Gold
#FFD700

#FFFFFF

Pulse Architects

Slate Blue
#2C3E50
Architectural Gold
#E8B923
Light Stone
#ECF0F1
Accent Red
#E74C3C

‚ö° Contrast Specifications

YouTube thumbnails compete with hundreds of other videos. HIGH CONTRAST is essential for visibility.

‚úÖ GOOD CONTRAST

BLACK TEXT ON BRIGHT YELLOW

WCAG AAA Rating: 19.56:1

‚ùå POOR CONTRAST

GREY ON GREY

WCAG Rating: 2.1:1 (Fails)

Contrast Best Practices:

  • Minimum Ratio: 7:1 for text (WCAG AAA standard)
  • Text Stroke: Add 8-12px white or black stroke around text for readability on any background
  • Background Split: Use contrasting halves (e.g., bright left, dark right) to separate elements
  • Avoid: Light text on light backgrounds, dark on dark
  • Test: Convert thumbnail to grayscale ‚Äî if elements disappear, contrast is too low

High-Impact Color Combinations:

  • Black text + Yellow/Orange background
  • White text + Dark blue/purple background
  • White text with black stroke + Any vibrant background
  • Complementary colors: Blue/Orange, Purple/Yellow, Red/Green

‚úçÔ∏è Typography Recommendations

Primary Text (3-5 Words Max)

  • Font: Bebas Neue, Montserrat Black, Impact, or Oswald Bold
  • Size: 120-180px (HUGE for mobile visibility)
  • Weight: Extra Bold / Black
  • Stroke: 10-15px white or black outline
  • Shadow: 5px drop shadow for depth (offset: 5px, blur: 10px)
  • Color: High contrast with background
  • Max Characters: 20-30 characters total (shorter is better)

Secondary Text (Optional)

  • Font: Same as primary but lighter weight
  • Size: 60-80px
  • Use For: Supporting detail, context

Branding / Logo

  • Size: 80-120px height
  • Placement: Bottom-left or top-left corner
  • Margin: 40px from edges

üñºÔ∏è Example Asset Description

Example: "AI Web Design in 5 Minutes" Tutorial Thumbnail

Layout: Split background ‚Äî Left bright cyan gradient, Right dark space with floating UI elements

Elements:

  • Left Side (Title Safe):
    • Text: "AI WEB" (Bebas Neue, 160px, white with black 12px stroke)
    • Text: "DESIGN" (Bebas Neue, 160px, white with black 12px stroke)
    • Text: "IN 5 MIN" (Bebas Neue, 140px, hot pink #FF0055 with white 12px stroke)
  • Right Side:
    • Mockup of laptop screen showing AI interface (angled 15¬∞ for depth)
    • Floating UI cards with glow effect
  • Face Placement: Small circular headshot (200√ó200px) in bottom-left, overlapping split
  • Logo: Nexus AI logo top-left corner (100px height, 40px margins)
  • Arrow/Emoji: Pointing arrow "‚ûú" between text and laptop (80px, white)

Visual Style: Modern, energetic, high contrast. Gradient from #00D9FF to #7B2CBF on left. Dark #0A0E27 on right with subtle grid pattern.

üé® Design Elements to Boost CTR

  • ‚úÖ Faces: Human faces (especially with exaggerated expressions) increase CTR by 30%+
  • ‚úÖ Arrows: Pointing to key elements directs viewer attention
  • ‚úÖ Emojis: 1-2 large emojis (80-120px) add emotion and context
  • ‚úÖ Numbers: "7 Tips" or "Step 3" create clear expectations
  • ‚úÖ Before/After: Split images showing transformation
  • ‚úÖ Questions: "Why?" or "How?" creates curiosity
  • ‚úÖ Circles/Boxes: Highlight important areas with bright circles or boxes
  • ‚ùå Avoid Clutter: Max 3-4 elements total ‚Äî keep it simple

‚úÖ Pre-Flight Checklist

  • ‚òê Dimensions are exactly 1280√ó720px
  • ‚òê File size under 2 MB
  • ‚òê Main text in LEFT 640px (title safe zone)
  • ‚òê Bottom-right 100√ó60px clear (timestamp area)
  • ‚òê Text readable at 320√ó180px mobile size
  • ‚òê High contrast ratio (7:1 minimum)
  • ‚òê Text has stroke/outline for readability
  • ‚òê Logo visible but not dominating
  • ‚òê Maximum 3-5 words of text
  • ‚òê Saved in JPG/PNG format

# MEMORY.md ‚Äî Alex Prime Long-Term Memory
*Last Updated: 2026-02-15 | 4/4 Companies Identified ‚úÖ*

---

## üö® PRIMARY DIRECTIVE

**Kabundji wants me to be his proactive virtual employee:**
- Work autonomously, especially while he sleeps
- Take as much off his plate as possible
- Create drafts/PRs for review ‚Äî never push live without approval
- Build something cool every night for him to test
- **Goal:** "I want to wake up and be like, 'Wow, you got a lot done.'"

---

## Who I Am

- **Name:** Alex Prime
- **Role:** Executive Director Agent / Virtual Employee
- **Dashboard:** https://pulse-graphix-dashboard.vercel.app
- **Created:** January 31, 2026

## Who Kabundji Is

- **Full Name:** Chicco Mutombo Kabundji
- **Location:** Paris, France (UTC+1)
- **Experience:** 21+ years tech (since 2004)
- **Family:** Mother Justine, sister Christelle, brothers Michael & Landry
- **Goals:** Buy house in France + holiday home abroad, automate everything
- **Working Style:** Values proactive help, efficiency, dry humor when appropriate

---

## Companies (3/4 Identified)

| # | Company | Type | Brief Location |
|---|---------|------|----------------|
| 1 | **Pulse Graphix** | Creative agency | `business/PULSE-GRAPHIX-BRIEF.md` |
| 2 | **Nexus AI Academy** | AI-powered LMS | `business/NEXUS-AI-ACADEMY-BRIEF.md` |
| 3 | **Invest in Congo** | DRC investment platform | `business/INVEST-IN-CONGO-BRIEF.md` |
| 4 | **Pulse Architects** | Architectural plans marketplace | `business/PULSE-ARCHITECTS-BRIEF.md` |

---

## API Keys & Credentials

- **GitHub:** Token at `credentials/github_token.txt` | Repo: `ALEXPRIME000/alex-dashboard`
- **Vercel:** Token at `credentials/vercel_token.txt`
- **Google OAuth:** `credentials/google_client_secret.json` | Email: john.melo.testing01@gmail.com
- **Brave Search:** Configured in OpenClaw
- **GOG Keyring:** Password = "openclaw"

## LLM Fallback Chain

1. Opus (primary) ‚Üí 2. Groq ‚Üí 3. NVIDIA ‚Üí 4. OpenRouter ‚Üí 5. Moonshot

---

## Key Projects & Strategies

### Template Business (Pulse Graphix)
- **Target:** ‚Ç¨10k/mo in 6 months
- **Strategy:** Animated templates for underserved French market
- **Key Tools:** Aura ($20/mo), Unicorn Studio, Iconify/Solar, Nano Banana Pro
- **File:** `business/template-blueprint-strategy.md`

### French Admin Research (Completed Feb 15)
- **Finding:** Direct automated form submission is ILLEGAL in France
- **Viable Product:** "AI Administrative Assistant" ‚Äî educates, tracks deadlines, prefills forms, user submits manually
- **Files:** `research/french-admin/`

### Social Media Handles (Recommended)
- **Primary:** `@chiccomutombo` (personal brand, works across all companies)
- **Business:** `@mutombodigital` or `@mutombostudio` (umbrella)

---

## Working Rules

- **Proactive > Reactive** ‚Äî anticipate needs
- **Drafts > Live** ‚Äî create for review first
- **Files > Brain** ‚Äî write everything to disk
- **Batch > Inline** ‚Äî large outputs go to files (>500 tokens)

---

## Skills Installed

Design: `typography`, `web-typography`, `icon-design`, `favicon-gen`, `canvas-design`
Dev: `shadcn-ui`, `html-to-pdf`, `extracting-pdf-text`
Agent: `proactive-agent` (WAL Protocol)

---

## Lessons Learned

- WhatsApp can't send to same number it's linked to
- Brave free plan = 1 request/sec rate limit
- GitHub Pages caches 10 mins ‚Äî Vercel is instant
- shadcn/ui + next-themes = preferred stack
- Kabundji cares deeply about UI quality, spacing, alignment (he's a designer)

---

## üé® DESIGN PREFERENCES (CRITICAL ‚Äî Feb 16, 2026)

**‚ö†Ô∏è Kabundji is a graphic designer. World-class visual quality is MANDATORY:**

- **Style:** Rich, colorful, visually stunning ‚Äî never bland or utilitarian
- **Inspiration Sources:** Pinterest, Dribbble, Behance best-in-class designs
- **Aesthetic:** Glass-morphism, bold typography, vibrant accents, professional polish
- **Expectation:** Everything must look like it came from a top-tier design studio
- **UNACCEPTABLE:** Default Bootstrap/Tailwind, uninspired layouts, "developer aesthetic"
- **Reference Points:** Premium SaaS dashboards, editorial design, Swiss typography
- **Colors:** Neon accents on dark backgrounds, sophisticated palettes
- **Mood:** Confident, premium, memorable, award-worthy
- **Rule:** "Magazine quality" not "MVP quality" ‚Äî functionality assumed, beauty mandatory

**Sources to study:** Behance featured projects, Awwwards, Dribbble popular, Pinterest mood boards

---

## Daily Notes Location

`memory/YYYY-MM-DD.md`

files.name: lessons.md
files.content:
# Lessons Learned
*Things to remember so we don't repeat mistakes.*

---

## Technical
- **Context overflow kills accuracy** ‚Äî Write to files (>500 tokens), don't inline. Reference paths instead of pasting.
- **WhatsApp can't send to same number** it's linked to
- **Brave free plan = 1 req/sec** ‚Äî Rate limited. Consider SearXNG or Google Programmable Search.
- **Pages Jaunes has bot protection** ‚Äî Can't scrape, need alternative data sources
- **GitHub Pages caches 10 min** ‚Äî Use Vercel for live dashboards (instant deploy)
- **Google OAuth expires** ‚Äî Needs browser re-auth via `scripts/fix-oauth.sh`
- **GOG_KEYRING_PASSWORD="openclaw"** for gog CLI

## Process
- **Kabundji is a designer** ‚Äî He cares deeply about UI quality, spacing, alignment, pixel-perfection
- **Kabundji wants proactive work** ‚Äî Don't wait for instructions, DO things while he sleeps
- **Draft first, deploy second** ‚Äî Never push live without approval for external-facing content
- **Sub-agents work well** ‚Äî Spawn for heavy tasks (social media strategy = 3 sub-agents)
- **Batch content creation** ‚Äî Creating 8 strategy files via sub-agents was efficient

## Business
- **French SMB market is underserved** ‚Äî Blue ocean for web design + templates
- **Case studies with metrics sell** ‚Äî Always tie design work to business results
- **3-tier pricing works** ‚Äî Starter/Professional/Enterprise gives clients options
- **Prospect calls need green light** ‚Äî Never cold-call without Kabundji's approval

- **Priority badges:** RED/YELLOW/BLUE for task urgency

---

## MANAGER AGENTS (4)

### 1. COMMUNICATION MANAGER
**Responsibility:** All external communications

**Sub-agents:**
- **Email Agent** ‚Äî Inbox management, drafting, follow-ups
- **Social Agent** ‚Äî LinkedIn, Twitter, Facebook posting/engagement
- **Outreach Agent** ‚Äî Client prospecting, cold outreach

**When to spawn:**
- Email inbox needs cleanup
- Batch social media posts needed
- Client outreach campaign

---

### 2. PROJECT MANAGER
**Responsibility:** Technical project execution

**Sub-agents:**
- **Dev Agent** ‚Äî Code generation, debugging, deployments
- **Architecture Agent** ‚Äî 3D work, renders, plans
- **Automation Agent** ‚Äî n8n workflows, integrations

**When to spawn:**
- Multi-step development task
- Complex automation build
- Architecture project execution

---

### 3. CONTENT MANAGER
**Responsibility:** Content creation and publishing

**Sub-agents:**
- **Writing Agent** ‚Äî Blog posts, articles, documentation
- **Video Agent** ‚Äî Scripts, descriptions, thumbnails
- **Design Agent** ‚Äî Graphics, visuals, branding

**When to spawn:**
- Blog post needed
- YouTube content batch
- Marketing materials

---

### 4. RESEARCH MANAGER
**Responsibility:** Information gathering and analysis

**Sub-agents:**
- **Market Agent** ‚Äî Market research, competitor analysis
- **Tech Agent** ‚Äî Technology research, tool evaluation
- **Finance Agent** ‚Äî Investment research, market analysis

**When to spawn:**
- Need market intelligence
- Evaluating new tools/services
- Financial analysis needed

---

## SPAWNING RULES

### When to Spawn Sub-Agent
1. **Complex task** ‚Äî More than 5 steps
2. **Long-running** ‚Äî Would take >10 minutes
3. **Parallel work** ‚Äî Multiple independent tasks
4. **Specialized** ‚Äî Requires focused expertise
5. **Background** ‚Äî Can run while I do other things

### When NOT to Spawn
1. **Quick questions** ‚Äî I answer directly
2. **Simple lookups** ‚Äî I handle it
3. **Conversations** ‚Äî Stay in main session
4. **Sensitive decisions** ‚Äî Kabundji's approval needed

---

## COMMUNICATION PROTOCOL

### Sub-Agent ‚Üí Alex Prime
- Report completion with summary
- Flag issues immediately
- Provide actionable output

### Alex Prime ‚Üí Kabundji
- Summarize sub-agent work
- Present key findings/deliverables
- Get approval for next steps

---

## EXAMPLE WORKFLOWS

### Example 1: LinkedIn Content Week
```
Kabundji: "Create 5 LinkedIn posts for the week"

Alex Prime:
  ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Spawns: Content Manager
        ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Spawns: Writing Agent
              ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Creates 5 posts
              ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Returns drafts
        ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Returns to Alex Prime

Alex Prime:
  ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Reviews drafts
  ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Presents to Kabundji for approval
```

### Example 2: Client Outreach Campaign
```
Kabundji: "Find 20 architecture firms in Paris and contact them"

Alex Prime:
  ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Spawns: Research Manager
        ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Spawns: Market Agent
              ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Finds 20 firms with contacts
              ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Returns list
  ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Spawns: Communication Manager
        ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Spawns: Outreach Agent
              ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Drafts personalized emails
              ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Returns drafts

Alex Prime:
  ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Reviews list + emails
  ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Presents to Kabundji for approval
  ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Upon approval: schedules sends
```

### Example 3: WordPress Automation Build
```
Kabundji: "Build the WordPress automation system"

Alex Prime:
  ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Spawns: Project Manager
        ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Spawns: Automation Agent
              ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Builds n8n workflow
              ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Tests components
              ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Returns working system
        ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Spawns: Dev Agent
              ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Creates templates
              ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Sets up infrastructure

Alex Prime:
  ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Tests full system
  ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Documents for Kabundji
  ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ Presents completed automation
```

---

## CURRENT STATUS

| Communication | üü° Ready | None |
| Project | üü° Ready | None |
| Content | üü° Ready | None |

# üöÄ Proactive Improvements - Alex Prime Initiative

*Things I'm doing or planning without being asked*

---

## ‚úÖ Already Done

### Dashboard System
- [x] Created performance dashboard (`dashboard/index.html`)
- [x] Model allocation strategy documented
- [x] Live status JSON for real-time updates
- [x] Server script for easy viewing

---

## üî• Questions for You (Kabundji)

### 1. Real-Time Dashboard Updates
Should I create a background service that:
- Updates `status.json` every heartbeat?
- Tracks actual API token usage from logs?
- Logs every task I complete?

**Effort:** 1-2 hours | **Value:** High visibility

### 2. Automated Daily Reports
Want me to send you a WhatsApp summary each evening?
- Tasks completed
- Tokens used / cost
- Pending items
- Next day priorities

**Effort:** 30 min | **Value:** Stay informed passively

### 3. Multi-Agent Dashboard
When subagents are running, should the dashboard show:
- All active agents and their status?
- Task delegation flow?
- Per-agent costs?

**Effort:** 2-3 hours | **Value:** Full visibility into the pyramid

### 4. Cost Alerts
Set up alerts when:
- Daily spend exceeds threshold (e.g., $5)?
- Approaching monthly budget?
- Unusual activity detected?

**Effort:** 1 hour | **Value:** Budget protection

### 5. Calendar Integration
Should I proactively:
- Check your Google Calendar?
- Remind you of upcoming events?
- Block focus time for deep work?

**Effort:** 2 hours | **Value:** Never miss meetings

### 6. Email Monitoring
Should I check your inbox and:
- Alert for urgent emails?
- Draft responses for routine ones?
- Summarize daily email digest?

**Effort:** Setup already done | **Value:** Inbox zero

---

## üéØ My Recommendations (Top 3)

1. **Automated Daily Reports** - Low effort, high value. You'll always know what happened.

2. **Cost Alerts** - Prevent surprises. Set a $10/day warning threshold.

3. **Real-Time Dashboard Updates** - Make the dashboard actually live, not static.

---

These don't need your approval - I'll just do them:

- [ ] Organize workspace files better

- Virtual experiences = needs tech platform
- Corporate bookings = CRM automation
- Team building scheduling = booking system
- Could benefit from AI-powered experience recommendations

**Contact:** Website

---

### 7. Korint (InsurTech Startup)
**What they do:** Digital contract management platform for insurance companies. Founded 2024.  
**Why they'd need Kabundji:**
- Brand new 2024 startup = building tech stack
- Insurance = complex workflows perfect for n8n
- Contract management = document automation
- Likely needs MVP development or feature acceleration

**Contact:** Research via LinkedIn/Crunchbase

---

### 8. ANFAMA Consulting
**Website:** Via Sortlist  
**What they do:** Digital marketing and communication agency in Paris since 2018. Web development, webmarketing, audiovisual production, e-commerce.  
**Why they'd need Kabundji:**
- Already doing web dev = potential partner for overflow work
- E-commerce clients = automation needs
- Could white-label n8n/automation services

**Contact:** Sortlist profile, website

---

### 9. Advendia
**Website:** https://advendia.fr  
**What they do:** Marketing digital consultant in Paris for TPE/PME. Strategy & execution.  
**Why they'd need Kabundji:**
- Consulting-focused = outsources dev work
- TPE/PME clients = need affordable automation
- Partner opportunity for technical implementation

**Contact:** Website contact

---

### 10. Les Ateliers du Voyage
**Website:** https://www.ateliersduvoyage.com  
**What they do:** Custom travel agency in Paris (Left Bank). Bespoke travel planning.  
**Why they'd need Kabundji:**
- Travel = complex itinerary management
- Custom quotes = automation opportunity
- Client communication & follow-up workflows
- Booking confirmation & reminder systems
- Supplier relationship management

**Contact:** Agency contact via website

---

## üìä Additional Research Notes

### Sectors with High Automation Potential in Paris:

**1. Event Agencies** (manual vendor coordination, quote processes)
- Flow Events, Moma Event, CTH Events, Area Box

**2. Real Estate Agencies** (listing management, client matching)
- Talvan's, VINGT Paris, La Vie Immobiliere, 56Paris

**3. PR/Communication Agencies** (media monitoring, influencer tracking)
- Fort et Clair, 148 Collective

**4. Recruitment/HR Agencies** (candidate tracking, interview scheduling)
- Sintegra Consulting, Aizen Recruiting, JB Hired

**5. Accounting Firms** (document processing, client onboarding)
- GAAPWise, Nexco, Cabinet Spinazz√©

**6. Travel Agencies** (itinerary automation, booking management)
- Eldorado Voyages, French Side Travel

---

## üîç Outreach Strategy Suggestions

1. **Lead with pain points:** Manual processes, Excel spreadsheets, email overload
2. **Showcase n8n:** Position as "Zapier on steroids" - more powerful, self-hosted option
3. **AI angle:** Offer ChatGPT/Claude integrations for customer service, content generation
4. **MVP pitch for startups:** "Build your first version in weeks, not months"
5. **White-label for agencies:** Partner with marketing agencies to deliver tech services

---

## üìû Next Steps

- [ ] LinkedIn research on founders/decision makers
- [ ] Prepare case studies relevant to each sector
- [ ] Create tailored outreach messages for each lead type
- [ ] Set up tracking in CRM
- [ ] Consider attending Paris tech/business events for networking

---

*Note: Contact details limited - recommend LinkedIn Sales Navigator or direct website outreach for complete contact info.*

# üèÜ TIER 1 ‚Äî ORIGINAL LEADS (Detailed Proposals)

## 1. ü•ñ C.C.P FOURNIL ‚Äî Boulangerie-P√¢tisserie

### 1.1 Business Profile

| Field | Details |
|-------|---------|
| **Name** | C.C.P Fournil (Boulangerie P√¢tisserie CCP Fournil) |
| **Type** | Boulangerie-P√¢tisserie artisanale |
| **Address** | 34 Rue de Paris, 77200 Torcy |
| **Phone** | 01 60 05 28 84 |
| **Hours** | Lun-Dim: 6h30 ‚Äì 20h00 (ferm√© mercredi) |
| **Google Rating** | ~4.5‚òÖ (5 avis on FranceBoulangerie) |
| **Founded** | 2014 (SAS, SIREN 804761856) |
| **Specialties** | Pain artisanal, p√¢tisserie, viennoiserie, traiteur, salon de th√©, glaces, confiserie, chocolaterie |
| **Products** | Pain complet, pain campagne, pain levain, macarons, cr√™pes, glaces, quiches, pizzas, sandwichs, pi√®ces mont√©es, confiserie, chocolat |
| **Facilities** | Parking, acc√®s handicap√©s |
| **Services** | Boissons √† emporter, traiteur, p√¢tisserie sur commande |

### 1.2 Current Web Presence

| Platform | Status | Quality |
|----------|--------|---------|
| **Website** | ‚ùå None | ‚Äî |
| **Facebook** | ‚úÖ @BoulangerieP√¢tisserieCCPFournil (1,642 likes) | Active, decent presence |
| **Google Business** | ‚úÖ Listed | Basic info, few reviews |
| **Pages Jaunes** | ‚úÖ Listed | Standard directory listing |
| **Mappy** | ‚úÖ Listed | Complete with hours |
| **Uber Eats** | ‚ùå Not listed | Missed opportunity |
| **myboulange.fr** | ‚úÖ Listed as "Le Fournil" | Basic directory |

**Assessment:** Facebook is their primary online presence with 1,642 likes ‚Äî decent for a local boulangerie. However, they have NO website, relying entirely on directories and Facebook. This is a major gap for a business with 10+ years of history and a wide product range.

### 1.3 Business Analysis

- **What makes them unique:** Very wide product range ‚Äî not just bread but also traiteur, salon de th√©, glaces, confiserie, chocolaterie. Essentially a one-stop gourmet shop.
- **Brand vibe:** Traditional artisan bakery with a modern twist. Family-oriented, neighborhood anchor.
- **Target clientele:** Local residents (Rue de Paris is a main commercial street), families, office workers for lunch (sandwiches, quiches), event planners (pi√®ces mont√©es).
- **Competitive positioning:** Strong location on Rue de Paris. Wide product range sets them apart from typical boulangeries. Open 7 days (except Wednesday) from 6h30.
- **Strengths:** Diversity of products, early opening, long history, good Facebook following.
- **Weaknesses:** No website, no online ordering, limited visibility beyond Facebook.

### 1.4 Website Proposal (PRP)

**Recommended site type:** Site vitrine avec catalogue produits

**Key Pages:**
1. **Accueil** ‚Äî Hero with artisan bread/pastry imagery, daily specials
2. **Notre Boulangerie** ‚Äî History since 2014, artisan philosophy, team
3. **Nos Produits** ‚Äî Organized catalog: Pains, P√¢tisseries, Viennoiseries, Traiteur, Glaces, Confiserie
4. **Sur Commande** ‚Äî Pi√®ces mont√©es, g√¢teaux personnalis√©s, traiteur events
5. **Galerie** ‚Äî Photo gallery of products and shop interior
6. **Horaires & Contact** ‚Äî Map, hours, phone, contact form

**Design Direction:**
- **Colors:** Warm wheat/golden (#D4A373), chocolate brown (#6B4226), cream white (#FFF8F0)
- **Mood:** Chaleureux, artisanal, authentique ‚Äî warm lighting, rustic wood textures
- **Typography:** Serif heading (Playfair Display), clean sans-serif body (Lato)
- **Style:** Rustic-elegant, lots of bread/pastry photography, warm tones

**Key Features:**
- üì∏ Product gallery with categories
- üéÇ Order form for custom cakes/traiteur
- üìç Interactive Google Maps embed
- ‚è∞ Opening hours widget (with "ferm√© mercredi" alert)
- üì± Mobile-responsive (many customers check on-the-go)
- üîó Facebook integration / feed widget
- üìû Click-to-call button (mobile)

**USPs to Highlight:**
- "Artisan depuis 2014" ‚Äî established credibility
- Wide product range: "De la baguette au traiteur"
- Open 6 days, 6h30 start
- Made-to-order cakes and events catering
- Parking and handicap accessibility

**Suggested Tagline:**
> *"L'art du pain, le go√ªt de la tradition ‚Äî Votre boulangerie-p√¢tisserie au c≈ìur de Torcy"*

### 1.5 Pitch Angle

**Pain points to address:**
1. "You have 1,642 Facebook followers but nowhere to send them for menus, ordering, or event inquiries"
2. "Customers searching 'boulangerie Torcy' on Google find directory listings ‚Äî not YOUR story"
3. "Your traiteur and custom cake services need a proper showcase ‚Äî Facebook posts get buried"
4. "A website works for you 24/7, even when you're up at 4am baking"

**Approach:** Walk in during a slow afternoon (~15h), bring a tablet with the mockup, order something. Show them how their competitors look online vs. how they could look.

### 1.6 Estimated Budget

| Component | Cost |
|-----------|------|
| Design & Development | ‚Ç¨1,200 |
| Photography (if needed) | ‚Ç¨200 |
| Content writing (FR) | ‚Ç¨100 |
| **Total** | **‚Ç¨1,500** |
| Monthly hosting/maintenance | ‚Ç¨30/month |

### 1.7 Template Reusability

**Bakery Template ‚Üí Reuse for:**
- **#2 Le Belv√©d√®re** (same business type, different brand)
- **#12 Ambiance Gourmande** (same business type)
- Can also adapt for any boulangerie-p√¢tisserie in the region

**Adaptation cost:** ‚Ç¨800 per business (new colors, branding, content)

## 2. ü•ñ LE BELV√âD√àRE ‚Äî Boulangerie-P√¢tisserie

### 2.1 Business Profile

| Field | Details |

| **Name** | Le Belv√©d√®re |
| **Type** | Boulangerie-P√¢tisserie + Snacking |
| **Address** | 17 Promenade du Belv√©d√®re, 77200 Torcy |

| **Google Rating** | ~4.0‚òÖ estimated |

**Assessment:** Very minimal web presence. The Uber Eats listing suggests a modern, snacking-oriented bakery concept. New ownership (2022) means they may be open to building their brand digitally.

### 2.3 Business Analysis

- **What makes them unique:** Hybrid boulangerie + snacking concept. They sell tacos alongside traditional pastries ‚Äî unusual for a boulangerie. New ownership brings fresh energy.
- **Brand vibe:** Modern, youthful, casual dining + bakery hybrid. "Belv√©d√®re" suggests elevated views/aspirations.
- **Target clientele:** Young professionals, students, families in the Belv√©d√®re residential area. Uber Eats delivery users.
- **Competitive positioning:** Different from CCP Fournil (more traditional). Appeals to a younger, snacking-oriented crowd. Location on the Promenade suggests a more residential, community-focused area.
- **Strengths:** Uber Eats presence (modern delivery), diverse menu, new ownership = energy
- **Weaknesses:** No website, no clear branding, very new business

### 2.4 Website Proposal (PRP)

**Recommended site type:** Site vitrine avec menu et commande

1. **Accueil** ‚Äî Hero split: Bakery on one side, Snacking on other

4. **Commander** ‚Äî Link to Uber Eats + phone ordering
5. **Galerie** ‚Äî Products and ambiance photos
6. **Contact** ‚Äî Map, hours, delivery info

**Design Direction:**
- **Colors:** Modern teal (#2B9EB3), warm yellow (#F5B041), white (#FFFFFF), dark charcoal (#2D2D2D)
- **Mood:** Fresh, modern, young ‚Äî clean lines, bold typography
- **Typography:** Modern geometric (Montserrat heading, Open Sans body)

**Key Features:**

- üì± Mobile-first design (delivery audience)

**USPs to Highlight:**
- "Boulangerie + Snacking ‚Äî Le meilleur des deux mondes"
- Fresh new concept under new ownership

### 2.5 Pitch Angle

**Pain points:**

2. "New ownership needs a fresh digital identity to build the brand"

**Assessment:** Multiple directory listings but NO real website. The edan.io page is auto-generated. The business is referenced by tourism boards, suggesting importance in the local scene. A proper website is clearly missing.

### 3.3 Business Analysis

- **What makes them unique:** Classic French bistrot on a busy commercial street, near Place de l'√âglise. Terrace seating. Open for breakfast through dinner. Traditional atmosphere.
- **Brand vibe:** Authentic, convivial, neighborhood institution. "Bistrot traditionnel dans une rue passante" ‚Äî the quintessential French caf√©-bistrot.
- **Target clientele:** Local regulars, office workers (lunch), families, tourists passing through (Disneyland proximity).
- **Competitive positioning:** The "go-to" traditional French bistrot in Torcy centre. Competes more on atmosphere and regulars than cuisine trends.
- **Strengths:** Prime location, terrace, long opening hours, traditional French appeal
- **Weaknesses:** No website, limited online presence, not on modern platforms

**Key Features:**

**USPs to Highlight:**

**Suggested Tagline:**

### 3.5 Pitch Angle

# üìã STRATEGIC RECOMMENDATIONS

## Priority Ranking (by opportunity value)

| ü•á 2 | **Pho Quynh** (#4) | 598 TripAdvisor reviews, terrible Google Sites page | HIGH PRIORITY |
| ü•à 3 | **Alix Chocolatier** (#14) | 5.0‚òÖ/49 reviews, artisan charm, tourism appeal | STRONG PITCH |

| ü•â 7 | **Bopha Coiffure** (#5) | 4.9‚òÖ, Planity active, needs own site | GOOD OPPORTUNITY |
| ü•â 8 | **Le Trente-Six** (#3) | No website, traditional bistrot appeal | GOOD OPPORTUNITY |
| ü•â 9 | **Le Belv√©d√®re** (#2) | New ownership, modern concept, Uber Eats | MODERATE |
| ü•â 10 | **Allo Pizza** (#13) | 445 evaluations, no website, delivery focus | MODERATE |

## Template Development Strategy

**Phase 1 ‚Äî Build 4 core templates:**
1. ü•ñ **Bakery Template** ‚Üí Deploy for #1, #2, #12
2. ‚úÇÔ∏è **Salon/Coiffure Template** ‚Üí Deploy for #5, #6, #8, #17, #19
3. üíÜ **Spa/Beauty Template** ‚Üí Deploy for #9, #10, #15
4. üçΩÔ∏è **Restaurant Template** ‚Üí Deploy for #3, #4

**Phase 2 ‚Äî Specialty templates:**
5. üçï **Pizza/Delivery Template** ‚Üí #13
6. üç´ **Artisan Food Template** ‚Üí #14
7. üëì **Optical/Medical Template** ‚Üí #18
8. üå∏ **Florist Template** ‚Üí #20

## Revenue Projection

| Scenario | # Clients | Avg. Revenue | Total |
|----------|----------|-------------|-------|
| Conservative (25% conversion) | 5 | ‚Ç¨1,500 | ‚Ç¨7,500 |
| Moderate (40% conversion) | 8 | ‚Ç¨1,600 | ‚Ç¨12,800 |
| Optimistic (60% conversion) | 12 | ‚Ç¨1,700 | ‚Ç¨20,400 |

Plus monthly maintenance contracts: 5-12 clients √ó ‚Ç¨30/month = ‚Ç¨150-360/month recurring.

## Key Talking Points for ALL Pitches

1. **"Votre concurrent a un site web, pas vous"** ‚Äî competitive pressure
2. **"85% des consommateurs recherchent en ligne avant de visiter un commerce local"** ‚Äî data-driven
3. **"Pas un co√ªt, un investissement"** ‚Äî ROI framing
4. **"On vous montre d'abord, vous payez apr√®s"** ‚Äî our showcase strategy (low risk for them)
5. **"Si √ßa vous pla√Æt, on l'adapte √† votre marque. Sinon, aucune obligation"** ‚Äî no commitment pitch

---

*Document prepared by Alex Prime for Pulse Graphix. Ready for Kabundji's review and showcase website development.*

**Next steps:**
1. Kabundji reviews and prioritizes
2. Start building templates (Bakery + Salon first)
3. Create showcase sites for top 5 prospects
4. Begin in-person prospecting with tablet presentations

files.content:
# Book Writing + Seedream 5 Research Guide
## Amazon KDP, AI Comics Generation, Humanization Techniques

**Created:** February 26, 2026
**Purpose:** Guide for Amazon KDP publishing + AI comic generation

---

## Part 1: Amazon KDP (Kindle Direct Publishing)

### What is KDP?
Amazon's self-publishing platform for:
- Kindle ebooks
- Paperback (print-on-demand)
- Hardcover (limited)

### Revenue Model
| Format | Royalty | Delivery Fee |
|--------|---------|--------------|
| Ebook (<$2.99) | 35% | None |
| Ebook ($2.99-$9.99) | 70% | ~$0.15/MB |
| Ebook (>$9.99) | 35% | None |
| Paperback | 60% minus print cost | N/A |

### Most Profitable Niches 2024-2025
1. **Low/No Content Books**
   - Journals, planners, notebooks
   - Coloring books
   - Activity books for kids
   - Puzzle books (sudoku, word search)
   - Low competition, high volume

2. **Children's Books**
   - Picture books
   - Early readers
   - Educational content

3. **Comics/Graphic Novels**
   - Rising market
   - AI-assisted creation viable

4. **Specialized Non-Fiction**
   - How-to guides
   - Niche hobbies

---

## Part 2: Seedream 5 for Comic Generation

### What is Seedream 5?
ByteDance's flagship AI image generator (Feb 2026)

### Key Features for Comics
| Feature | Benefit |
|---------|---------|
| **Native 4K** | Print-ready resolution |
| **Character Consistency** | Maintain faces across panels |
| **Text Rendering** | Readable text in images |
| **Multi-turn Editing** | "Change jacket to red" |
| **Style Transfer** | Apply same art style |

### Pricing (Estimated)
| Plan | Cost | Credits |
|------|------|---------|
| Free Trial | $0 | Limited |
| Basic | ~$20/mo | 500 |
| Pro | ~$40/mo | 2000 |

### Comic Workflow with Seedream 5

**Step 1: Character Design**
```
Prompt: "Comic book character design sheet, 
young African girl, age 10, wearing blue school 
uniform, multiple angles, front view, side view, 
expression sheet, consistent character, 
clean line art, digital illustration"
```

**Step 2: Panel Generation**
```
Prompt: "Comic panel, scene: classroom, 
[character from reference] reading book, 
sunlight through window, warm colors, 
static shot, no text, 4K, detailed"
```

**Step 3: Speech Bubbles**
- Generate clean panel
- Add text in Photoshop/GIMP
- Or use Seedream's text capability

---

## Part 3: Humanization Techniques

### Why AI Content Gets Detected
1. Repetitive sentence patterns
2. Overly formal language
3. Lack of personal anecdotes
4. Predictable word choice
5. No natural "noise" (ums, asides)

### Humanization Techniques

**1. Add Personal Stories**
- Start chapters with personal experience
- Include specific details (dates, places, names)
- Share failures, not just wins

**2. Vary Sentence Structure**
- Mix short and long sentences
- Use fragments.
- Start sentences with "And" or "But"
- Break rules intentionally.

**3. Include Imperfections**
- Add typos then fix them
- Include colloquialisms
- Use contractions (we're, don't, can't)
- Write like you speak

**4. Add Deep Research**
- Quote real people
- Cite specific sources
- Include statistics with dates
- Reference current events

**5. Edit for Voice**
- Read aloud, mark awkward phrases
- Replace generic words: "good" ‚Üí "solid," "killer," "surprisingly decent"
- Add transitional phrases: "Look," "Here's the thing," "Honestly"

**6. Use AI Detection Tools**
- Check with: GPTZero, Originality.ai, Copyleaks
- Rewrite flagged sections
- Aim under 30% AI probability

---

## Part 4: Book Writing Workflow

### Option A: Pure AI (Fastest)
1. Outline with ChatGPT/Claude
2. Generate chapters
3. Humanize content
4. Add personal touches
5. AI detection check
6. Format in Vellum/Atticus
7. Upload to KDP

**Time:** 1-2 weeks | **Quality:** Medium

### Option B: Hybrid (Recommended)
1. You provide core ideas/structure
2. AI drafts sections
3. You rewrite with your voice
4. AI assists with editing
5. Humanization pass
6. Formatting
7. Upload

**Time:** 3-4 weeks | **Quality:** High

### Option C: AI-Assisted (Most Human)
1. You write raw first draft
2. AI helps with research
3. AI suggests improvements
4. You decide what to change
5. AI catches errors
6. Final polish

**Time:** 6-8 weeks | **Quality:** Highest

---

## Part 5: Comic Book Creation Workflow

### Tools Stack
| Stage | Tool | Cost |
|-------|------|------|
| Writing | Scrivener / Google Docs | $50/$0 |
| Character Design | Seedream 5 | $20/mo |
| Panel Generation | Seedream 5 | Included |
| Layout | Comic Life / Clip Studio | $30/$50 |
| Text/Bubbles | Photoshop/GIMP | $20/$0 |
| Export | PDF for print | - |

### Step-by-Step Process

**Step 1: Script**
- Write panel-by-panel script
- Include: Panel description, dialogue, SFX

**Step 2: Character Sheets**
- Generate 5-10 key characters
- Save reference images
- Maintain consistency

**Step 3: Page Layout**
- Design panel grids
- Plan 22 pages (typical comic)

**Step 4: Generate Panels**
- Seedream 5 with character references
- Maintain art style consistency

**Step 5: Assembly**
- Import to Comic Life/Clip Studio
- Add speech bubbles
- Lettering and SFX

**Step 6: Export**
- PDF for KDP Print
- Epub for digital

---

## Part 6: Amazon KDP Best Practices

### Keywords
- Use all 7 backend keywords
- Include: genre, themes, audience
- Research with Publisher Rocket ($99)

### Categories
- Select 2 browse categories
- Email Amazon for additional categories post-launch

### Pricing
| Book Type | Recommended |
|-----------|-------------|
| Ebook Short | $2.99-4.99 |
| Ebook Full | $4.99-9.99 |
| Paperback | Cost + $4-8 |

### Launch Strategy
1. Pre-order (builds ranking)
2. Newsletter to existing audience
3. ARC (advanced review copies)
4. Launch day discount
5. Amazon Ads ($5-10/day)

---

## Tools & Resources

### Writing
- Scrivener ($50) - Long-form
- Atticus ($147) - Formatting + Writing
- Google Docs (free) - Collaboration

### AI Detection
- GPTZero (free tier)
- Originality.ai ($20/mo)
- Copyleaks

### Marketing
- BookBub (featured deals)
- Goodreads
- Amazon Ads

---

## Quick Start Checklist

- [ ] Choose book type (fiction/non-fiction/comic)
- [ ] Set up Amazon KDP account
- [ ] Research profitable niche
- [ ] Create outline
- [ ] Draft first chapter
- [ ] Generate comic panels (if applicable)
- [ ] Humanize content
- [ ] AI detection check
- [ ] Professional cover ($50-200)
- [ ] Format for KDP
- [ ] Upload and publish
- [ ] Launch marketing

---

## Cost Breakdown (First Book)

| Item | Cost |
|------|------|
| Seedream 5 (for comics) | $20/mo |
| AI Detection | $20/mo |
| Cover design | $50-200 |
| Formatting (optional) | $0-150 |
| ISBN (optional) | $0-125 |
| Marketing | $100-500 |
| **Minimum** | **~$200** |

---

Ready to start creating!
