FORMS-INVENTORY.md
files.content:
# French Administrative Forms Inventory

Comprehensive catalog of common French administrative forms (Cerfa) with numbers, URLs, and required data fields.

---

## üßæ INCOME TAX FORMS (Impots.gouv.fr)

### Form 2042: Main Income Tax Return
- **Cerfa Number:** 10330*29 (year varies)
- **URL:** https://www.impots.gouv.fr/formulaire/2042/declaration-des-revenus
- **Platform:** impots.gouv.fr (online filing mandatory if internet-equipped)
- **Purpose:** Annual income declaration for all taxpayers
- **Required Data Fields:**
  - Civil status: Name, first name, date/place of birth
  - Marital status and changes
  - Address and contact information
  - Tax household composition (dependents)
  - Employment income (wages, pensions)
  - Social security number (NIR)
  - Bank account details (RIB) for direct debit/refund
- **Annexes:**
  - 2042-C (complementary income: investments, capital gains)
  - 2042-C-PRO (professional income, BIC, BNC)
  - 2042-RICI (tax credits, deductions)
  - 2042-IOM (overseas income)

### Form 2044: Rental Income Declaration
- **Cerfa Number:** 10334*26
- **URL:** https://www.impots.gouv.fr/formulaire/2044/revenus-fonciers
- **Purpose:** Declaration of rental property income
- **Required Data Fields:**
  - Property address and cadastral reference
  - Rental income received
  - Deductible expenses (repairs, management fees, property tax)
  - Loan interest payments
  - Co-owner percentage (if applicable)
  - Tenant information

### Form 2047: Foreign Income Declaration
- **Cerfa Number:** 11226*23
- **URL:** https://www.impots.gouv.fr/formulaire/2047/declaration-des-revenus-encaisses-letranger
- **Purpose:** Declaration of income earned abroad
- **Required Data Fields:**
  - Country of income source
  - Nature of income (wages, pensions, rental, etc.)
  - Amount in foreign currency and euros
  - Taxes paid abroad
  - Tax treaty provisions applicable

### Form 6660: Property Tax Return
- **Cerfa Number:** 10517*21
- **URL:** https://www.impots.gouv.fr/formulaire/6660-rev/declaration-pour-lannee
- **Purpose:** Annual property tax declaration for changes
- **Required Data Fields:**
  - Property identification (cadastral reference)
  - Nature of changes (construction, demolition, change of use)
  - Effective date of change
  - Property characteristics (surface area, rooms)

---

## üë®‚Äçüë©‚Äçüëß CAF FORMS (Caisse d'Allocations Familiales)

### Cerfa 11423: General CAF Benefits Application
- **Cerfa Number:** 11423*07
- **URL:** https://www.caf.fr/allocataires/aides-et-demarches/les-formulaires
- **Platform:** caf.fr (online preferred)
- **Purpose:** Application for family allowances, housing benefits, RSA
- **Required Data Fields:**
  - Full civil status of all household members
  - Social security numbers (NIR)
  - Address and housing situation
  - Family composition (children, dates of birth)
  - Income information (wages, pensions, benefits)
  - Bank details (RIB)
  - Employment status
  - Childcare arrangements (if applicable)

### Cerfa 14129: Housing Benefit Application (APL/ALF/ALS)
- **Cerfa Number:** 14129*03
- **URL:** https://www.caf.fr/allocataires/aides-et-demarches/aides-au-logement
- **Purpose:** Apply for housing assistance
- **Required Data Fields:**
  - Complete address of housing
  - Lease details (landlord, rent amount, charges)
  - Housing type (apartment, house, student housing)
  - Surface area in m¬≤
  - Monthly rent and charges breakdown
  - Landlord's SIRET or tax number (if landlord not individual)
  - Date of entry into housing
  - Household income (last 2 years)
  - Bank details (RIB)
  - Energy performance certificate (DPE) information

### Cerfa 15481: RSA Application (Revenu de Solidarit√© Active)
- **Cerfa Number:** 15481*01
- **URL:** https://www.caf.fr/allocataires/aides-et-demarches/les-formulaires
- **Purpose:** Apply for minimum income support
- **Required Data Fields:**
  - Complete household composition
  - All income sources (last 3 months)
  - Bank account information
  - Employment history and status
  - Job search registration (P√¥le Emploi)
  - Assets and property owned
  - Vehicle information
  - Housing costs

### Cerfa 11361: Child Declaration for Family Allowances
- **Cerfa Number:** 11361*04
- **URL:** https://www.caf.fr/allocataires/aides-et-demarches/les-formulaires
- **Purpose:** Declare a newborn or new child in household
- **Required Data Fields:**
  - Child's full name, date and place of birth
  - Birth certificate details
  - Relationship to household
  - Other parent's information (if applicable)
  - Custody arrangements
  - Childcare costs and arrangements

### Cerfa 14000: Quarterly Resource Declaration (RSA/Prime d'activit√©)
- **Cerfa Number:** 14000*02
- **Purpose:** Quarterly income declaration for RSA recipients
- **Platform:** caf.fr (online mandatory)
- **Required Data Fields:**
  - All income received in past 3 months (by month)
  - Employment status changes
  - Hours worked
  - Sick leave or unemployment periods
  - Other benefits received

---

## üíº URSSAF FORMS (Social Security Contributions)

### Cerfa P0 PL: Liberal Profession Business Registration
- **Cerfa Number:** 11768*06
- **URL:** https://www.autoentrepreneur.urssaf.fr/ or https://formalites.entreprises.gouv.fr/
- **Purpose:** Register as liberal professional/auto-entrepreneur
- **Required Data Fields:**
  - Personal information (name, birth date/place, address)
  - Social security number
  - Business activity description (APE code)
  - Business address
  - Start date of activity
  - Choice of tax regime
  - VAT regime option
  - ACRE (social security exemption) request
  - Bank details (RIB)
  - Professional qualification certificates

### Cerfa P2-P4: Business Modification/Cessation
- **Cerfa Number:** 11678*03 (modification), 11679*03 (cessation)
- **URL:** https://formalites.entreprises.gouv.fr/
- **Purpose:** Declare changes or closure of business
- **Required Data Fields:**
  - SIRET number
  - Nature of change (address, activity, name)
  - Effective date
  - Reason for cessation (if applicable)
  - Final revenue declaration

### D√©claration de Chiffre d'Affaires (Auto-Entrepreneur)
- **No Cerfa:** Online form only
- **URL:** https://www.autoentrepreneur.urssaf.fr/
- **Frequency:** Monthly or quarterly
- **Purpose:** Declare revenue and pay social contributions
- **Required Data Fields:**
  - Period covered
  - Total revenue by activity category
  - Revenue at zero if no activity (must still declare)
  - VAT amount collected (if applicable)

---

## üÜî IDENTITY & LIFE EVENT FORMS (Service-Public.fr)

### Cerfa 12100: National ID Card Application
- **Cerfa Number:** 12100*02
- **URL:** https://www.service-public.fr/particuliers/vosdroits/R1073
- **Purpose:** Apply for or renew national identity card
- **Pre-application:** Online pre-application mandatory (ANTS)
- **Required Data Fields:**
  - Full civil status
  - Address
  - Parent information (for minors)
  - Previous ID details (if renewal)
  - Reason for request (first time, renewal, loss, theft)
  - Emergency contact
- **Supporting documents needed:**
  - Birth certificate (< 3 months)
  - Proof of residence
  - 2 photos
  - Previous ID

### Cerfa 12100: Passport Application
- **Cerfa Number:** 12100*02 (same form as ID card)
- **URL:** https://www.service-public.fr/particuliers/vosdroits/R42218
- **Pre-application:** Online (ANTS)
- **Required Data Fields:**
  - Same as ID card application
  - Travel document history
  - Height, eye color
- **Note:** Tax stamp (timbre fiscal) required - purchased online

### Cerfa 14948: Driver's License Exchange
- **Cerfa Number:** 14948*01
- **URL:** https://www.service-public.fr/particuliers/vosdroits/R23165
- **Platform:** ANTS (online only)
- **Purpose:** Exchange foreign license for French
- **Required Data Fields:**
  - Original license details (number, country, issue date)
  - License categories held
  - Address in France
  - Duration of residence in France
  - Translation (if non-EU license)

### Cerfa 15725: Birth Declaration
- **Cerfa Number:** 15725*02
- **URL:** In-person at town hall (mairie)
- **Deadline:** 5 days from birth
- **Required Data Fields:**
  - Child's name (first and last names)
  - Date, time, and place of birth
  - Gender
  - Parent information (names, occupations, addresses)
  - Marital status of parents
  - Witness information (if applicable)

### Cerfa 15725: PACS Declaration
- **Cerfa Number:** 15726*02
- **URL:** https://www.service-public.fr/particuliers/vosdroits/R46735
- **Purpose:** Register a civil partnership
- **Required Data Fields:**
  - Partners' full civil status
  - Address(es)
  - Previous marital status
  - Property regime choice
  - Convention of PACS (attached document)
  - Signatures of both partners

### Cerfa 11530: Marriage Publication
- **Cerfa Number:** 11530*03
- **Purpose:** Request publication of marriage banns
- **Required Data Fields:**
  - Future spouses' information
  - Chosen date and location
  - Witness information (2-4 witnesses)
  - Previous marital status
  - Prenuptial agreement details (if applicable)

### Cerfa 13750: Change of Address Notification
- **Cerfa Number:** 13750*05
- **URL:** https://www.service-public.fr/particuliers/vosdroits/R15248
- **Purpose:** Single form to notify multiple administrations
- **Platform:** service-public.fr
- **Required Data Fields:**
  - Old address
  - New address
  - Effective date of move
  - Contact information
  - Services to notify (checkboxes)
  - Tax number
  - Social security number

---

## üöó VEHICLE & DRIVER FORMS (ANTS)

### Cerfa 13750: Vehicle Registration
- **Cerfa Number:** 13750*07
- **URL:** https://immatriculation.ants.gouv.fr/
- **Purpose:** Register a new or used vehicle
- **Required Data Fields:**
  - Vehicle identification (VIN)
  - Make, model, year
  - Purchase date and price
  - Previous owner information
  - Buyer information and address
  - Certificate of sale (certificat de cession)

### Cerfa 13753: Vehicle Sale Declaration
- **Cerfa Number:** 13754*03
- **URL:** https://www.service-public.fr/particuliers/vosdroits/R13592
- **Purpose:** Declare sale/transfer of vehicle
- **Required Data Fields:**
  - Vehicle registration number
  - VIN
  - Seller and buyer information
  - Sale date and price
  - Odometer reading
  - Signatures

---

## üè† PROPERTY & HOUSING FORMS

### Cerfa 13467: Property Tax Declaration for New Construction
- **Cerfa Number:** 13467*04
- **URL:** https://www.impots.gouv.fr/formulaire/h1/declaration-modele-h1
- **Deadline:** 90 days after completion
- **Purpose:** Declare new construction or major renovation
- **Required Data Fields:**
  - Property address and cadastral reference
  - Owner information
  - Construction completion date
  - Surface areas (living space, annexes)
  - Construction costs
  - Building characteristics (floors, materials, equipment)

### Cerfa 10862: Lease Agreement (Contrat de Location)
- **Cerfa Number:** 10862*07
- **URL:** https://www.service-public.fr/particuliers/vosdroits/R16186
- **Purpose:** Standard residential lease
- **Required Data Fields:**
  - Landlord and tenant information
  - Property address and description
  - Rent amount and payment terms
  - Charges (breakdown)
  - Deposit amount
  - Lease duration
  - Special conditions
  - Diagnostics (DPE, asbestos, lead, etc.)

---

## üìã COMMON DATA FIELDS ACROSS FORMS

Most French administrative forms require these standard fields:

### Personal Identification
- **Nom de famille** (surname/family name)
- **Nom d'usage** (maiden name or chosen name)
- **Pr√©nom(s)** (first name(s) in order)
- **Date de naissance** (date of birth: DD/MM/YYYY)
- **Lieu de naissance** (place: commune/ville + d√©partement/pays)
- **Nationalit√©** (nationality)
- **Num√©ro de s√©curit√© sociale** (NIR - 15 digits)

### Contact Information
- **Adresse compl√®te** (full address)
  - Num√©ro et nom de rue
  - Code postal (5 digits)
  - Commune/Ville
- **T√©l√©phone** (mobile and/or landline)
- **Adresse √©lectronique** (email)

### Financial
- **RIB** (Bank details - IBAN, BIC)
- **Num√©ro fiscal** (tax number - 13 digits)
- **Avis d'imposition** (tax notice reference)

### Family
- **Situation familiale** (marital status):
  - C√©libataire (single)
  - Mari√©(e) (married)
  - Pacs√©(e) (civil partnership)
  - Divorc√©(e) (divorced)
  - Veuf/Veuve (widowed)
- **Nombre de personnes √† charge** (dependents)
- **Livret de famille** (family record book number)

---

## üîó PLATFORM LINKS

- **Impots.gouv.fr:** https://www.impots.gouv.fr/accueil
- **CAF:** https://www.caf.fr/
- **URSSAF Auto-Entrepreneur:** https://www.autoentrepreneur.urssaf.fr/
- **Service-Public.fr:** https://www.service-public.fr/
- **ANTS (Documents):** https://ants.gouv.fr/
- **Guichet Entreprises:** https://formalites.entreprises.gouv.fr/
- **Ameli (Health):** https://www.ameli.fr/
- **France Travail:** https://www.francetravail.fr/

---

## ‚ö†Ô∏è IMPORTANT NOTES

1. **Cerfa numbers change:** The number after the asterisk (*) is the version and updates regularly
2. **Online priority:** Many forms are now online-only; paper versions being phased out
3. **FranceConnect:** Most platforms require FranceConnect authentication
4. **Supporting documents:** Forms often require supporting documents (justificatifs)
5. **Prefilled data:** Tax and CAF forms increasingly prefill based on previous declarations
6. **Mobile apps:** Most services have mobile apps (Impots.gouv, Ameli, CAF, ANTS)

---

*Last Updated: February 2026*
*Sources: service-public.fr, impots.gouv.fr, caf.fr, urssaf.fr, ants.gouv.fr*

files.name: OBLIGATIONS-CATALOG.md
files.content:
# French Administrative Obligations Catalog

Comprehensive list of major French administrative obligations for residents and businesses.

---

## üìä TAX OBLIGATIONS (Imp√¥ts)

### Income Tax (Imp√¥t sur le Revenu)
- **Frequency:** Annual
- **Filing Period:** April-May (online) for previous year's income
  - Paper deadline: Mid-May (national)
  - Online deadlines (zone-based):
    - D√©partements 1-19: Late May
    - D√©partements 20-54: Early June
    - D√©partements 55+: Mid-June
- **Payment:** Monthly installments (pr√©l√®vement √† la source) or balance due in September
- **Penalties if missed:**
  - 10% late filing penalty
  - 0.2% monthly interest on unpaid amounts
  - Up to 40% penalty for repeated non-compliance
- **Required documents:**
  - Previous year's tax notice (avis d'imposition)
  - Income statements (salaries, pensions, rental income)
  - Proof of deductions (childcare, donations, home improvements)
  - Bank account details (RIB) for refunds/debits

### Property Tax (Taxe Fonci√®re)
- **Frequency:** Annual
- **Deadline:** Mid-October (online payment deadline ~October 20)
- **Payment:** Lump sum or monthly installments
- **Penalties if missed:**
  - 10% surcharge on unpaid amount
  - 0.4% monthly interest
- **Required documents:**
  - Property deed/ownership proof
  - Cadastral information
  - Bank details for payment

### Residence Tax on Second Homes (Taxe d'Habitation)
- **Frequency:** Annual
- **Deadline:** December 15-20
- **Payment:** Lump sum or installments
- **Note:** Primary residence tax abolished for most households (2023+)
- **Penalties if missed:**
  - 10% surcharge
  - Interest charges
- **Required documents:**
  - Proof of residence status (primary vs secondary)
  - Occupancy details

---

## üè• SOCIAL SECURITY OBLIGATIONS

### Health Insurance - CPAM (Assurance Maladie)
- **Registration:** Mandatory within 3 months of arrival/birth
- **Annual:** No annual filing, but update changes within 1 month
- **Key Events Requiring Notification:**
  - Change of address: Within 1 month
  - Change of employment: Within 1 month
  - Addition of beneficiaries: Within 1 month
- **Penalties if missed:**
  - Loss of healthcare coverage
  - Reimbursement delays
  - Potential retroactive payment of medical costs
- **Required documents:**
  - Birth certificate
  - Proof of residence
  - Social security number
  - Employment contract or proof of status

### Family Allowance Fund - CAF (Caisse d'Allocations Familiales)
- **Initial Application:** Within 3 months of qualifying event
- **Quarterly Income Declaration:** Every 3 months for RSA/prime d'activit√© recipients
- **Annual Resource Declaration:** January-February for previous year
- **Penalties if missed:**
  - Benefit suspension or reduction
  - Overpayment recovery (with interest)
  - Administrative fines
- **Required documents:**
  - Tax notice (avis d'imposition)
  - Birth certificates of children
  - Proof of residence (lease, utility bills)
  - Bank details (RIB)
  - Income statements (payslips)

### URSSAF (Social Contributions for Self-Employed)
- **Frequency:** Monthly or quarterly
- **Declaration:** Online via urssaf.fr or autoentrepreneur.urssaf.fr
- **Deadlines:** Varies by regime
  - Auto-entrepreneurs: Monthly (end of month) or quarterly
  - Liberal professions: Monthly/quarterly installments
- **Penalties if missed:**
  - 5% late payment penalty
  - 0.2% interest per month
  - Potential loss of social protection
- **Required documents:**
  - Revenue/turnover statements
  - SIRET number
  - Bank details

---

## ü™™ IDENTITY DOCUMENTS

### National Identity Card (Carte Nationale d'Identit√© - CNI)
- **Validity:** 15 years (adults), 10 years (minors)
- **Renewal:** No specific deadline, but must be valid for certain procedures
- **Processing Time:** 4-6 weeks typically
- **Penalties if missed:**
  - No direct penalty, but expired ID may prevent travel/administrative acts
- **Required documents:**
  - Birth certificate (less than 3 months old)
  - Proof of residence
  - Previous ID card
  - 2 passport photos
  - Tax stamp (timbre fiscal) - ‚Ç¨25 if lost/stolen

### Passport (Passeport)
- **Validity:** 10 years (adults), 5 years (minors)
- **Renewal:** No specific deadline
- **Processing Time:** 2-4 weeks (varies by season)
- **Cost:** ‚Ç¨86 (adult), ‚Ç¨42 (minor 15-17), ‚Ç¨17 (under 15)
- **Required documents:**
  - National ID card or birth certificate
  - Proof of residence
  - 2 passport photos
  - Tax stamp (timbre fiscal)

### Driver's License (Permis de Conduire)
- **Validity:** Unlimited for paper licenses; 15 years for new format
- **Exchange:** EU licenses valid indefinitely; non-EU must exchange within 1 year
- **Renewal:** Medical exam required at certain ages or for specific categories
- **Penalties if missed:**
  - Driving with expired foreign license: ‚Ç¨35 fine + license suspension
- **Required documents:**
  - Proof of residence
  - Medical certificate (if required)
  - Previous license
  - Photos

---

## üë®‚Äçüë©‚Äçüëß‚Äçüë¶ LIFE EVENTS (√âv√©nements de Vie)

### Birth Declaration
- **Deadline:** Within 5 days of birth (3 days if born at home)
- **Where:** Town hall (mairie) of birth location
- **Penalties if missed:**
  - Criminal penalty (rare, but legally possible)
  - Complications for obtaining official documents
- **Required documents:**
  - Birth certificate from hospital
  - Parents' ID cards
  - Family record book (livret de famille) if exists
  - Marriage certificate (if applicable)

### Marriage (Mariage)
- **Notification:** Publication of banns 10 days before
- **Registration:** Immediate (day of ceremony)
- **Subsequent Updates Required:**
  - Tax authorities: Next tax filing
  - Social security: Within 1 month
  - CAF: Within 1 month
- **Required documents:**
  - Birth certificates (less than 3 months old)
  - Proof of residence
  - List of witnesses
  - Prenuptial agreement (if applicable)

### PACS (Civil Partnership)
- **Registration:** At town hall or notary
- **Updates Required:** Same as marriage (taxes, social security, CAF)
- **Dissolution:** Notify registering authority
- **Required documents:**
  - Birth certificates
  - Proof of residence
  - Joint declaration of PACS
  - ID documents

### Change of Address
- **Deadline:** No legal deadline, but recommended within 1 month
- **Entities to Notify:**
  - Tax authorities (impots.gouv.fr)
  - Social security (ameli.fr)
  - CAF (caf.fr)
  - Driver's license (ANTS)
  - Employer
  - Banks, insurance, utilities
- **Penalties if missed:**
  - Missed official correspondence
  - Service interruptions
  - Invalid license address (‚Ç¨135 fine if stopped by police)
- **Required documents:**
  - New proof of residence (lease, utility bill, property deed)

### Death Declaration
- **Deadline:** Within 24 hours
- **Where:** Town hall of death location
- **Required documents:**
  - Death certificate from doctor
  - Deceased's ID documents
  - Family record book

---

## üíº BUSINESS OBLIGATIONS

### Auto-Entrepreneur (Micro-Entreprise)

#### Registration
- **Deadline:** Before starting activity
- **Portal:** autoentrepreneur.urssaf.fr or guichet-entreprises.fr
- **Required documents:**
  - ID card
  - Proof of residence
  - Professional qualification certificates (for regulated activities)

#### Revenue Declaration
- **Frequency:** Monthly or quarterly (chosen at registration)
- **Deadlines:**
  - Monthly: Last day of each month
  - Quarterly: End of April, July, October, January
- **Penalties if missed:**
  - ‚Ç¨58 penalty per late declaration
  - 5% penalty on contributions due
  - 0.2% monthly interest

#### Annual Declaration
- **When:** April-May (income tax return)
- **Purpose:** Income tax calculation
- **Penalties:** Same as income tax penalties

### VAT (TVA - Taxe sur la Valeur Ajout√©e)
- **Threshold (2024):**
  - Services: ‚Ç¨36,800 (franchise applies below)
  - Goods: ‚Ç¨91,900 (franchise applies below)
- **Declaration Frequency:**
  - Above thresholds: Monthly or quarterly
  - CA12 form: Annually if exempt
- **Deadlines:**
  - Monthly: 24th of following month
  - Quarterly: 24th of month following quarter
- **Penalties if missed:**
  - 10% of tax due (minimum ‚Ç¨15)
  - Interest charges
- **Required documents:**
  - Purchase and sales invoices
  - VAT-compliant invoices (with VAT number)

### CFE (Cotisation Fonci√®re des Entreprises)
- **Frequency:** Annual
- **Deadline:** December 15
- **First Year:** Exempt
- **Penalties if missed:**
  - 10% surcharge
  - Interest charges
- **Required documents:**
  - Declaration of business premises (form 1447-C) in first year
  - Surface area of professional premises

### Social Declarations (DSN)
- **For Employers:** Monthly social security declarations
- **Deadline:** 5th or 15th of following month (depending on size)
- **Platform:** net-entreprises.fr
- **Penalties:** Significant fines for late/missing declarations

---

## üìÖ ANNUAL CALENDAR SUMMARY

### January
- Quarterly VAT (if applicable)
- CFE balance payment (if installments)

### February
- CAF annual resource declaration begins

### April-May
- **Income tax declaration season** (CRITICAL)
- Auto-entrepreneur annual income declaration

### June
- Final income tax filing deadline (online, zone 3)

### July
- Quarterly VAT
- Quarterly URSSAF (if applicable)

### September
- Income tax balance payment (if applicable)

### October
- Property tax payment deadline (~Oct 20)
- Quarterly VAT
- Quarterly URSSAF

### December
- CFE payment deadline (Dec 15)
- Residence tax on second homes (Dec 20)

---

## ‚ö†Ô∏è CRITICAL NOTES

1. **FranceConnect Required:** Most online services require FranceConnect authentication
2. **Online Priority:** Paper forms increasingly deprecated; online filing often mandatory
3. **Automatic Updates:** Many services share data automatically; still verify accuracy
4. **Prescription Periods:** Tax authorities can audit 3 years back (6 for serious omissions)
5. **Foreign Residents:** Different rules/deadlines may apply for non-residents

---

*Last Updated: February 2026*
*Sources: impots.gouv.fr, service-public.fr, ameli.fr, caf.fr, urssaf.fr*

files.name: PLATFORM-ANALYSIS.md
files.content:
# French Administrative Platform Technical Analysis

Technical analysis of major French government platforms for automation compatibility, API availability, and authentication requirements.

---

## üîê FRANCECONNECT - Identity Federation System

### Overview
FranceConnect is France's national identity federation system that allows citizens to use existing credentials from one service (Impots.gouv, Ameli, La Poste Identity) to authenticate to other government services.

### Technical Architecture
- **Type:** OpenID Connect (OIDC) based federation
- **Identity Providers (IdP):**
  - Impots.gouv.fr (DGFiP)
  - Ameli.fr (Assurance Maladie)
  - L'Identit√© Num√©rique La Poste
  - MSA (agricultural social security)
  - France Identit√© (national digital identity app)
  - MobileConnect et moi
  - YRIS
  - TrustMe

### For Service Providers
- **Integration:** Required for most government services
- **API Documentation:** https://partenaires.franceconnect.gouv.fr/
- **Access:** Restricted to:
  - Public administrations
  - Local authorities
  - Private companies with public service missions
- **Process:**
  1. Request access via franceconnect.gouv.fr
  2. Provide legal documentation
  3. Technical integration (OAuth 2.0 / OpenID Connect)
  4. Testing in sandbox environment
  5. Production approval

### API Capabilities
- **Identity verification:** Name, first name, birth date/place
- **Data retrieval:** Via "API FranceConnect√©es" (see below)
- **No automation for end users:** FranceConnect is for service providers, not for automating user actions

### Automation Feasibility
- ‚ùå **Cannot be automated for form-filling:** FranceConnect requires real user authentication
- ‚úÖ **Can be integrated:** If building a registered service
- ‚ö†Ô∏è **User must authenticate:** Each session requires actual user login

---

## üí∞ IMPOTS.GOUV.FR - Tax Administration

### Platform Details
- **URL:** https://www.impots.gouv.fr/
- **Authority:** DGFiP (Direction G√©n√©rale des Finances Publiques)
- **Mobile App:** Yes (iOS, Android)

### Authentication
- **FranceConnect:** ‚úÖ Required for most services
- **Direct login:** Username/password (fiscal number + password)
- **2FA:** Increasingly required for sensitive operations

### API Availability

#### For Individuals - NO PUBLIC API
- ‚ùå **No public API** for individuals to automate their own tax filing
- ‚ùå **No official scraping allowed** (Terms of Service prohibit automation)
- ‚ö†Ô∏è **Anti-bot measures:** CAPTCHA, rate limiting, session fingerprinting

#### For Service Providers - LIMITED APIs

**1. API Imp√¥t Particulier** (via API Particulier)
- **Purpose:** Retrieve tax data WITH user consent
- **Access:** Authorized administrations and services only
- **URL:** https://api.gouv.fr/les-api/impot-particulier
- **FranceConnect:** Required (user must authenticate)
- **Data provided:**
  - Tax notice (avis d'imposition)
  - Tax household income (revenu fiscal de r√©f√©rence)
  - Tax amount
  - Number of dependents
- **Use case:** Third parties verifying user income for loans, benefits, etc.
- **NOT for:** Automated form filling by users themselves

**2. API Particulier**
- **URL:** https://particulier.api.gouv.fr/
- **Purpose:** Aggregate API for multiple government data sources
- **Includes:** Tax data, CAF data, P√¥le Emploi data
- **Access:** Authorized organizations only (must apply)
- **User consent:** Required via FranceConnect
- **Rate limits:** Yes
- **Cost:** Free for eligible public services

### Form Submission
- **Online filing:** Mandatory if internet access available
- **Platform:** Web-based form on impots.gouv.fr
- **Prefilled data:** Tax returns increasingly prefilled
- **Automation:**
  - ‚ùå Direct automation: Prohibited
  - ‚ùå Scraping: Against ToS and technically prevented
  - ‚ö†Ô∏è Manual only: User must log in and submit

### Technical Barriers
- CAPTCHA on login and sensitive operations
- Session tokens with short expiration
- Browser fingerprinting
- IP-based rate limiting
- Terms of Service prohibit automated access

### Automation Verdict
- ‚ùå **User automation:** NOT POSSIBLE (and illegal)
- ‚úÖ **Service provider integration:** Possible with authorization
- ‚ö†Ô∏è **Recommended approach:** Assist user with data collection, user submits manually

---

## üè• AMELI.FR - Health Insurance (CPAM)

### Platform Details
- **URL:** https://www.ameli.fr/
- **Authority:** CNAM (Caisse Nationale d'Assurance Maladie)
- **Mobile App:** Yes (iOS, Android) - "Ameli"

### Authentication
- **FranceConnect:** ‚úÖ Supported
- **Direct login:** Social security number + password
- **2FA:** Available (recommended)

### API Availability

#### For Service Providers - YES (Limited)

**1. API Droits √† l'Assurance Maladie**
- **URL:** https://api.gouv.fr/les-api/api_ameli_droits_cnam
- **Purpose:** Verify health insurance coverage
- **FranceConnect:** Required
- **Data provided:**
  - Coverage status (yes/no)
  - Start/end dates of coverage
  - Regime type
  - Beneficiaries in household
- **Access:** Authorized organizations only
- **Use case:** Verify patient coverage before care

**2. API Indemnit√©s Journali√®res**
- **URL:** https://api.gouv.fr/les-api/api-indemnites-journalieres-cnam
- **Purpose:** Retrieve daily sickness benefit amounts
- **FranceConnect:** Required
- **Access:** Restricted to authorized services

**3. API Compl√©mentaire Sant√© Solidaire (C2S)**
- **Purpose:** Check C2S eligibility
- **Via:** API Particulier
- **Access:** Authorized services only

### For Individual Users - NO API
- ‚ùå No public API for personal use
- ‚ùå Automation prohibited in Terms of Service

### Common Operations
- View reimbursements (d√©comptes)
- Download attestations (coverage certificates)
- Update personal information
- Order European Health Insurance Card (CEAM)

### Technical Barriers
- Login CAPTCHA
- Session management
- Anti-scraping measures
- Terms of Service against automation

### Automation Verdict
- ‚ùå **User automation:** NOT POSSIBLE
- ‚úÖ **Service provider data retrieval:** Possible with authorization
- ‚ö†Ô∏è **Recommended:** Manual access only

---

## üë∂ CAF.FR - Family Allowance Fund

### Platform Details
- **URL:** https://www.caf.fr/
- **Mobile App:** Yes (iOS, Android) - "Caf - Mon Compte"
- **Geographic:** Network of local CAF offices (departmental)

### Authentication
- **FranceConnect:** ‚úÖ Supported
- **Direct login:** Allocataire number + password
- **Login varies:** By d√©partement (local CAF sites)

### API Availability

#### For Service Providers - PLANNED

**1. API Quotient Familial** (In development)
- **Status:** Specification phase (as of 2024-2026)
- **Purpose:** Retrieve family quotient (QF)
- **FranceConnect:** Will be required
- **Data planned:**
  - Family quotient (QF)
  - Household composition
  - Benefit eligibility
- **Access:** Authorized organizations (municipalities, schools, etc.)
- **Use case:** Determine tariffs for daycare, school meals, activities

**2. Via API Particulier**
- **Current availability:** Limited CAF data via API Particulier
- **URL:** https://particulier.api.gouv.fr/
- **Data available:**
  - Family composition (limited)
  - Housing benefit status
  - RSA recipient status
- **Access:** Authorized organizations only

### For Individual Users - NO API
- ‚ùå No public API for personal automation
- ‚ùå Terms of Service prohibit scraping

### Common Operations
- Apply for benefits (online forms)
- Quarterly income declarations (RSA, Prime d'activit√©)
- Upload supporting documents
- Download attestations (benefit statements)
- Update family situation

### Technical Challenges
- Decentralized: Each d√©partement has separate portal
- Different URLs: cafXX.fr (where XX = d√©partement number)
- CAPTCHA on login
- Document upload required (scans)
- Complex multi-step forms

### Automation Verdict
- ‚ùå **User automation:** NOT POSSIBLE
- ‚ö†Ô∏è **Future API:** May become available for authorized services
- üìù **Current state:** Manual only, document-heavy

---

## üè¢ AUTOENTREPRENEUR.URSSAF.FR - Self-Employed

### Platform Details
- **URL:** https://www.autoentrepreneur.urssaf.fr/
- **Authority:** URSSAF (Union de Recouvrement des Cotisations de S√©curit√© Sociale et d'Allocations Familiales)
- **Mobile App:** Yes - "AutoEntrepreneur Urssaf"

### Authentication
- **FranceConnect:** ‚úÖ Supported
- **Direct login:** SIRET + password

### API Availability

#### For Individual Auto-Entrepreneurs - NO PUBLIC API
- ‚ùå No public API for declaring revenue
- ‚ùå Automation prohibited

#### For Software Providers - YES (Certified Software)

**"Logiciel de Tenue de Caisse"**
- **Requirement:** Since 2018, certain businesses need certified accounting software
- **Certification:** LNE (Laboratoire National de M√©trologie et d'Essais)
- **Purpose:** Anti-fraud measure for cash-based businesses
- **Integration:** Certified software can interface with URSSAF systems
- **Access:** Software vendors must be certified

**Partner Software:**
- Several commercial partners integrate with URSSAF
- Examples: Indy, Shine, Freebe, Tiime, Pennylane
- Integration allows semi-automated declarations
- Still requires user review and approval

### Common Operations
- Monthly/quarterly revenue declaration
- Social contribution payment
- View contribution history
- Download attestations (URSSAF compliance certificates)
- Update business information

### Technical Details
- Simple interface (compared to other platforms)
- Revenue declaration is straightforward (3 fields typically)
- Declarations must be submitted even if revenue = 0
- Late declarations incur penalties automatically

### Automation Verdict
- ‚ùå **Direct user automation:** NOT ALLOWED
- ‚ö†Ô∏è **Via certified software:** Possible if using partner platforms
- üìä **Data export:** Users can export payment history
- üîå **Recommendation:** Integrate with partner accounting software

---

## üèõÔ∏è SERVICE-PUBLIC.FR - Unified Portal

### Platform Details
- **URL:** https://www.service-public.fr/
- **Purpose:** Information portal + procedural aggregator
- **Authority:** DILA (Direction de l'Information L√©gale et Administrative)

### Functionality
- ‚úÖ Information resource (not a transactional platform)
- ‚úÖ Links to actual service portals
- ‚úÖ Form downloads
- ‚úÖ Procedural guidance

### API - NONE
- No APIs (it's a documentation/portal site)
- Links redirect to actual platforms (ANTS, Impots, CAF, etc.)

### Automation
- N/A - Not a transactional platform

---

## ü™™ ANTS.GOUV.FR - National Agency for Secure Documents

### Platform Details
- **URL:** https://ants.gouv.fr/
- **Services:**
  - Driver's license
  - Vehicle registration (carte grise)
  - Passport
  - National ID card

### Authentication
- **FranceConnect:** ‚úÖ Required for most services
- **No direct login:** Must use FranceConnect

### API Availability
- ‚ùå **No public API**
- ‚ùå **No automation allowed**

### Process
- Pre-application online
- Upload documents (photos, scans)
- Appointment scheduling (for ID documents)
- In-person validation (biometrics for passports/ID)

### Technical Barriers
- Document upload required (photos, scans)
- CAPTCHA
- Appointment booking (physical presence needed)
- Biometric data collection in person

### Automation Verdict
- ‚ùå **Not automatable** (requires physical presence + biometrics)
- üì§ **Can assist:** Prepare documents, fill forms, schedule appointment
- üë§ **User must:** Appear in person for ID documents

---

## üìä SUMMARY MATRIX

| Platform | Public API | Service Provider API | FranceConnect Required | Automation Feasible | Manual Only Operations |
|----------|-----------|---------------------|----------------------|-------------------|----------------------|
| **Impots.gouv.fr** | ‚ùå No | ‚úÖ Yes (read-only, with consent) | ‚úÖ Yes | ‚ùå No | Tax filing, payments |
| **Ameli.fr** | ‚ùå No | ‚úÖ Yes (limited, read-only) | ‚úÖ Yes | ‚ùå No | All operations |
| **CAF.fr** | ‚ùå No | ‚ö†Ô∏è In development | ‚úÖ Yes | ‚ùå No | Applications, declarations |
| **AutoEntrepreneur.URSSAF** | ‚ùå No | ‚ö†Ô∏è Via certified software | ‚úÖ Yes | ‚ö†Ô∏è Limited (via partners) | Revenue declarations |
| **ANTS.gouv.fr** | ‚ùå No | ‚ùå No | ‚úÖ Yes | ‚ùå No | All (requires in-person) |
| **Service-Public.fr** | ‚ùå N/A | ‚ùå N/A | ‚ùå N/A | ‚ùå N/A | Information only |

---

## ü§ñ AUTOMATION STRATEGIES & RECOMMENDATIONS

### ‚ùå What CANNOT Be Automated (Legally & Technically)

1. **Tax filing for individuals** (Impots.gouv.fr)
   - Prohibited by Terms of Service
   - Technical anti-bot measures
   - Legal liability for errors

2. **Health insurance claims** (Ameli.fr)
   - No API for individual use
   - Anti-scraping protections

3. **CAF benefit applications**
   - Complex, document-heavy processes
   - No automation APIs
   - Fraud prevention measures

4. **Identity documents** (ANTS)
   - Requires physical presence
   - Biometric data collection

### ‚ö†Ô∏è What CAN Be Semi-Automated

1. **Data aggregation** (read-only)
   - IF building an authorized service
   - Via API Particulier + FranceConnect
   - Requires:
     - Legal entity (company/association)
     - Public service mission justification
     - User consent for each data access
     - Habilitation (authorization) from data providers

2. **Form assistance** (preparation only)
   - Gather user information
   - Prefill form fields (on user's device)
   - Guide user through process
   - User completes final submission manually

3. **Document management**
   - Organize supporting documents
   - Generate PDFs for upload
   - Reminder system for deadlines

4. **URSSAF via partners**
   - Use certified accounting software (Indy, Shine, etc.)
   - Semi-automated revenue declaration
   - User must review and approve

### ‚úÖ Recommended Approach for AI Form-Filling Service

#### Tier 1: Information Assistant (LEGAL, LOW-RISK)
- **What it does:**
  - Explains obligations and deadlines
  - Lists required documents
  - Provides procedural guidance
  - Sends reminders
- **Tech:** Chatbot, knowledge base, calendar integration
- **Risk:** None
- **Value:** High for user education

#### Tier 2: Document Preparation Assistant (LEGAL, MODERATE RISK)
- **What it does:**
  - Collects information via conversation
  - Generates prefilled PDF forms (locally)
  - Organizes documents for upload
  - Provides step-by-step instructions
- **Tech:** PDF generation, local storage, structured data collection
- **Risk:** Low (user reviews everything)
- **Value:** Saves time, reduces errors
- **Critical:** User retains full control and final submission

#### Tier 3: Integration Partner (LEGAL, REQUIRES AUTHORIZATION)
- **What it does:**
  - Retrieves user data via APIs (with consent)
  - Autofills forms with verified data
  - Connects to certified accounting software (URSSAF)
  - Provides dashboard of obligations
- **Tech:** API Particulier integration, FranceConnect, partner APIs
- **Requirements:**
  - Legal entity with public service mission or partnership
  - Habilitation from DINUM, DGFiP, CNAM, CNAF
  - Data protection compliance (GDPR, CNIL)
  - Secure infrastructure
- **Risk:** Moderate (regulatory compliance burden)
- **Value:** High automation, official data sources

#### ‚ùå Tier 4: Automated Submission (ILLEGAL - DO NOT PURSUE)
- **What it would do:** Submit forms on behalf of users without their direct action
- **Why not:**
  - Violates Terms of Service of all platforms
  - Illegal impersonation
  - Criminal liability for errors
  - Technical barriers (CAPTCHA, 2FA, anti-bot)
  - Impossible to maintain (platforms change frequently)

---

## üîê FRANCECONNECT INTEGRATION GUIDE (For Authorized Services)

If building an authorized service:

### 1. Eligibility Check
Are you:
- A public administration?
- A local government entity?
- A private company with a public service mission (DSP)?

If NO ‚Üí Cannot integrate FranceConnect or APIs

### 2. Application Process
1. **Request access:** https://franceconnect.gouv.fr/partenaires
2. **Submit documents:**
   - Legal status proof
   - Service description
   - Data protection impact assessment (AIPD)
   - CNIL compliance documentation
3. **Technical onboarding:**
   - OAuth 2.0 / OpenID Connect integration
   - Sandbox testing
   - Security audit
4. **Production approval**

### 3. API Habilitation (Separate Process)
Each API requires separate authorization:
- **API Imp√¥t Particulier:** Apply via api.gouv.fr
- **API Particulier:** Apply via particulier.api.gouv.fr
- **API Ameli:** Apply via CNAM
- **API CAF:** Apply via CNAF

**Timeline:** 3-6 months for full authorization

---

## üìù LEGAL & COMPLIANCE CONSIDERATIONS

### GDPR & Data Protection
- **User consent:** Explicit opt-in required for data processing
- **Purpose limitation:** Data used only for stated purpose
- **Data minimization:** Collect only necessary fields
- **Right to erasure:** Users can request data deletion
- **CNIL registration:** May be required depending on processing

### Terms of Service
- **Impots.gouv.fr:** Prohibits automated access (Article 7.2)
- **Ameli.fr:** Prohibits scraping and unauthorized data collection
- **CAF.fr:** Restricts automated form submission
- **URSSAF:** Allows access via certified software only

### Criminal Liability
- **Fraudulent access:** 2 years imprisonment, ‚Ç¨60,000 fine (Article 323-1 Code P√©nal)
- **Identity fraud:** 1 year, ‚Ç¨15,000 fine
- **Tax fraud:** Up to 5 years, ‚Ç¨500,000 fine

### Recommendations
- ‚úÖ **Comply fully** with Terms of Service
- ‚úÖ **Obtain authorizations** before API integration
- ‚úÖ **User-driven:** User must explicitly approve all submissions
- ‚úÖ **Transparency:** Clearly explain what the service does and doesn't do
- ‚ùå **Never:** Submit forms without explicit user action

---

## üéØ CONCLUSION & VIABLE PRODUCT STRATEGY

### What Users Need (Pain Points)
1. Understanding complex obligations
2. Tracking deadlines
3. Gathering required documents
4. Filling repetitive information across multiple forms
5. Avoiding errors and penalties

### What Technology Can Provide Legally
1. **Education:** Explain obligations in plain language
2. **Organization:** Calendar, reminders, document storage
3. **Efficiency:** Prefill forms with user-provided data (stored locally)
4. **Guidance:** Step-by-step instructions with screenshots
5. **Peace of mind:** Validation checks before user submits

### Viable Product: "AI Administrative Assistant"

**Core Features (No authorization needed):**
- Obligation calendar with smart reminders
- Document checklist generator
- Conversational form assistant (ask questions, AI helps fill locally)
- PDF generator for common forms (prefilled from user input)
- Deadline tracker synced with official calendars
- Multi-platform guide (how to submit on each portal)

**Premium Features (Requires authorization as service provider):**
- FranceConnect integration for identity verification
- API-based data retrieval (tax notice, CAF quotient)
- Direct document upload to compatible platforms
- Partner integration (certified URSSAF software)

**Value Proposition:**
"We prepare everything. You submit with one click."
(User still clicks "submit" on official platforms, but all preparation is done)

---

## üîó USEFUL RESOURCES

- **FranceConnect Partners:** https://franceconnect.gouv.fr/partenaires
- **API Particulier:** https://particulier.api.gouv.fr/
- **API Catalog:** https://api.gouv.fr/
- **DINUM (Digital Ministry):** https://www.numerique.gouv.fr/
- **CNIL (Data Protection):** https://www.cnil.fr/
- **Legal Framework:** https://www.legifrance.gouv.fr/

---

*Last Updated: February 2026*
*Status: Current based on publicly available documentation*
*Note: API availability and policies subject to change; verify before development*

files.name: gemini-3-design-capabilities.md
files.content:
# Gemini 3 Design Capabilities: Comprehensive Research for Graphic Designers

**Research Date:** February 16, 2026  
**Target Audience:** Kabundji (Graphic Designer working with template systems)  
**Focus:** Evaluating Gemini 3 as a design-focused LLM vs other models

---

## Executive Summary

**Verdict:** Gemini 3 is the **strongest design-focused LLM available in 2026**, particularly for UI generation, image-to-code workflows, and visual understanding. However, for pure code quality and debugging, Claude Opus 4.5/4.6 still holds an edge.

**Best Strategy for Kabundji's Template System:**
- **Vision/Analysis:** Gemini 3 Pro (design understanding, color/typography extraction)
- **Code Generation:** Gemini 3 Pro or Claude Opus 4.6 (both excellent, pick based on cost)
- **Image Generation:** Nano Banana Pro (Gemini 3 Pro Image) for design assets
- **Cost-Optimized:** Gemini 3 Flash for high-volume tasks

---

## 1. Gemini 3 Design Capabilities

### What Can It Do for Design?

Gemini 3 represents a significant leap in design-aware AI. Here's what it offers:

#### UI Generation & Code Output
- **Native multimodal workflow:** Analyze a design image ‚Üí generate HTML/CSS/React code in one pass
- **Component-based thinking:** Scaffolds proper component hierarchy, not just flat HTML
- **Design system integration:** Can establish type scales, color systems, spacing tokens automatically
- **Semantic HTML:** Generates accessible, semantic markup with proper ARIA attributes
- **Framework support:** HTML, CSS, React, Vue, Tailwind, Next.js, Flutter

#### Image Analysis & Understanding
‚úÖ **Design-first analysis:** Unlike generic vision models, Gemini 3 understands:
- **Typography:** Font families, weights, sizes, hierarchy, line-height, letter-spacing
- **Color theory:** Color palettes, contrast ratios, color psychology, brand consistency
- **Composition:** Layout principles, visual hierarchy, whitespace, grid systems
- **Design patterns:** Recognizes UI patterns (cards, hero sections, navigation, etc.)

**Real capability example:**
> "Upload a screenshot of a website, and Gemini 3 Pro can extract the exact color palette (#HEX codes), identify typography choices (font families + sizes), analyze spacing systems, and generate a design system specification ‚Äî all in seconds."

#### Native Multimodal Abilities
- **Input:** Text, images, audio, video, PDFs, code repositories
- **Output:** Text, code, structured data
- **Context window:** 1 million tokens (can process entire design systems)
- **Output limit:** 64k tokens (enough for complex multi-file projects)

#### Screenshot-to-Code Excellence
Gemini 3 Pro excels at the **image-to-code pipeline**:
1. Upload design mockup (Figma export, screenshot, wireframe)
2. Gemini analyzes layout, components, styling
3. Generates React/Next.js/HTML with accurate styling
4. Includes responsive design patterns

**Popular tools using Gemini 3 for screenshot-to-code:**
- [screenshot-to-code](https://github.com/abi/screenshot-to-code) (open source, now supports Gemini 3)
- Google Stitch (Google Labs experimental tool)
- Figma Make (direct integration)

---

## 2. Gemini 3 Image Generation: Nano Banana Pro

### Can Gemini 3 Generate Images?

**YES!** Gemini 3 integrates with **Nano Banana Pro** (formerly Imagen 3+), Google's highest-quality image generation model.

### Nano Banana Pro Features

| Feature | Capability |
|---------|------------|
| **Resolution** | 1K, 2K, 4K output |
| **Text rendering** | Accurate multilingual text in images (game-changer for mockups) |
| **Style control** | Photorealistic, illustration, sketch, 3D, artistic styles |
| **Design assets** | UI mockups, marketing materials, infographics, posters |
| **Aspect ratios** | 1:1, 16:9, 9:16, 4:3, 3:4 |
| **Editing** | Can modify existing images (change colors, text, elements) |

### Quality Comparison: Nano Banana Pro vs Competitors

| Model | Photorealism | Text Accuracy | Design Asset Quality | Speed |
|-------|--------------|---------------|---------------------|-------|
| **Nano Banana Pro** | ‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê | ‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê (best) | ‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê | Fast |
| **Flux 2 Pro** | ‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê | ‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê | ‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê | Medium |
| **Seedream 4.5** | ‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê | ‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê | ‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê | Fast |
| **DALL-E 3** | ‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê | ‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê | ‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê | Fast |
| **Midjourney v7** | ‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê | ‚≠ê‚≠ê | ‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê | Medium |
| **Stable Diffusion XL** | ‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê | ‚≠ê‚≠ê | ‚≠ê‚≠ê‚≠ê | Very Fast |

**Key Differentiator:** Nano Banana Pro's **text rendering** is unmatched. It can generate:
- Mockups with accurate UI text
- Marketing posters with legible, stylized text
- Infographics with multiple text elements
- Multilingual designs (20+ languages)

### Can It Generate UI Mockups from Text?

**Yes, and it's REALLY good at it.**

Example workflow:
```
Prompt: "Generate a modern SaaS landing page mockup for a project 
management tool. Clean, minimal design with blue/white color scheme, 
hero section with dashboard screenshot, three feature cards, and CTA."

Output: High-fidelity 4K mockup with:
- Realistic UI elements
- Proper spacing and hierarchy
- Legible placeholder text
- Professional color palette
```

---

## 3. Gemini 3 Technical Architecture

### Model Sizes & Variants

| Model | Use Case | Speed | Cost | Context |
|-------|----------|-------|------|---------|
| **Gemini 3 Pro** | Complex design tasks, reasoning, multi-file projects | Medium | $$$ | 1M tokens |
| **Gemini 3 Flash** | Fast prototyping, high-volume tasks, real-time UI | Very Fast | $ | 1M tokens |
| **Gemini 3 Pro Image (Nano Banana Pro)** | Image generation/editing | Medium | $$ | N/A |
| **Gemini 3 Deep Think** | Scientific/research tasks (not design-focused) | Slow | $$$$ | 1M tokens |

### Context Window & Capabilities

- **Input context:** 1 million tokens (can process ~750,000 words or 100+ design files)
- **Output limit:** 64,000 tokens (~48,000 words or a full multi-page React app)
- **Multimodal inputs:** Text, images, audio, video, PDFs, code
- **Thinking modes:** Minimal, low, medium, high (adaptive reasoning)

### API Access & Pricing (2026)

#### Google AI Studio (Free Tier)
- **FREE** for development/testing in AI Studio
- **Gemini 3 Flash:** Free tier available via API
- **Rate limits:** ~1500 requests/day (free tier)

#### Gemini API Pricing (Paid Production)

**Gemini 3 Pro:**
| Context Range | Input (per 1M tokens) | Output (per 1M tokens) |
|---------------|----------------------|----------------------|
| 0-200K tokens | $2.00 | $12.00 |
| 200K-1M tokens | $4.00 | $18.00 |

**Gemini 3 Flash:**
| Context Range | Input (per 1M tokens) | Output (per 1M tokens) |
|---------------|----------------------|----------------------|
| All contexts | $0.075 | $0.60 |

**Nano Banana Pro (Image Generation):**
- ~$0.05-0.10 per image (1K resolution)
- ~$0.20-0.30 per image (4K resolution)

#### Vertex AI Pricing
- Same pricing as Gemini API
- Additional enterprise features (SLA, data residency, VPC)
- Better for high-volume production use

#### OpenRouter Access
- Gemini 3 available via OpenRouter
- Unified API for multiple models
- Pricing: OpenRouter markup + Google's base rates

### Rate Limits

| Tier | Requests/Minute | Tokens/Minute |
|------|----------------|---------------|
| Free (AI Studio) | 15 | 1M |
| Pay-as-you-go | 360 | 30M |
| Enterprise (Vertex) | Custom | Custom |

---

## 4. Gemini vs Other Models: Design Task Comparison

### Detailed Feature Matrix

### Key Insights from Real-World Testing

**Gemini 3 Pro wins when:**
- You need design understanding (color, typography, layout analysis)
- Screenshot-to-code workflows
- Analyzing existing designs for extraction
- Rapid UI prototyping with Figma/design mockups
- Multi-step design reasoning (system thinking)

**Claude Opus 4.5/4.6 wins when:**
- Pure code quality matters more than design understanding
- Complex refactoring and debugging
- Following precise instructions across multi-file changes
- Enterprise-grade code generation (fewer bugs)

**GPT-4o is solid but middle-ground:**
- Good at both design and code, but not #1 at either
- Faster than Claude, slower than Gemini Flash
- DALL-E 3 integration, but text rendering inferior to Nano Banana

**Llama 3.3 & Qwen 2.5:**
- Open models, great for cost-sensitive workflows
- Not design-specialized (generic vision capabilities)
- Good code generation, but less design-aware

### Proposed Multi-Model Pipeline

Based on research, here's the optimal pipeline for Kabundji's template factory:

#### **Step 1: Image Analysis (Extract Design Attributes)**

**Model:** Gemini 3 Pro  
**Why:** Best vision model for design understanding

**Input:** Template screenshot/mockup  
**Prompt:**
```
Analyze this design template and extract:
1. Color palette (hex codes for primary, secondary, accent colors)
2. Typography (font families, sizes, weights for H1-H6, body, captions)
3. Layout structure (grid system, spacing patterns)
4. Component breakdown (header, hero, cards, footer)
5. Design style (modern, minimal, corporate, playful, etc.)

Output as JSON.
```

#### **Step 2: Code Generation (HTML/Next.js/React)**

**Options:**

**A) Gemini 3 Pro (Recommended for design fidelity)**
- Pros: Best at matching visual design, understands spacing/colors/typography
- Cons: Slightly more expensive than Flash
- Cost: $2-4 per 1M input tokens, $12-18 per 1M output tokens

**B) Claude Opus 4.6 (Recommended for code quality)**
- Pros: Cleanest code, fewer bugs, better component architecture
- Cons: Expensive, weaker design understanding
- Cost: $15 per 1M input tokens, $75 per 1M output tokens

**C) Gemini 3 Flash (Recommended for high-volume)**
- Pros: Very fast, cheap, still decent quality
- Cons: Less precise than Pro
- Cost: $0.075 per 1M input tokens, $0.60 per 1M output tokens

**Kabundji's Best Bet: Gemini 3 Flash ‚Üí Manual Review**
- Use Flash for initial code generation (90% there, 5x cheaper)
- Manual refinement for production quality
- Claude for complex components only

**Prompt:**
```
Generate a Next.js component for this template section:
- Design tokens: [JSON from Step 1]
- Section: Hero with CTA button
- Framework: Next.js 15, React, Tailwind CSS
- Requirements: Responsive, mobile-first, accessible

Include:
- Semantic HTML
- Tailwind utility classes
- TypeScript types
- Comments for customization points
```

## 8. Practical Setup Guide

### How to Get API Access

#### Option 1: Google AI Studio (Free + Fast)

**Best for:** Testing, low-volume production, personal projects

1. **Visit:** https://aistudio.google.com/
2. **Sign in** with Google account
3. **Get API key:** https://aistudio.google.com/app/apikey
4. **Free tier:**
   - Gemini 3 Flash: 15 RPM, 1M TPM (free)
   - Gemini 3 Pro: Limited free in AI Studio UI
   - Rate limits: 1500 requests/day

**API Example (Node.js):**
```javascript
import { GoogleGenerativeAI } from "@google/generative-ai";

const genAI = new GoogleGenerativeAI("YOUR_API_KEY");
const model = genAI.getGenerativeModel({ model: "gemini-3-flash" });

const result = await model.generateContent([
  "Analyze this design and extract colors",
  {inlineData: {data: imageBase64, mimeType: "image/png"}}
]);

console.log(result.response.text());
```

#### Option 2: Vertex AI (Production + Enterprise)

**Best for:** High-volume, enterprise, need SLA/security

1. **Create Google Cloud project:** https://console.cloud.google.com
2. **Enable Vertex AI API**
3. **Set up authentication:** Service account + JSON key
4. **Billing:** Pay-as-you-go (same pricing as AI Studio API)

**Benefits:**
- Higher rate limits
- VPC support
- Data residency controls
- SLA guarantees
- Better monitoring/logging

**API Example (Node.js):**
```javascript
const {VertexAI} = require('@google-cloud/vertexai');

const vertexAI = new VertexAI({
  project: 'your-project-id',
  location: 'us-central1'
});

const model = vertexAI.getGenerativeModel({model: 'gemini-3-pro'});
const result = await model.generateContent('Design a card component');
```

#### Option 3: OpenRouter (Multi-Model Access)

**Best for:** Want to switch between models (Gemini, Claude, GPT)

1. **Visit:** https://openrouter.ai
2. **Sign up + get API key**
3. **Unified API** for all models
4. **Pricing:** OpenRouter markup + base model cost

**API Example:**
```javascript
fetch("https://openrouter.ai/api/v1/chat/completions", {
  method: "POST",
  headers: {
    "Authorization": `Bearer ${OPENROUTER_KEY}`,
    "Content-Type": "application/json"
  },
  body: JSON.stringify({
    "model": "google/gemini-3-pro",
    "messages": [{role: "user", content: "Generate a navbar"}]
  })
});
```

### Code Example: Sending Image to Gemini for Design Analysis

**Node.js + Next.js Integration:**

```javascript
// pages/api/analyze-design.js
import { GoogleGenerativeAI } from "@google/generative-ai";
import fs from "fs";

export default async function handler(req, res) {
  if (req.method !== 'POST') {
    return res.status(405).json({ error: 'Method not allowed' });
  }

  try {
    const { imageBase64 } = req.body;
    
    const genAI = new GoogleGenerativeAI(process.env.GEMINI_API_KEY);
    const model = genAI.getGenerativeModel({ 
      model: "gemini-3-flash" // or gemini-3-pro
    });

    const prompt = `Analyze this design template and extract:
1. Color palette (hex codes)
2. Typography (font families, sizes)
3. Layout structure
4. Component breakdown

Output as JSON.`;

    const result = await model.generateContent([
      prompt,
      {
        inlineData: {
          data: imageBase64,
          mimeType: "image/png"
        }
      }
    ]);

    const analysisText = result.response.text();
    
    // Parse JSON from response (may need cleaning)
    const jsonMatch = analysisText.match(/```json\n([\s\S]*?)\n```/);
    const analysis = jsonMatch 
      ? JSON.parse(jsonMatch[1]) 
      : JSON.parse(analysisText);

    res.status(200).json({ analysis });
  } catch (error) {
    console.error('Gemini API error:', error);
    res.status(500).json({ error: error.message });
  }
}
```

**Frontend (React/Next.js):**

```tsx
// components/DesignAnalyzer.tsx
'use client';
import { useState } from 'react';

export default function DesignAnalyzer() {
  const [analysis, setAnalysis] = useState(null);
  const [loading, setLoading] = useState(false);

  const analyzeImage = async (file: File) => {
    setLoading(true);
    
    const reader = new FileReader();
    reader.onload = async (e) => {
      const base64 = e.target?.result?.toString().split(',')[1];
      
      const response = await fetch('/api/analyze-design', {
        method: 'POST',
        headers: { 'Content-Type': 'application/json' },
        body: JSON.stringify({ imageBase64: base64 })
      });

      const data = await response.json();
      setAnalysis(data.analysis);
      setLoading(false);
    };
    
    reader.readAsDataURL(file);
  };

  return (
    <div>
      <input 
        type="file" 
        accept="image/*"
        onChange={(e) => analyzeImage(e.target.files[0])}
      />
      
      {loading && <p>Analyzing design...</p>}
      
      {analysis && (
        <pre>{JSON.stringify(analysis, null, 2)}</pre>
      )}
    </div>
  );
}
```

‚úÖ Cost-effectiveness (Flash variant)  
‚úÖ Speed (Flash variant)

**Where Gemini 3 FALLS SHORT:**

**Budget allocation (monthly):**
- Gemini 3 Flash: $90-100 (bulk work)
- Gemini 3 Pro: $30-50 (vision tasks)
- Nano Banana Pro: $20-30 (image generation)
- Claude (optional): $100-200 (code review for premium templates)

**Total: $240-380/month** for 100 templates/day (3000/month)  
**Per-template cost: $0.08-0.13**

---

## 10. Additional Resources

### Official Documentation
- [Gemini 3 Developer Guide](https://ai.google.dev/gemini-api/docs/gemini-3)
- [Gemini API Pricing](https://ai.google.dev/gemini-api/docs/pricing)
- [Nano Banana Pro Docs](https://ai.google.dev/gemini-api/docs/image-generation)
- [Vertex AI Gemini Docs](https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/models/gemini/3-pro)

### Tools & Libraries
- [screenshot-to-code (GitHub)](https://github.com/abi/screenshot-to-code) - Open source, Gemini 3 support
- [Flutter Gemini Package](https://pub.dev/packages/flutter_gemini)
- [Figma Gemini CLI Extension](https://github.com/figma/figma-gemini-cli-extension)
- [Google AI Studio](https://aistudio.google.com/) - Free testing environment

### Community Resources
- r/GoogleGeminiAI - Reddit community
- r/FlutterDev - Flutter discussions (Gemini + Flutter)
- [Better Stack Gemini 3 Guide](https://betterstack.com/community/guides/ai/gemini-3/)
- [UX Planet: Gemini 3 for Product Design](https://uxplanet.org/what-gemini-3-pro-changes-about-product-design-59397efbc527)

---

## Conclusion

**Gemini 3 is THE design-focused LLM for 2026.** Its native multimodal understanding, design systems thinking, and cost-effective Flash variant make it ideal for Kabundji's template factory.

**Key takeaway:** Use a multi-model approach:
- **Gemini 3 Flash** for 90% of work (speed + cost)
- **Gemini 3 Pro** for design analysis (vision)
- **Claude Opus** for code review (optional, for premium templates)
- **Nano Banana Pro** for image generation

This strategy delivers **professional quality at $0.08-0.13 per template** ‚Äî scalable, cost-effective, and production-ready.

---

**Research compiled by:** OpenClaw Subagent  
**Date:** February 16, 2026  
**Sources:** Web search (Brave), official documentation, community feedback  
**Status:** ‚úÖ Ready for production implementation

files.name: template-enhancement-resources.md
files.content:
# üéØ Template Enhancement Resources ‚Äî Deep Analysis
*Compiled: Feb 18, 2026 | For: Pulse Graphix Template System*

---

## 1. SUPAHERO (supahero.io) ‚Äî Hero Section Library

### What It Is
Curated library of high-quality hero sections from real websites. Now merged with **screensdesign.com** (biggest UX app library). Also sells **Framer templates** directly.

### Key Patterns to Steal
- **Story-driven heroes** ‚Äî not just tagline + button. Show the product/service value visually in the first fold
- **Split hero layouts** ‚Äî text left, interactive visual right
- **Video background heroes** ‚Äî ambient motion, not autoplay with sound
- **Gradient mesh heroes** ‚Äî soft organic shapes behind bold typography
- **3D element heroes** ‚Äî floating objects, isometric illustrations

### How to Apply to Our Templates
| Pattern | Implementation | Priority |
|---------|---------------|----------|
| Hero variant library | Build 10+ hero section variants per template | üî¥ HIGH |
| Animated hero backgrounds | Use Unicorn Studio WebGL or CSS animations | üî¥ HIGH |
| Interactive product mockups | Embed rotating/scrolling device frames | üü° MED |
| Split-screen layout | 50/50 or 60/40 text-visual splits | üî¥ HIGH |
| Scroll-triggered reveals | Fade-in, slide-up on scroll | üü° MED |

---

## 2. BENTO GRIDS (bentogrids.com) ‚Äî Layout Inspiration

### What It Is
Curated collection of bento-style grid layouts. The trend was popularized by **Apple's product spec videos** (iPhone/Mac events) and Microsoft's Metro design.

### Why Bento Grids Are a Goldmine for Templates
- **Most requested layout style in 2025-2026** ‚Äî every SaaS, startup, and portfolio wants it
- **Modular by nature** ‚Äî easy for clients to rearrange
- **Visual hierarchy built-in** ‚Äî large feature cards + smaller detail cards
- **Works for everything:** features, pricing, team, stats, testimonials

### Key Bento Patterns
| Pattern | Description | Use Case |
|---------|-------------|----------|
| **2:1 Feature Grid** | 1 large card (2 cols) + 2 small cards | Feature highlights |
| **Stats Bento** | Numbers in varying card sizes | Dashboard-style metrics |
| **Image + Text Mix** | Alternating visual/text cards | Portfolio, services |
| **Nested Bento** | Cards within cards | Complex feature pages |
| **Animated Bento** | Cards animate in on scroll, hover effects | Premium SaaS templates |

### How to Apply
```
EVERY Pulse Graphix template should include:
1. At least ONE bento grid section (features or services)
2. CSS Grid with gap: 1rem, varying span sizes
3. Hover state on each card (subtle lift + shadow)
4. Optional: animated counters in stat cards
```

**CSS Framework:**
```css
.bento-grid {
  display: grid;
  grid-template-columns: repeat(4, 1fr);
  gap: 1rem;
}
.bento-card { border-radius: 1.25rem; }
.bento-card--large { grid-column: span 2; grid-row: span 2; }
.bento-card--wide { grid-column: span 2; }
.bento-card--tall { grid-row: span 2; }
```

---

## 3. CTA GALLERY (cta.gallery) ‚Äî Call-to-Action Patterns

### What It Is
Curated gallery of CTAs sorted by **industry** and **mode** (light/dark). Sponsored by Webestica (Webflow + Bootstrap template creator ‚Äî competitor to study).

### CTA Patterns That Convert (2026 Trends)
| Pattern | Description | Conversion Impact |
|---------|-------------|-------------------|
| **Benefit-driven text** | "Start growing" not "Sign up" | +20-35% clicks |
| **Dual CTA** | Primary + secondary ("Try free" + "See demo") | +15% engagement |
| **Social proof CTA** | "Join 10,000+ users" near button | +25% trust |
| **Animated CTA** | Subtle pulse, gradient shift on button | +10% attention |
| **Contextual CTA** | Changes based on scroll position/section | +30% relevance |
| **Sticky CTA** | Fixed bottom bar on mobile | +40% mobile conversion |
| **Input + CTA combo** | Email field + "Get started" in one line | Reduces friction |

### How to Apply
```
EVERY template CTA section must include:
1. Benefit-driven button text (never generic "Submit")
2. Supporting micro-copy below button ("No credit card required")
3. Social proof element (avatar stack, user count, logos)
4. At least 2 CTA variants (hero CTA + mid-page CTA + footer CTA)
5. Mobile sticky CTA option
```

---

## 4. MOBBIN (mobbin.com) ‚Äî UI/UX Pattern Library

### What It Is
Massive searchable database of **1,150+ apps**, **593,700+ screens**, **315,100+ flows** from real iOS, Android & web apps. Features:
- **Flows** ‚Äî complete user journeys with transitions & animations
- **Prototype mode** ‚Äî step-by-step interactive walkthroughs
- **Figma plugin** ‚Äî copy designs directly into Figma
- **Collections** ‚Äî save & organize inspiration

### Pricing
- **Free tier** ‚Äî limited browsing
- **Pro** ‚Äî full access (~$1,000/yr for teams, varies)

### How to Use for Templates
| Use Case | What to Study | Template Application |
|----------|--------------|---------------------|
| **Onboarding flows** | How top apps welcome users | Add onboarding screens to SaaS templates |
| **Dashboard layouts** | Real dashboard patterns from 1000+ apps | Build premium dashboard templates |
| **Settings pages** | Best UX for settings/account | Include settings page in web app templates |
| **Pricing pages** | How successful SaaS present pricing | Create high-converting pricing sections |
| **Empty states** | How apps handle no-data situations | Add empty state designs to templates |
| **Navigation patterns** | Sidebar, top-nav, command palette | Multiple nav options per template |

### Key Insight
Mobbin is your **research tool, not your design tool**. Use it to study what works in production apps, then apply those patterns to templates. The free tier is enough for inspiration browsing.

---

## 5. DRIBBBLE (dribbble.com) ‚Äî Creative Visuals

### What It Is
The world's biggest design community. 3,500+ SaaS landing page designs alone.

### How to Use Strategically
| Strategy | Action |
|----------|--------|
| **Trend scouting** | Browse "Popular" weekly for emerging styles |
| **Color palette mining** | Screenshot palettes from top shots |
| **Component harvesting** | Study specific elements (cards, headers, footers) |
| **Client convincing** | Show Dribbble shots as style references in proposals |
| **Competitive analysis** | Search "Framer template" or "Webflow template" to see what sells |

### Current Dribbble Trends (2026)
- Glassmorphism 2.0 (frosted glass + subtle grain texture)
- 3D floating elements (product mockups, abstract shapes)
- Dark mode with neon accents (electric blue, cyan, purple)
- Oversized typography (120px+ display fonts)
- Gradient mesh backgrounds
- Claymorphism (soft 3D clay-like UI elements)
- Organic/blob shapes as section dividers

---

## 6. UNICORN STUDIO (unicorn.studio) ‚Äî WebGL Backgrounds

### What It Is
No-code tool for creating **WebGL effects, motion, and interactivity**. Embeds into Framer, Webflow, or any website. Uses SDK for native code embedding for max performance.

### Why This Is a Game-Changer for Templates
- **Premium differentiator** ‚Äî animated WebGL backgrounds instantly elevate any template from $49 to $99+
- **No-code** ‚Äî you don't need Three.js knowledge
- **Embeddable** ‚Äî works with Framer and Webflow (our target platforms)
- **Performance** ‚Äî native SDK means no iframe jank

### Effects Available
| Effect Type | Description | Template Use |
|-------------|-------------|-------------|
| **Gradient mesh** | Animated flowing gradients | Hero backgrounds |
| **Particle fields** | Floating dots/connections | Tech/SaaS hero |
| **Noise/grain** | Animated grain texture | Dark mode luxury feel |
| **Blob morph** | Organic shape animations | Creative agency templates |
| **3D scenes** | Rotating objects, depth | Product showcases |
| **Cursor reactive** | Effects follow mouse | Interactive hero sections |

### Pricing to Investigate
Need to check current plans ‚Äî was mentioned in our template strategy as a key tool.

---

## üöÄ ENHANCEMENT RECOMMENDATIONS

### Tier 1: Immediate Template Upgrades (This Week)

**1. Bento Grid Section Component**
Build a reusable bento grid component with 5 layout variants:
- 2√ó2 balanced
- Featured (1 large + 3 small)
- Masonry-style (mixed heights)
- Stats dashboard
- Image gallery

**2. Hero Section Library (5 Variants Per Template)**
- Video background hero
- Split screen (text + mockup)
- Centered minimal (gradient + headline)
- Animated gradient mesh (Unicorn Studio)
- Interactive/3D hero

**3. CTA Section Upgrade**
Replace basic CTAs with conversion-optimized patterns:
- Add social proof near every CTA button
- Dual CTA (primary + ghost button)
- Sticky mobile CTA bar
- Benefit-driven copy defaults

### Tier 2: Premium Template Differentiators (Next 2 Weeks)

**4. Unicorn Studio Integration**
- Create 5 reusable WebGL backgrounds
- Package as "premium backgrounds" included with templates
- This alone justifies premium pricing ($79-99 vs $49)

**5. Micro-Animation System**
Build a consistent animation library:
- Scroll reveal (fade-up, fade-in, slide-left/right)
- Hover states (lift, glow, scale)
- Loading/transition animations
- Counter animations for stats sections
- Staggered grid animations (cards appear one by one)

**6. Mobbin-Inspired Flow Pages**
Add these pages to every SaaS template:
- Onboarding wizard (3-step)
- Settings/account page
- Empty states
- 404 page (branded)
- Pricing comparison table

### Tier 3: Competitive Moat (Month 2-3)

**7. "Sections Library" Product**
Instead of selling complete templates, sell a **sections library**:
- 50+ sections (heroes, features, CTAs, pricing, testimonials, FAQs, footers)
- Mix-and-match in Framer/Webflow
- Price: $149-199 for the full library
- Recurring updates ($99/yr)

**8. Industry-Specific Template Packs**
Based on Mobbin research, create specialized packs:
- Restaurant/Food ($79)
- SaaS/Startup ($99)
- Agency/Portfolio ($89)
- E-commerce ($99)
- Personal Brand ($69)

---

## üìä COMPETITIVE EDGE SUMMARY

| What Most Template Sellers Do | What We Should Do |
|-------------------------------|-------------------|
| Static hero section | 5 hero variants + WebGL option |
| Basic CSS grid | Bento grid system with animations |
| Generic "Sign Up" CTA | Conversion-optimized dual CTAs with social proof |
| No animations | Micro-animation system (scroll, hover, load) |
| One layout per template | Modular sections library approach |
| Screenshots as previews | Interactive Framer previews |
| No dark mode | Light + dark mode included |
| Single industry | Industry-specific customization notes |

---

## üîß SKILLS WE ALREADY HAVE

| Skill | Relevance | Status |
|-------|-----------|--------|
| `canvas-design` | Visual art, poster design | ‚úÖ Installed |
| `typography` | Type scales, font pairing | ‚úÖ Installed |
| `web-typography` | Web font loading, responsive type | ‚úÖ Installed |
| `icon-design` | Lucide/Heroicons/Phosphor selection | ‚úÖ Installed |
| `favicon-gen` | Favicon for template branding | ‚úÖ Installed |
| `shadcn-ui` | Component patterns, Tailwind | ‚úÖ Installed |
| `ui-design-system` | Design system architecture | ‚úÖ Installed |
| `color-palette` | WCAG accessible palettes | ‚úÖ Installed |
| `happy-hues` | Curated color schemes | ‚úÖ Installed |
| `frontend-design` | Modern UI guidelines | ‚úÖ Installed |
| `html-to-pdf` | Export proposals as PDF | ‚úÖ Installed |

### Skills We Could Use (Not Installed)
| Need | Solution |
|------|----------|
| WebGL/Three.js animations | Unicorn Studio (no-code) or custom Three.js |
| Framer-specific patterns | Need Framer skill or documentation |
| GSAP animations | Could build or find a skill |
| Webflow integration | Need Webflow skill |

---

## üéØ NEXT STEPS

1. **Build bento grid component** ‚Äî reusable CSS Grid + Tailwind
2. **Create 5 hero variants** ‚Äî one for each style
3. **Set up Unicorn Studio account** ‚Äî test WebGL backgrounds
4. **Study top 10 Framer templates on marketplace** ‚Äî reverse-engineer what sells
5. **Build micro-animation CSS library** ‚Äî scroll reveals, hover states
6. **Create a "sections library" prototype** ‚Äî test modular approach

---

*Save this file. Reference when building any new template.*

daily-backup.sh
files.content:
#!/bin/bash
# Alex Prime Daily Backup Script
# Backs up entire .openclaw folder to Google Drive

set -e

# Configuration
BACKUP_DIR="/tmp/alex-prime-backups"
OPENCLAW_DIR="/home/ubuntu/.openclaw"
GDRIVE_FOLDER_ID="1V-EN0KdCTYekeHoNiYdW5EZTOSG93Pyb"
DATE=$(date +%Y-%m-%d)
BACKUP_NAME="alex-prime-backup-${DATE}.tar.gz"

# Export for gog CLI
export GOG_KEYRING_PASSWORD="openclaw"

echo "üîÑ Starting Alex Prime backup - ${DATE}"

# Create backup directory
mkdir -p "$BACKUP_DIR"

# Create compressed backup (exclude large/unnecessary files)
echo "üì¶ Creating backup archive..."
tar -czvf "${BACKUP_DIR}/${BACKUP_NAME}" \
    --exclude='*.log' \
    --exclude='node_modules' \
    --exclude='.git' \
    --exclude='media/*' \
    -C /home/ubuntu \
    .openclaw

# Get file size
SIZE=$(du -h "${BACKUP_DIR}/${BACKUP_NAME}" | cut -f1)
echo "üìä Backup size: ${SIZE}"

# Upload to Google Drive
echo "‚òÅÔ∏è Uploading to Google Drive..."
gog drive upload "${BACKUP_DIR}/${BACKUP_NAME}" --parent "${GDRIVE_FOLDER_ID}"

# Clean up local backup (keep only last 2 days locally - older ones are on Google Drive)
echo "üßπ Cleaning up local backups older than 2 days..."
find "$BACKUP_DIR" -name "alex-prime-backup-*.tar.gz" -mtime +2 -delete

echo "‚úÖ Backup complete: ${BACKUP_NAME} (${SIZE}) uploaded to Google Drive"
echo "üìÅ Folder: https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/${GDRIVE_FOLDER_ID}"

files.name: fix-oauth.sh
files.content:
#!/bin/bash
# Fix OAuth script for Kabundji
# Run this to refresh expired Google authentication

echo "=============================================="
echo "  OAuth Refresh Script"
echo "=============================================="
echo ""
echo "This will refresh authentication for john.melo.testing01@gmail.com"
echo ""

export GOG_KEYRING_PASSWORD="openclaw"

echo "Step 1: Removing expired credentials..."
gog auth remove john.melo.testing01@gmail.com --yes 2>/dev/null || true

echo ""
echo "Step 2: Adding fresh authentication..."
echo "You will be asked to authorize in browser. Choose:"
echo "  - Gmail, Calendar, Drive, Contacts, Docs, Sheets"
echo ""
gog auth add john.melo.testing01@gmail.com --services gmail,calendar,drive,contacts,docs,sheets

echo ""
echo "Step 3: Testing connection..."
gog gmail search '"newer_than:1d"' --max 1 --account john.melo.testing01@gmail.com

echo ""
echo "=============================================="
echo "  OAuth refresh complete!"
echo "=============================================="

Alex Prime Report Generator
Generates PDF reports from workspace files
"""

import os
import datetime

    from reportlab.platypus import SimpleDocTemplate, Paragraph, Spacer, Table, TableStyle
    from reportlab.lib import colors
    HAS_REPORTLAB = True
except ImportError:
    HAS_REPORTLAB = False

WORKSPACE = Path("/home/ubuntu/.openclaw/workspace")
REPORTS_DIR = WORKSPACE / "reports"

def read_todo():
    """Read TODO.md and parse it"""
    todo_path = WORKSPACE / "TODO.md"
    if todo_path.exists():
        return todo_path.read_text()
    return "No TODO.md found"

‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ

‚ö†Ô∏è  WhatsApp Outbound: BLOCKED (same number)
‚ö†Ô∏è  Web Search: NEEDS API KEY

‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ‚îÅ

Report generated by Alex Prime
Your Executive Director Agent üéØ

"""
    return report

def main():
    """Main function"""
    now = datetime.datetime.now(datetime.timezone.utc)
    date_str = now.strftime("%Y-%m-%d")
    
    # Create reports directory
    report_dir = REPORTS_DIR / date_str
    report_dir.mkdir(parents=True, exist_ok=True)
    
    # Generate text report
    report_text = generate_text_report()
    
    # Save as text
    txt_path = report_dir / "ALEX_PRIME_STATUS.txt"
    txt_path.write_text(report_text)
    print(f"‚úÖ Text report saved: {txt_path}")
    
    # Try to generate PDF if reportlab available
    if HAS_REPORTLAB:
        pdf_path = report_dir / "ALEX_PRIME_STATUS.pdf"
        doc = SimpleDocTemplate(str(pdf_path), pagesize=A4)
        styles = getSampleStyleSheet()
        story = []
        
        # Title
        title_style = ParagraphStyle(
            'Title',
            parent=styles['Heading1'],
            fontSize=24,
            spaceAfter=30,
            alignment=1  # Center
        )
        story.append(Paragraph("ALEX PRIME STATUS REPORT", title_style))
        story.append(Paragraph(f"{date_str}", styles['Normal']))
        story.append(Spacer(1, 20))
        
        # Content (simplified for PDF)
        for line in report_text.split('\n'):
            if line.strip():
                story.append(Paragraph(line, styles['Normal']))
            else:
                story.append(Spacer(1, 10))
        
        doc.build(story)
        print(f"‚úÖ PDF report saved: {pdf_path}")
    else:
        print("‚ÑπÔ∏è  reportlab not installed - PDF generation skipped")
        print("   Install with: pip install reportlab")
    
    return report_text

if __name__ == "__main__":
    main()
