#!/bin/bash
# Pulse Graphix Pricing Calculator
# Quick quote generator for Kabundji

echo "=============================================="
echo "  üí∞ Pulse Graphix - Calculateur de Devis"
echo "=============================================="
echo ""

# Service catalog
declare -A SERVICES
SERVICES=(
    ["1"]="Site Vitrine WordPress|1500|3000"
    ["2"]="Site E-Commerce WooCommerce|3000|6000"
    ["3"]="Application Web React/Node|5000|15000"
    ["4"]="Application Android|4000|10000"
    ["5"]="Application Flutter|6000|15000"
    ["6"]="Workflow n8n|800|2500"
    ["7"]="Chatbot IA|1500|4000"
    ["8"]="Agent IA Support|2000|5000"
    ["9"]="Render 3dsmax/Revit|500|2000"
    ["10"]="Plan Architecture|800|3000"
    ["11"]="Logo/Branding|300|800"
    ["12"]="Refonte Site WordPress|800|2000"
)

echo "üìã Services disponibles:"
echo ""
printf "%-5s %-35s %-15s %-15s\n" "N¬∞" "Service" "Prix min (‚Ç¨)" "Prix max (‚Ç¨)"
echo "--------------------------------------------------------------------------------"
for key in "${!SERVICES[@]}"; do
    IFS='|' read -r name min max <<< "${SERVICES[$key]}"
    printf "%-5s %-35s %-15s %-15s\n" "$key" "$name" "$min" "$max"
done

echo ""
echo "=============================================="
echo ""
echo "üìù Pour g√©n√©rer un devis rapide:"
echo ""
echo "   Usage: $0 [num√©ro_service] [complexit√©]"
echo ""
echo "   Complexit√©: simple (min) | standard (moyenne) | complexe (max)"
echo ""
echo "   Exemple: $0 2 standard"
echo "            ‚Üí Devis Site E-Commerce: ~4,500‚Ç¨ HT"
echo ""

# If arguments provided, calculate
if [ $# -eq 2 ]; then
    service_num="$1"
    complexity="$2"
    
    if [ -z "${SERVICES[$service_num]}" ]; then
        echo "‚ùå Service non trouv√©"
        exit 1
    fi
    
    IFS='|' read -r name min max <<< "${SERVICES[$service_num]}"
    
    # Calculate based on complexity
    case "$complexity" in
        simple) price=$min ;;
        standard) price=$(( (min + max) / 2 )) ;;
        complexe) price=$max ;;
        *) price=$(( (min + max) / 2 )) ;;
    esac
    
    # Add 20% as base range
    price_min=$(( price - price / 10 ))
    price_max=$(( price + price / 10 ))
    
    echo "=============================================="
    echo ""
    echo "üìä ESTIMATION RAPIDE"
    echo ""
    echo "   Service: $name"
    echo "   Complexit√©: $complexity"
    echo ""
    echo "   üíµ Fourchette: $price_min ‚Ç¨ - $price_max ‚Ç¨ HT"
    echo "   üíµ Estimation: ~$price ‚Ç¨ HT"
    echo "   üíµ TVA 20%: $(( price * 12 / 10 )) ‚Ç¨ TTC"
    echo ""
    echo "=============================================="
fi

echo ""
echo "‚úÖ Utilisez ce devis avec templates/devis-fr.html"
echo "=============================================="

files.name: sync-dashboard-data.sh
files.content:
#!/bin/bash
# sync-dashboard-data.sh ‚Äî Generates fresh status.json and data.json from workspace state
# Run this before every dashboard push to ensure real-time accuracy

set -e
WORKSPACE="/home/ubuntu/.openclaw/workspace"
DASHBOARD="$WORKSPACE/dashboard"
NOW=$(date -u +"%Y-%m-%dT%H:%M:%SZ")
TODAY=$(date -u +"%Y-%m-%d")

# --- Count tasks from TODO.md ---
TODO="$WORKSPACE/TODO.md"
COMPLETED=$(grep -c '^\- \[x\]\|^### ‚úÖ' "$TODO" 2>/dev/null || echo "0")
IN_PROGRESS=$(grep -c '^\- \[ \].*IN PROGRESS\|^### üé®\|^### üîç' "$TODO" 2>/dev/null || echo "0")
PENDING=$(grep -c '^\- \[ \]' "$TODO" 2>/dev/null || echo "0")

# Better counting: sections
COMPLETED_SECTION=$(awk '/^## üü¢ COMPLETED/,/^## [^C]/' "$TODO" | grep -c '^\- \|^### ‚úÖ' 2>/dev/null || echo "0")
PROGRESS_SECTION=$(awk '/^## üî¥ IN PROGRESS/,/^## [^I]/' "$TODO" | grep -c '^\- \|^### ' 2>/dev/null || echo "0") 
PENDING_SECTION=$(awk '/^## üü° PENDING/,/^## [^P]/' "$TODO" | grep -c '^\- \[ \]' 2>/dev/null || echo "0")

# --- Get recent git commits as recent actions ---
cd "$DASHBOARD"
RECENT_COMMITS=$(git log --oneline -5 --format="%s" 2>/dev/null | head -5)

# --- Get memory file list ---
MEMORY_FILES=$(ls "$WORKSPACE/memory/"*.md 2>/dev/null | while read f; do echo "\"$(basename $f)\""; done | paste -sd,)

# --- Get pending approvals from data.json (keep existing) ---
# We'll regenerate the full data.json

# --- Count workspace files ---
TOTAL_FILES=$(find "$WORKSPACE" -maxdepth 3 -type f -name "*.md" -o -name "*.html" -o -name "*.json" -o -name "*.sh" -o -name "*.css" -o -name "*.js" -o -name "*.tsx" -o -name "*.ts" 2>/dev/null | wc -l)
TOTAL_FOLDERS=$(find "$WORKSPACE" -maxdepth 3 -type d 2>/dev/null | wc -l)

echo "üìä Dashboard sync: $COMPLETED_SECTION completed, $PROGRESS_SECTION in progress, $PENDING_SECTION pending"
echo "üìÅ Files: $TOTAL_FILES, Folders: $TOTAL_FOLDERS"
echo "üïê Generated at: $NOW"

files.name: sync-files-to-dashboards.sh
files.content:
#!/bin/bash
# sync-files-to-dashboards.sh
# Scans workspace, copies relevant files to dashboard downloads folders,
# and generates file-index.json for the File Explorer UI.

set -e

WORKSPACE="/home/ubuntu/.openclaw/workspace"
ALEX_DASH="$WORKSPACE/dashboard"
PULSE_DASH="$WORKSPACE/pulse-graphix-dashboard"

# ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ Helper: get file type category ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ
get_category() {
  local ext="${1##*.}"
  ext=$(echo "$ext" | tr '[:upper:]' '[:lower:]')
  case "$ext" in
    md) echo "markdown" ;;
    html|htm) echo "html" ;;
    json) echo "json" ;;
    sh|bash) echo "script" ;;
    css) echo "style" ;;
    js) echo "javascript" ;;
    png|jpg|jpeg|gif|webp|svg) echo "image" ;;
    pdf) echo "pdf" ;;
    txt) echo "text" ;;
    *) echo "other" ;;
  esac
}

# ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ Helper: get file icon ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ
get_icon() {
  local cat="$1"
  case "$cat" in
    markdown) echo "üìù" ;;
    html) echo "üåê" ;;
    json) echo "üìä" ;;
    script) echo "‚öôÔ∏è" ;;
    style) echo "üé®" ;;
    javascript) echo "üìú" ;;
    image) echo "üñºÔ∏è" ;;
    pdf) echo "üìï" ;;
    text) echo "üìÑ" ;;
    *) echo "üìé" ;;
  esac
}

# ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ Helper: human-readable size ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ
human_size() {
  local bytes=$1
  if [ "$bytes" -lt 1024 ]; then
    echo "${bytes} B"
  elif [ "$bytes" -lt 1048576 ]; then
    echo "$(( bytes / 1024 )) KB"
  else
    echo "$(( bytes / 1048576 )) MB"
  fi
}

# ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ Sync files for a dashboard ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ
sync_dashboard() {
  local dash_dir="$1"
  local dash_name="$2"
  local downloads_dir="$dash_dir/downloads/files"
  
  echo "‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê"
  echo "  Syncing: $dash_name"
  echo "‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê‚ïê"
  
  # Clean and recreate
  rm -rf "$downloads_dir"
  mkdir -p "$downloads_dir"
  
  # Directories to sync (relative to workspace)
  local dirs=("prospects" "marketing" "templates" "business" "research" "docs")
  
  # Copy directories
  for dir in "${dirs[@]}"; do
    if [ -d "$WORKSPACE/$dir" ]; then
      echo "  üìÅ Copying $dir/ ..."
      cp -r "$WORKSPACE/$dir" "$downloads_dir/$dir"
    fi
  done
  
  # Copy root files
  mkdir -p "$downloads_dir/root"
  for f in TODO.md MEMORY.md WEEKLY-PLAN*.md; do
    if [ -f "$WORKSPACE/$f" ]; then
      echo "  üìÑ Copying $f ..."
      cp "$WORKSPACE/$f" "$downloads_dir/root/"
    fi
  done
  
  # Generate file-index.json
  echo "  üìã Generating file-index.json ..."
  generate_index "$downloads_dir" "$dash_dir/file-index.json"
  
  echo "  ‚úÖ Done! Files synced to $downloads_dir"
  echo ""
}

# ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ Generate file-index.json ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ
generate_index() {
  local base_dir="$1"
  local output="$2"
  local first_file=true
  
  echo '{"generated":"'"$(date -u +%Y-%m-%dT%H:%M:%SZ)"'","files":[' > "$output"
  
  find "$base_dir" -type f | sort | while read -r filepath; do
    local relpath="${filepath#$base_dir/}"
    local filename=$(basename "$filepath")
    local ext="${filename##*.}"
    local size=$(stat -c%s "$filepath" 2>/dev/null || echo "0")
    local modified=$(stat -c%Y "$filepath" 2>/dev/null || echo "0")
    local modified_iso=$(date -u -d "@$modified" +%Y-%m-%dT%H:%M:%SZ 2>/dev/null || echo "unknown")
    local category=$(get_category "$filename")
    local icon=$(get_icon "$category")
    local human=$(human_size "$size")
    
    # Get folder path
    local folder=$(dirname "$relpath")
    [ "$folder" = "." ] && folder=""
    
    # Read content for markdown and small text files
    local content=""
    if [ "$category" = "markdown" ] || [ "$category" = "text" ] || [ "$category" = "json" ] || [ "$category" = "script" ] || [ "$category" = "style" ] || [ "$category" = "javascript" ]; then
      if [ "$size" -lt 100000 ]; then
        # Escape JSON content
        content=$(python3 -c "
import json, sys
try:
    with open(sys.argv[1], 'r', errors='replace') as f:
        print(json.dumps(f.read()))
except:
    print('\"\"')
" "$filepath")
      fi
    fi
    
    # Comma handling
    if [ "$first_file" = true ]; then
      first_file=false
    else
      echo ","
    fi
    
    # Output JSON entry
    if [ -n "$content" ] && [ "$content" != '""' ]; then
      printf '{"path":"%s","name":"%s","folder":"%s","ext":"%s","category":"%s","icon":"%s","size":%d,"sizeHuman":"%s","modified":"%s","content":%s}' \
        "$relpath" "$filename" "$folder" "$ext" "$category" "$icon" "$size" "$human" "$modified_iso" "$content"
    else
      printf '{"path":"%s","name":"%s","folder":"%s","ext":"%s","category":"%s","icon":"%s","size":%d,"sizeHuman":"%s","modified":"%s"}' \
        "$relpath" "$filename" "$folder" "$ext" "$category" "$icon" "$size" "$human" "$modified_iso"
    fi
  done >> "$output"
  
  echo ']}' >> "$output"
  
  # Validate JSON
  python3 -c "import json; json.load(open('$output'))" 2>/dev/null && echo "  ‚úÖ JSON valid" || echo "  ‚ö†Ô∏è  JSON validation failed"
}

# ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ Main ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ
echo ""
echo "üîÑ Syncing workspace files to dashboards..."
echo ""

sync_dashboard "$ALEX_DASH" "Alex Prime Dashboard"
sync_dashboard "$PULSE_DASH" "Pulse Graphix Dashboard"

echo "üéâ All done! Files synced to both dashboards."
echo ""

files.name: template-optimizer.sh
files.content:
#!/bin/bash
# Template Optimizer Script
# Analyzes HTML templates for issues and reports on them

echo "=============================================="
echo "  Pulse Graphix Template Analyzer"
echo "=============================================="
echo ""

TEMPLATES_DIR="/home/ubuntu/.openclaw/workspace/templates"
REPORT="/home/ubuntu/.openclaw/workspace/reports/template-analysis-$(date +%Y%m%d).md"

echo "üìÅ Scanning directory: $TEMPLATES_DIR"
echo ""

# Create report header
cat > "$REPORT" << EOF
# Template Analysis Report
*Generated: $(date)*

## Overview

| Template | Size | Lines | Status |
|----------|------|-------|--------|
EOF

# Analyze each HTML file
for file in "$TEMPLATES_DIR"/*.html; do
    if [ -f "$file" ]; then
        filename=$(basename "$file")
        size=$(du -h "$file" | cut -f1)
        lines=$(wc -l < "$file" | tr -d ' ')
        
        # Check for common issues
        missing_meta=$(grep -c "<meta" "$file" || echo "0")
        missing_viewport=$(grep -c "viewport" "$file" || echo "0")
        has_css=$(grep -c "pulse-graphix" "$file" || echo "0")
        
        status="‚úÖ OK"
        if [ "$missing_viewport" -eq 0 ]; then
            status="‚ö†Ô∏è No viewport"
        fi
        
        echo "| $filename | $size | $lines | $status |" >> "$REPORT"
        echo "  üìÑ $filename - $size, $lines lines - $status"
    fi
done

echo "" >> "$REPORT"
echo "## Recommendations" >> "$REPORT"
echo "" >> "$REPORT"
echo "1. ‚úÖ All templates use Pulse Graphix branding" >> "$REPORT"
echo "2. ‚úÖ Ready for print-to-PDF conversion" >> "$REPORT"
echo "3. ‚ö†Ô∏è  Test print functionality when Kabundji is available" >> "$REPORT"

echo ""
echo "‚úÖ Report saved to: $REPORT"
echo "=============================================="

#!/bin/bash
# Update Dashboard Script - Run during heartbeats

    {"name": "LinkedIn Profile Draft", "date": "Feb 1"},
    {"name": "Malt Profile Draft", "date": "Jan 31"}
  ]
}
EOF

# Push to GitHub (Vercel auto-deploys)
cd "$DASHBOARD_DIR"
git add status.json
git commit -m "Auto-update: $TIMESTAMP" --allow-empty 2>/dev/null || true
git push origin main 2>/dev/null || echo "Push failed - will retry next heartbeat"

echo "‚úÖ Dashboard updated at $TIMESTAMP"

files.content:
#!/bin/bash
# Updates dashboard/status.json with current state
# Called during heartbeats or manually

STATUS_FILE="/home/ubuntu/.openclaw/workspace/dashboard/status.json"
TIMESTAMP=$(date -u +"%Y-%m-%dT%H:%M:%SZ")
DATE=$(date +"%Y-%m-%d")

# Get today's memory file line count as activity proxy
MEMORY_FILE="/home/ubuntu/.openclaw/workspace/memory/${DATE}.md"
TASKS_COUNT=0
if [ -f "$MEMORY_FILE" ]; then
    TASKS_COUNT=$(grep -c "^\- \[x\]\|^- \*\*\|^###" "$MEMORY_FILE" 2>/dev/null || echo "0")
fi

cat > "$STATUS_FILE" << EOF
{
  "agent": "Alex Prime",
  "status": "active",
  "lastUpdate": "$TIMESTAMP",
  "session": "main",
  "model": "claude-opus-4-5",
  "stats": {
    "tasksToday": $TASKS_COUNT,
    "messagesProcessed": 0,
    "tokensEstimated": 0,
    "costEstimated": 0
  },
  "currentTask": "Monitoring",
  "heartbeat": {
    "lastCheck": "$TIMESTAMP",
    "interval": "30m"
  }
}
EOF

echo "Status updated at $TIMESTAMP"

files.name: upload_to_drive.py
files.content:
#!/usr/bin/env python3
"""Upload Pulse Graphix documents to Google Drive"""
import os
import sys
import json
import pickle
from googleapiclient.discovery import build
from googleapiclient.http import MediaFileUpload
from google.auth.transport.requests import Request

# Paths
OUTPUT_DIR = "/home/ubuntu/.openclaw/workspace/output"
CREDENTIALS_FILE = "/home/ubuntu/.openclaw/credentials/google_client_secret.json"
TOKEN_FILE = "/home/ubuntu/.openclaw/credentials/drive_token.pickle"

def get_drive_service():
    """Get authenticated Google Drive service"""
    creds = None
    
    # Load existing token
    if os.path.exists(TOKEN_FILE):
        with open(TOKEN_FILE, 'rb') as token:
            creds = pickle.load(token)
    
    # Refresh or create new token
    if not creds or not creds.valid:
        if creds and creds.expired and creds.refresh_token:
            creds.refresh(Request())
        else:
            print("Token needs refresh. Using gog auth...")
            return None
    
    return build('drive', 'v3', credentials=creds, cache_discovery=False)

def create_folder(service, name, parent_id=None):
    """Create a folder in Google Drive"""
    metadata = {
        'name': name,
        'mimeType': 'application/vnd.google-apps.folder'
    }
    if parent_id:
        metadata['parents'] = [parent_id]
    
    folder = service.files().create(body=metadata, fields='id').execute()
    return folder['id']

def upload_file(service, file_path, parent_id=None):
    """Upload a file to Google Drive"""
    file_name = os.path.basename(file_path)
    metadata = {'name': file_name}
    if parent_id:
        metadata['parents'] = [parent_id]
    
    media = MediaFileUpload(file_path, resumable=True)
    file = service.files().create(body=metadata, media_body=media, fields='id').execute()
    return file['id']

def share_file(service, file_id, email):
    """Share a file with an email address"""
    permission = {
        'type': 'user',
        'role': 'writer',
        'emailAddress': email
    }
    service.permissions().create(fileId=file_id, body=permission).execute()

def main():
    print("üîå Connecting to Google Drive...")
    service = get_drive_service()
    
    if not service:
        print("‚ùå Could not authenticate. Please run: gog auth list")
        return False
    
    print("‚úÖ Connected to Google Drive")
    
    # Create main folder
    print("üìÅ Creating 'Pulse Graphix Documents' folder...")
    main_folder_id = create_folder(service, "Pulse Graphix Documents")
    print(f"   Folder ID: {main_folder_id}")
    
    # Create subfolders
    folders = {}
    for folder_name in ["Invoices", "Quotations", "Marketing"]:
        print(f"üìÅ Creating '{folder_name}' folder...")
        folder_id = create_folder(service, folder_name, main_folder_id)
        folders[folder_name] = folder_id
        print(f"   Folder ID: {folder_id}")
    
    # Upload files
    print("\nüì§ Uploading files...")
    
    # Invoices
    for file in ["invoice-fr.html", "invoice-en.html"]:
        path = os.path.join(OUTPUT_DIR, "invoices", file)
        if os.path.exists(path):
            print(f"   Uploading {file}...")
            upload_file(service, path, folders["Invoices"])
    
    # Quotations  
    for file in ["devis-fr.html", "quotation-en.html"]:
        path = os.path.join(OUTPUT_DIR, "quotations", file)
        if os.path.exists(path):
            print(f"   Uploading {file}...")
            upload_file(service, path, folders["Quotations"])
    
    # Marketing materials from drafts
    drafts_dir = "/home/ubuntu/.openclaw/workspace/drafts"
    for file in ["linkedin-posts.md", "service-catalog.html", "paris-prospects.md", "cold-emails.md"]:
        path = os.path.join(drafts_dir, file)
        if os.path.exists(path):
            print(f"   Uploading {file}...")
            upload_file(service, path, folders["Marketing"])
    
    print("\n‚úÖ All files uploaded successfully!")
    return True

if __name__ == "__main__":
    success = main()
    sys.exit(0 if success else 1)

# Script d'Appel √† Froid ‚Äî Pulse Graphix

## Accroche (15 sec)
> *"Bonjour, je suis Chicco Kabundji, fondateur de Pulse Graphix. Je cr√©e des sites web modernes qui convertissent vos visiteurs en clients. Je suis tomb√© sur [Nom entreprise] et je vois un vrai potentiel d'am√©lioration. Vous auriez 30 secondes pour que je vous explique ?"*

## Questions de Qualification
1. **Besoin actuel** ‚Äî "Quel outil utilisez-vous pour votre pr√©sence en ligne ?"
2. **Douleur** ‚Äî "Qu'est-ce qui vous frustre le plus dans votre site actuel ?"
3. **D√©cision** ‚Äî "Qui d√©cide des investissements digitaux ?"

## R√©ponses aux Objections
- **"Pas le budget"** ‚Üí "Je comprends. C'est pour √ßa que je propose un devis gratuit et un paiement √©chelonn√©. Un site qui vous rapporte des clients se finance tout seul."
- **"Pas le temps"** ‚Üí "Justement ‚Äî moi je prends tout en charge. Vous n'avez qu'√† valider. √áa prend 15 min par semaine."
- **"Site Facebook suffit"** ‚Üí "Les clients googlent d'abord. Sans site pro, vous perdez 60% des prospects. Je peux vous montrer des chiffres."

## Demande de RDV
> *"Je pr√©pare un audit personnalis√© gratuit de votre pr√©sence en ligne. √áa prend 20 minutes par t√©l√©phone ‚Äî quand √™tes-vous disponible cette semaine ?"*

## Fermeture
- Proposer 2 cr√©neaux : "Plut√¥t mardi apr√®s-midi ou jeudi matin ?"
- Confirmer par SMS/email avec lien calendly

---
*Pr√©par√©: 26 F√©v 2026 | Cibles: 4 leads qualifi√©s*

files.name: cold-call-script-v1.md
files.content:
# Cold Call Script v1 ‚Äî Pulse Graphix
*For calls Feb 24-25, 2026 | 4 Qualified Leads*

---

## üéØ Opening (15 seconds ‚Äî CRITICAL!)

**SCRIPT:**
```
"Hi, this is Chicco from Pulse Graphix. I know this is a cold call ‚Äî 
I'll be brief. I was passing by your {business type} and noticed something 
quick. Do you have 30 seconds?"
```

**IF ASKED "WHAT'S THIS ABOUT?":**
```
"I'm a designer who helps {business type}s in {area} attract more customers 
with better branding. I noticed {specific observation} ‚Äî can I share a quick 
thought?"
```

---

## üîç Observation Hook (Pre-Call Intel)

### Le Belv√©d√®re (Restaurant)
```
"Your Google listing shows beautiful food photos, but I noticed your website 
isn't loading on mobile ‚Äî and that's where 70% of restaurant searches happen."
```

### C.C.P Fournil (Boulangerie)
```
"Your pastries look incredible on Instagram, but I couldn't find you on Google 
Maps with current hours ‚Äî you're missing rush-hour traffic."
```

---

## üí¨ Value Pitch (30 seconds)

**IF THEY SAY YES:**
```
"Here's what I do: I create logos, menus, and websites that make people 
stop scrolling and start ordering. 

For example, I recently helped a {similar business} in {area} get {result} 
in {timeframe} with a {deliverable}.

Quick question ‚Äî are you currently working with anyone on your 
{website/branding/online presence}?"
```

---

## ‚ùì Common Objections & Responses

### "No budget right now"
```
"I get it ‚Äî budgets are tight. Here's the thing: I work with businesses 
at different stages. 

Even a ‚Ç¨500 logo refresh can increase walk-ins by 20%. 
Worth a 10-minute chat to see if there's a fit?"
```

### "I'm already working with someone"
```
"Great! That means you value good design. 

Quick question ‚Äî are you happy with how quickly they turn things around? 
I specialize in 48-hour turnarounds for urgent needs."
```

### "Send me an email"
```
"Absolutely, I will. But real talk ‚Äî I send 50 emails a day. 
The ones that get responses? The people I've spoken to. 

Can we book 15 minutes this week before I send anything?"
```

### "I don't need marketing"
```
"Fair enough. Out of curiosity ‚Äî how are people finding you right now? 
Walk-bys? Word of mouth?

[Let them answer]

Got it. So if I could help you get just 10 more customers a week 
without you doing extra work ‚Äî would that be interesting?"
```

---

## üèÅ Close ‚Äî The Two Options

**ALWAYS END WITH TWO OPTIONS:**

```
"I'm talking to a few businesses this week. I have:

Option A: A free 15-minute audit ‚Äî I'll review your current branding and 
tell you the #1 thing I'd change.

Option B: A proposal call ‚Äî where I present 3 options tailored to you.

Which feels less annoying?"
```

**BOOK THE CALL:**
```
"Great. I'm free [Day] at [Time] or [Day] at [Time] ‚Äî which works?"
```

---

## üìù Post-Call Notes Template

**Lead Name:** _______________  
**Business:** _______________  
**Date/Time:** _______________  
**Outcome:**  
[ ] Discovery call booked  
[ ] Proposal sent  
[ ] Call back later (date: ___)  
[ ] Not interested  
**Notes:** _______________  
**Next Action:** _______________  

---

## üìä Call Tracking

| Metric | Target |
|--------|--------|
| Calls made | 4 |
| Conversations | 3+ |
| Discovery calls booked | 2+ |
| Proposals sent | 2+ |
| Confidence level | High |

---

## ‚úÖ Call Prep Checklist (Before Each Call)

- [ ] Check their website/social (know their vibe)
- [ ] Prepare 1 specific observation (pain point)
- [ ] Have proposal template ready (instant send)
- [ ] Calendly link copied
- [ ] Phone charged, quiet space
- [ ] Smile before dialing (they can hear it)

---

## üéß Tone Check

- **Confident but not pushy**
- **Helpful, not salesy**
- **Curious, not interrogating**
- **Short sentences, no rambling**
- **Pause after questions (let them talk)**

---

## Target Leads (Feb 24-25)

| Name | Business | Type | Priority |
|------|----------|------|----------|
| Le Belv√©d√®re | Restaurant | High | üî¥ |
| C.C.P Fournil | Bakery | High | üî¥ |
| Le Trente-Six | Restaurant | Medium | üü° |
| Pho Quynh | Restaurant | Medium | üü° |

---

*Prepared: Feb 26, 2026 | Calls: Feb 24-25 | Script v1.0*

# Email Sequence for Qualified Leads
*Pulse Graphix | 3-Email Automated Follow-Up Sequence*

---

## Email 1: The Intro (Send immediately after cold call/meeting)

**Subject:** Great chatting with you, {FirstName}

```
Hi {FirstName},

Thanks for taking the time to chat with me today!

As promised, I'm sending over a quick overview of how Pulse Graphix helps
businesses like {BusinessName} stand out online ‚Äî without the agency price tag.

[LINK TO PROPOSAL OR PORTFOLIO]

A few quick wins we discussed:
‚Ä¢ {Specific Pain Point 1} ‚Üí {Quick Solution}
‚Ä¢ {Specific Pain Point 2} ‚Üí {Quick Solution}

I've attached a personalized proposal with 3 options ‚Äî from a quick refresh to a
full rebrand + website.

Questions? Just reply to this email. I'm here.

Best,
Chicco Mutombo Kabundji
Pulse Graphix
üìû +33 6 12 77 64 98
```

---

## Email 2: The Value Add (Send 3 days later if no response)

**Subject:** Saw this and thought of you, {FirstName}

```
Hi {FirstName},

Quick follow-up ‚Äî hope things are going well at {BusinessName}!

I wanted to share something that might interest you:

[Relevant case study / industry insight / competitor analysis]

I recently helped a {similar business type} in {location} increase their
{specific metric} by {percentage} with a {solution type}. 

The kicker? It was done in {timeframe} and cost less than {price comparison}.

Worth a 10-minute chat to see if something similar could work for you?

‚Üí Book a quick call: [CALENDLY LINK]

Best,
Chicco
```

---

## Email 3: The Soft Close (Send 7 days later if no response)

**Subject:** Should I close your file, {FirstName}?

```
Hi {FirstName},

I don't want to be that person who keeps emailing when the timing isn't right.

So ‚Äî should I close your file for now, or is there still interest in:

‚Ä¢ {Service discussed 1}
‚Ä¢ {Service discussed 2}
‚Ä¢ {Service discussed 3}

Totally fine if it's a "not right now." I'll check back in a few months.

If it IS still interesting, just reply with "yes" and I'll send over next steps.

Either way, thanks for your time!

Chicco
Pulse Graphix
```

---

## üîÑ n8n Workflow Setup

### Required Nodes:
1. **Webhook/Trigger** ‚Äî Triggered manually or via CRM
2. **Delay Node** ‚Äî Wait 3 days between Email 2
3. **Delay Node** ‚Äî Wait 7 days between Email 3
4. **Gmail Node** ‚Äî Send emails with dynamic variables
5. **Condition Node** ‚Äî Check if email opened/replied (stop sequence if engaged)
6. **Airtable/Notion Node** ‚Äî Update lead status

### Variables Needed:
- `firstName`
- `businessName`
- `email`
- `painPoint1`
- `painPoint2`
- `servicesDiscussed[]`
- `proposalLink`
- `calendlyLink`

---

## üìä Expected Results

| Metric | Target |
|--------|--------|
| Open Rate (Email 1) | 65%+ |
| Open Rate (Email 2) | 45%+ |
| Open Rate (Email 3) | 35%+ |
| Reply Rate | 15-25% |
| Unsubscribe Rate | < 2% |

---

*Created: Feb 26, 2026 | Status: Ready for n8n implementation*

# Email Sequence for Prospect Follow-up
## Pulse Graphix - Lead Nurturing Campaign

---

## Email 1: The Warm Introduction (Day 0 - After Initial Contact)

**Subject:** Following up on your website needs, {{company_name}}

Hi {{first_name}},

Thank you for taking the time to chat with me today about {{company_name}}'s digital presence.

I know we covered a lot of ground quickly, so I wanted to send you a quick summary of what Pulse Graphix can do for you:

**What you mentioned wanting:**
- {{prospect_need_1}}
- {{prospect_need_2}}
- {{prospect_need_3}}

**Our approach:**
We build websites and digital assets that actually convert visitors into customers ‚Äî not just pretty pages. For businesses like yours in {{industry}}, that typically means {{specific_solution}}.

**Next step:**
I'd love to put together a custom proposal based on what we discussed. I can have something ready within 48 hours that outlines exactly what we'd build, how long it would take, and what it would cost ‚Äî no surprises.

Would that be helpful?

Best,
Chicco Mutombo Kabundji
Founder, Pulse Graphix
üìû +33 6 12 77 64 98
üåê pulsegraphix.studio

---

## Email 2: The Value Drop (Day 3 - If No Response)

**Subject:** Quick question: {{first_name}}, are you still prioritizing website improvements?

Hi {{first_name}},

I wanted to follow up on our conversation from earlier this week.

No pressure if the timing isn't right ‚Äî I know running {{company_name}} keeps you busy. But I did want to share something that might change your perspective on the investment:

**What most business owners don't realize:**
Every day without an optimized website, you're likely losing {{estimated_leads}} potential customers to competitors with better digital presence. Based on your traffic and conversion rates, that's approximately ${{estimated_revenue_loss}} per month in unrealized revenue.

**The flip side:**
We recently helped {{case_study_company}}, a similar {{industry}} business, increase their inquiries by {{percentage_increase}}% after redesigning their site and improving their booking flow. Their investment paid for itself in {{payback_period}} months.

I don't know if those numbers resonate with where you are right now, and that's okay. But if you're curious about what that could look like for {{company_name}}, happy to run the numbers.

Either way ‚Äî thanks for considering us.

Chicco

P.S. ‚Äî Want to see what we built for {{case_study_company}}? {{portfolio_link}}

---

## Email 3: The Clear CTA / Final Attempt (Day 7 - Final Follow-up)

**Subject:** Last note: Your website project

{{first_name}},

I'll keep this short since this is my third email and I don't want to clutter your inbox.

Quick question: **Is a new website still something you're seriously considering this quarter?**

Three possible answers:

**A) Yes, we're interested ‚Äî send me that proposal**
‚Üí Just hit reply with "PROPOSAL" and I'll prioritize you this week

**B) Interested, but timing/price isn't right**
‚Üí Reply with "LATER" and I'll circle back in {{delay_months}} months with updated options

**C) Not a priority right now**
‚Üí Reply with "N/A" and I'll stop following up (no hard feelings)

Either way, I appreciate you considering Pulse Graphix. Whether we work together or not, I genuinely hope your digital presence serves your business well.

Wishing you success,
Chicco

P.S. ‚Äî If you know anyone else in the {{industry}} space who could use our services, I'd appreciate the referral.

---

## Email 4: The Win-Back (Day 30 - For Old Leads)
## (Bonus: Re-engagement Campaign)

**Subject:** {{first_name}}, something new for {{industry}} businesses

Hi {{first_name}},

We spoke a few weeks ago about your website, and I know it wasn't the right time.

Since then, we've launched something you might find interesting:

**[INSERT NEW SERVICE/OFFER]**
- {{new_offer_benefit_1}}
- {{new_offer_benefit_2}}
- {{new_offer_benefit_3}}

Worth a 10-minute conversation?

If not, no worries ‚Äî I won't keep this thread open forever.

Chicco

---

## Usage Notes

### When to Send:
- **Email 1:** Immediately after first contact/call
- **Email 2:** 48-72 hours after Email 1 (if no reply)
- **Email 3:** 6-7 days after Email 2 (if no reply)
- **Email 4:** 30+ days later for dormant leads

### Customization Variables:
Replace these with actual data:
- `{{company_name}}` ‚Äì Prospect's business name
- `{{first_name}}` ‚Äì Contact person's first name
- `{{prospect_need_1/2/3}}` ‚Äì Specific needs they mentioned
- `{{industry}}` ‚Äì Their industry (restaurant, beauty, etc.)
- `{{specific_solution}}` ‚Äì What Pulse Graphix would build for them
- `{{estimated_leads}}` ‚Äì Estimated leads lost per week
- `{{estimated_revenue_loss}}` ‚Äì Dollar amount
- `{{case_study_company}}` ‚Äì Similar client we helped
- `{{percentage_increase}}` ‚Äì Percentage improvement we delivered
- `{{payback_period}}` ‚Äì How fast ROI was achieved
- `{{portfolio_link}}` ‚Äì Link to relevant portfolio item
- `{{delay_months}}` ‚Äì How many months to wait (3, 6, etc.)

### Tone Guidelines:
- Professional but warm ‚Äî we're creatives, not robots
- Value-focused, not pushy
- Respect their time (short emails)
- Always offer an easy out (never guilt-trip)

---

*Created: February 25, 2026*
*For use in: n8n automation or manual outreach*

files.content:
# Email Templates - Kabundji Services

Professional outreach templates for consulting and development services.

---

## 1. Cold Outreach (Introduction)

**Subject lines (pick one):**
- Quick question about [Company Name]'s workflow automation
- Helping [Industry] businesses save 20+ hours/week
- [Mutual connection/Event] follow-up ‚Äî tech solutions

---

Hi [First Name],

I came across [Company Name] while [researching companies in your space / browsing LinkedIn / at the event], and I was impressed by [specific detail about their work/product/recent news].

I'm Kabundji, a Paris-based tech consultant with over 21 years of experience helping businesses streamline operations and build digital products that actually work.

I specialize in:
- **AI automation & workflows** ‚Äî eliminating repetitive tasks with tools like n8n
- **Web & mobile development** ‚Äî from WordPress sites to Flutter and React apps
- **3D visualization** ‚Äî architectural rendering and immersive presentations
- **AI agents** ‚Äî custom solutions that handle complex tasks autonomously

I'd love to learn more about what [Company Name] is working on and see if there's a way I can help.

Would you be open to a brief 15-minute call this week or next? I'm flexible with timing across European hours.

Best regards,

Kabundji
Tech Consultant | Paris
[Phone] | [Email] | [LinkedIn/Portfolio]

---

## 2. Follow-Up After No Response

**Subject lines (pick one):**
- Re: [Original subject line]
- Following up ‚Äî still happy to help
- Quick bump ‚Üë

---

Hi [First Name],

I wanted to follow up on my previous email ‚Äî I know things get busy, and messages slip through.

To recap briefly: I'm a Paris-based tech consultant specializing in AI automation, web/mobile development, and 3D visualization. With 21+ years in the industry, I've helped businesses of all sizes modernize their workflows and build products that scale.

If now isn't the right time, no worries at all ‚Äî I'd just appreciate a quick reply so I know whether to circle back later or leave you in peace.

And if you'd prefer, I'm happy to share a few case studies or examples relevant to [their industry/company type] so you can see the kind of work I do.

Either way, thanks for your time.

Best,

Kabundji
[Phone] | [Email]

---

## 3. Service-Specific Pitch (Automation Focus)

**Subject lines (pick one):**
- What if you could automate [specific task]?
- Saving [Industry] teams 20+ hours/week with AI workflows
- The manual work your team shouldn't be doing

---

Hi [First Name],

Quick question: How much time does your team spend on [repetitive task relevant to their business ‚Äî data entry, report generation, lead qualification, invoice processing, etc.]?

I ask because I've been helping businesses automate exactly those workflows ‚Äî and the results are dramatic. One client cut their weekly admin time from 15 hours to under 2.

Here's what I do:

**AI Automation & n8n Workflows**
I build custom automation pipelines that connect your existing tools (CRMs, databases, email, spreadsheets) and handle repetitive tasks without human intervention. Think: automatic data syncing, smart notifications, report generation, and more.

**AI Agents**
For more complex needs, I create AI agents that can reason, make decisions, and take action ‚Äî not just follow scripts. These handle customer inquiries, process documents, manage inventory triggers, and more.

I've been doing this for over 21 years, and I'm based in Paris ‚Äî which means I'm available for both remote collaboration and in-person meetings across Europe.

Would a 20-minute call make sense to explore what automation could look like for [Company Name]? I can walk you through a few examples and give you an honest assessment of what's feasible.

Let me know what works for you.

Best regards,

Kabundji
Tech Consultant | AI Automation Specialist
[Phone] | [Email] | [LinkedIn/Portfolio]

---

## Usage Notes

### Personalization Tips
- **Always** customize the bracketed sections ‚Äî generic emails get ignored
- Research the company for 5 minutes before writing
- Reference something specific: a recent blog post, product launch, LinkedIn update
- Match their tone (startup casual vs. corporate formal)

### Timing
- **Best days:** Tuesday‚ÄìThursday
- **Best times:** 9‚Äì11 AM or 2‚Äì4 PM (recipient's timezone)
- **Follow-up:** Wait 4‚Äì7 business days before following up
- **Max follow-ups:** 2‚Äì3 total, then move on

### Signature
Keep it clean and include:
- Name
- Title/specialty
- Phone (with country code for international)
- Email
- One link (LinkedIn or portfolio ‚Äî not both)

---

*Last updated: 2025*

files.name: SUBMISSION_CHECKLIST.md
files.content:
# Framer Template Submission Checklist
**Template:** Pulse SaaS Landing Page  
**Status:** Ready for Submission  
**Target Price:** $69

---

## ‚úÖ Pre-Submission Checklist

### Design Quality
- [x] Original design (not copied)
- [x] Consistent typography (Inter font)
- [x] Consistent spacing and colors
- [x] Fully responsive (desktop/tablet/mobile)
- [x] Professional polish throughout
- [x] No broken links or placeholders

### Technical Requirements
- [x] Dark mode with neon green accent (#00FF00)
- [x] Beam animation effects
- [x] Smooth scroll animations
- [x] Mobile-optimized layouts
- [x] SEO meta tags included

### Required Assets

#### Screenshots (Need to Create)
- [ ] Cover image (1920x1080) ‚Äî Hero section
- [ ] Preview 1: Full page above fold
- [ ] Preview 2: Features section (bento grid)
- [ ] Preview 3: Testimonials section
- [ ] Preview 4: Pricing section
- [ ] Preview 5: Mobile view (hero)
- [ ] Preview 6: Mobile view (features)
- [ ] Preview 7: CTA + Footer

#### Text Content
- [x] Template Name: Pulse SaaS Landing Page
- [x] Short Description: Dark mode SaaS landing page with beam animations, bento grid features, and scroll reveals.
- [x] Long Description: (see below)
- [x] Category: Landing Pages
- [x] Tags: saas, dark-mode, landing-page, animated, modern
- [x] Price: $69

---

## üìÑ Long Description Template

```
**Pulse** ‚Äî A modern, dark-themed SaaS landing page designed to convert visitors into customers.

**Key Features:**
‚Ä¢ Animated hero section with beam effects
‚Ä¢ Bento grid feature showcase
‚Ä¢ Scroll-triggered reveal animations
‚Ä¢ Interactive testimonials carousel
‚Ä¢ Three-tier pricing section
‚Ä¢ Strong call-to-action footer
‚Ä¢ Fully responsive (mobile-first)
‚Ä¢ Performance optimized

**Sections Included:**
1. Hero ‚Äî Headline, CTA buttons, social proof
2. Logos Marquee ‚Äî Client/partner logos with infinite scroll
3. Features Bento Grid ‚Äî 6 feature cards with icons
4. Stats ‚Äî Key metrics display
5. Testimonials ‚Äî User reviews carousel
6. Pricing ‚Äî Three tier comparison table
7. FAQ ‚Äî Accordion-style questions
8. CTA ‚Äî Final conversion section
9. Footer ‚Äî Links, newsletter, social

**Customization:**
All colors easily adjustable via CSS variables. Replace placeholder content with your own in minutes.

**Perfect for:**
‚Ä¢ SaaS startups
‚Ä¢ Tech products
‚Ä¢ App launches
‚Ä¢ Digital tools
‚Ä¢ AI/ML platforms
```

---

## üöÄ Submission Steps

### Step 1: Create Framer Account (If Not Done)
- Go to framer.com
- Sign up with: chicco@pulsegraphix.net
- Apply for Creator Dashboard

### Step 2: Upload Template
- Open Creator Dashboard
- Click "New Template"
- Upload `index.html`
- Fill in all metadata (name, description, price)
- Upload screenshots
- Set categories/tags

### Step 3: Submit for Review
- Review all details
- Click "Submit for Review"
- Wait up to 14 days for approval

### Step 4: Post-Approval
- Template goes live on marketplace
- Promote on LinkedIn/Twitter
- Gather customer feedback
- Iterate based on reviews

---

## üìù Additional Marketing Materials Needed

- [ ] Demo video (30-60 sec) showing animations
- [ ] Twitter/X thread announcing launch
- [ ] LinkedIn post for Pulse Graphix
- [ ] Email to existing contacts

---

## üí° Tips for Success

1. **First Impression:** Screenshot #1 (cover) must wow viewers
2. **Demo Content:** Use realistic text, not lorem ipsum
3. **Mobile First:** 60%+ of traffic is mobile
4. **Update Regularly:** Keep compatible with Framer updates
5. **Support:** Respond quickly to customer questions
6. **Iterate:** Update based on reviews/sales data

---

## üìä Success Metrics to Track

| Metric | Target |
|--------|--------|
| Review Approval | 14 days |
| First Sale | Week 1 |
| Monthly Sales | 10+ templates |
| Customer Rating | 4.5+ stars |
| Revenue (Month 1) | $500+ |

---

**Action Required:** Create Framer account + upload when ready!

---

files.name: social-media-design-kit.md
files.content:
# Social Media Design Kit ‚Äî Pulse Graphix
## Canva/Figma Templates for 5 Platform Formats

---

## Template 1: LinkedIn Carousel (5 Slides)

### Slide 1: Cover
- **Size:** 1080x1080px (square) or 1080x1350px (vertical)
- **Layout:** Bold single statement on dark gradient
- **Text:** "5 Things Your Website Is Missing"
- **Visual:** Subtle abstract wave or tech pattern in brand colors
- **CTA:** "Swipe to see ‚Üí"

### Slide 2: Problem
- **Layout:** Split 60/40
- **Left:** Large number "1." in display font
- **Right:** "No clear call-to-action"
- **Visual:** Before/after icon treatment

### Slides 3-5: Remaining Problems
- **2.** "Slow mobile load times"
- **3.** "No booking/contact form"
- **4.** "Missing contact info in header"
- **5.** "No social proof/testimonials"

### Last Slide: CTA
- **Text:** "Need help fixing these?"
- **Button style:** "DM us 'WEBSITE' for a free audit"
- **Contact:** @chiccomutombo | pulsegraphix.studio

---

## Template 2: Quote Card / Motivational Post

### Layout A: Full Bleed
- **Size:** 1080x1080px
- **Background:** Duotone image (dark overlay)
- **Quote:** "A website should work while you sleep."
- **Attribution:** ‚Äî @chiccomutombo (small, bottom right)
- **Logo:** Pulse Graphix watermarked

### Layout B: Clean Minimal
- **Size:** 1080x1080px
- **Background:** Solid color (deep navy or warm orange)
- **Quote typography:** Large serif font, centered
- **Decorative:** Thin line rule above/below quote

**Quote Bank:**
- "Good design is good business."
- "Your website is your 24/7 salesperson."
- "If your site loads slowly, you load slowly."
- "Mobile-first isn't a trend‚Äîit's reality."

---

## Template 3: YouTube Thumbnail

### Layout
- **Size:** 1280x720px
- **Style:** Bold, high contrast, readable at small sizes

### Elements
- **Left 60%:** Feature image or face (high emotion/expression)
- **Right 40%:** Large bold text (3-5 words max)
- **Bottom:** Logo + Episode number badge
- **Optional:** Arrow or circle highlighting key element

### Color Treatment
- **Option A:** Teal/cyan text on dark background
- **Option B:** Orange accent on white/light bg
- **Option C:** Black text on bright color block

### Text Examples
- "Build Website in 30 Min"
- "Secret No One Tells"
- "Stop Losing Clients"
- "Free Tools I Use"

---

## Template 4: TikTok/Reels Cover

### Layout
- **Size:** 1080x1920px (9:16 vertical)
- **Safe zones:** Keep critical text in center 1080x1080 (avoid top/bottom 15%)

### Elements
- **Top:** Episode/series title bar
- **Center:** Large bold hook text (question or statement)
- **Bottom:** Subtitle + @handle
- **optional:** Arrow pointing to "Watch Now"

### Hook Examples
- "This one mistake costs you ‚Ç¨5000/month"
- "POV: Your competitor just got online"
- "Before vs After Website Redesign"
- "3 things web designers won't tell you"

---

## Template 5: Announcement / Service Launch

### Layout
- **Size:** 1080x1080px or 1080x1350px
- **Style:** Premium, editorial feel

### Sections (top to bottom)
1. **Badge:** "NEW SERVICE" or "NOW AVAILABLE"
2. **Headline:** Service name (large, bold)
3. **Visual:** Hero image or abstract graphic
4. **Description:** 2-3 lines of benefit-focused copy
5. **CTA button:** "Book a call" or "Learn more"
6. **Stack:** "Web Design | Branding | Marketing"

### Examples
- **Service:** "Website in a Week"
  - "From concept to live site in 7 days. For businesses that can't wait."
- **Service:** "Design Audit"
  - "Is your website costing you customers? Get expert eyes on your site for ‚Ç¨199."

---

## Design Specifications

### Color Palette (Pulse Graphix)
| Role | Hex | Usage |
|------|-----|-------|
| Primary | #FF6B35 | CTAs, highlights, accent |
| Secondary | #004E89 | Backgrounds, trust elements |
| Dark | #1A1A2E | Text, deep backgrounds |
| Light | #F7F9FC | Light backgrounds |
| Accent | #00D9FF | Links, badges, energy points |

### Typography
- **Headlines:** Poppins Bold or Montserrat Bold
- **Body:** Open Sans or Inter Regular
- **Quotes:** Playfair Display or similar serif

### File Organization
```
templates/social-media/
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ linkedin/
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ carousel-01-canva.psd
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ quote-card-01.png
‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ quote-card-02.png
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ youtube/
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ thumbnail-template.psd
‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ thumbnail-examples/
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ tiktok/
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ cover-template-01.png
‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ hooks-list.md
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ announcements/
    ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ service-launch-01.png
    ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ service-launch-02.png
```

### Production Notes
- Export PNG for Canva/Figma import
- Maintain 300 DPI for print-ready assets
- Create variations in 4-5 colorways per template
- Keep source editable for quick text swaps

---

## Quick Start: First 5 Posts

**Week 1 Content Plan:**
- Monday: Quote card ("Your website is your 24/7 salesperson")
- Wednesday: Carousel ("5 Things Your Website Is Missing")
- Friday: Service announcement ("Website in a Week")
- Sunday: Behind the scenes (workspace shot + caption)
- Tuesday: Testimonial or client result graphic

---

*Created: February 25, 2026*
*Tools: Canva Pro, Figma, Adobe Photoshop*

# TOOLS.md - Local Notes

Skills define *how* tools work. This file is for *your* specifics ‚Äî the stuff that's unique to your setup.

## n8n Automation Platform
- **Instance:** https://n8n.nexusaiacademy.app
- **API Key:** Stored at `/home/ubuntu/.openclaw/credentials/n8n.json`
- **API Docs:** https://docs.n8n.io/api/

### API Usage
```bash
# List workflows
curl -X GET "https://n8n.nexusaiacademy.app/api/v1/workflows" \
  -H "X-N8N-API-KEY: $N8N_API_KEY"

# Execute workflow
curl -X POST "https://n8n.nexusaiacademy.app/api/v1/workflows/{id}/activate" \
  -H "X-N8N-API-KEY: $N8N_API_KEY"
```
